Early Access Review
								I've played this game for a few days now, and wow! Such an immersive world. It is frigthening as all heck, it is intense as you won't belive, yet so addictive. There are still few issues with the game here and there, but the shear beauty of the game more than makes up for it. Now, lets list some pros and cons:Pros:1) Gorgeous scenery and good graphics2) Cool weapons3) 10/10 Audio is unbelievable. You will poo your pants the first time the screen shakes and you hear the t-rex stomping!4) Supports multiplayer and is extremely fun to play with friends5) The dinos looks so amazing6) Giant world to exploreCons:1) The dinosaurs can act a bit ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ at times, they don't really behave as you would expect2) If you crouch or lie still, the dinos will still find and kill you. There is no way to not die if spotted by one3) Messy inventory aka. no way to "mash" ammo together. It just takes up unnessecary space4) Camoflage does not really work as you would expectIf I had the chance to make any changes in the game as is, I would make the dinosaurs behavoiur a bit more "predictable" and realistic in terms of what you would expect to happen if you were either walking very quiet or lying perfectly still. It can be extremely annoying at times when you spot a dino 200 meters away, lie still, and somehow the thing still manages to track you down and eat you for lunch.All in all I really do recommend this game to pretty much any one.

number of helpful: 10 of 14 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
Early Access Review
								If you enjoyed TheHunter and wished you could have an opportunity to hunt dinosaurs with more of a suspense/horror feel to it- this may be the game your looking for. Its got five weapons as of this point in development- Bow, pistol, shotgun with slugs or buckshot, 308 rifle, and the .700 double rifle. Your prey are raptors, tricerotops, and Tyranosaurrus Rex. The game starts off very punishing as you discover alot of your movements only work to aid raptors and rexes to find you. But you get used to how everything works and soon your getting the first attacks in and eventually rounding up the troops and getting revenge on the rex that just ate you.Seeing a rex lower its head and widen its stance to get ready to charge is downright horrifying. The stomping around as it gets closer and eventually shakes the screen with screams puts you into the scenerio of being the prey for once. Raptors have calls that you will learn as well. They have different vocalisations for when they hear you, when they spot you, and even then they plan on lunging at you.There are some downers about the game though becuase its still early in development. It crashes alot still, often times at clutch moments right before a big takedown, or after you die, when you drop items, or during a trophy shot. Hosting a game requires you to open ports and thats annoying for many. I still find that this game is highly addicting and worth playing. I have no doubt in my mind that many of the issues will be ironed out before its formal release. I do love this game and I've been playing it non stop. I recommend this game whole-heartedly.

Early Access Review
								This game is amazing ,atmospheric , light and shade in its ambiance with pretty fluttering insect life,and there's the Dinosaurs !!PVE and PVP , yup you can kill other players , hunt em down and kill em!Yes a glitchy bug ridden experiance , but that said, your paying for early access and all that entails.it can be a very hard game if you dont follow certain principles , ie stealth ,camoflage, spotting ,staying away from the top of cliff faces =Phowever its made easier and more efficiant as you can team up in groups and hunt in a pack , or you may prefer to hunt solo , there's a quick learning curve in staying alive in playing solo.The guns are great , they look and sound awsome, sometimes echoing around the vast landscape , and it is VAST with teasing out of reach islands begging to be explored , there is no swim mechanic implemented as of yet , so there's a fair bit of speculation knocking around ,so thats healthy i'd guess?.I have played since its release , and the development team do inform the community and patch reasonably often,and there is an ingame option for feedback directly to them , This game / simulator if reached to the expectancy i personally think is deserved will be a legend amongst any hunting title.In my humble opinion its very far from complete and i cannot imagine it will be ready by release date.So if you want to treat yourself , BUY THIS !!Its scarey and beautiful massive and immersive.

number of helpful: 14 of 22 people (64%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 12, 2015
Early Access Review
								tldr; I'm recommending this game, but only if you're a fan of Avalanche Studio's other hunting sim, theHunter, and games with roguelike death mechanics, like DayZ or Dark Souls, and only if you'd like to support the development of the game. It's at a point that I would consider very early development.After only playing this game for a little over an hour, I can say it's extremely challenging in it's current form. If you're adverse to dying a lot early on in a game, then this isn't for you. Unlike in theHunter, everything in these hunting grounds is in reality hunting you, and it's your job to avoid them as best you can, at least until you can get a better weapon than the crappy bow you start with.When you first spawn, you're presented with the all too familiar tracking/GPS tool you use in theHunter. In this it's called the Settlersmate, the premise of the game being you're a convict, banished to an island on a planet called Primal Eden, and tasked with "cleaning up" the island of it's wild life. In front of you is what appears to be the pod you are dropped onto the planet in. It contains an improvised bow, 10 arrows and a map fragment. That's your starting kit, but don't expect to be taking down a lot with it. It does very little to most of the inhabitants of this paradise, other than to serve to♥♥♥♥♥♥them off. The map fragment uncovers a small, random portion of the map, which is mostly blanketed by a 'fog of war'.From then on, you're pretty much on your own to roam around the map. Keep a sharp eye on your Settlersmate, because there are supply crates that can contain ammunition, possibly weapons (although I've only ever found the starter bows), and occasionally new items of clothing scattered about, and a few POIs you can stumble across that usually have loot crates, and even a little bit of lore.If you're unlucky enough to come across any dino activity, it works pretty much the same as in theHunter. You get an audible queue from your Settlersmate and you can left click to analyze the sound or track marks.This game mixes the hunting simulation of theHunter with roguelike elements of games akin to DayZ (if the zombies were gaint eating machines that can run at 30mph). You die, you respawn in a random location on the map (which looks to be quite enormous), with the starter kit.Pros:Extremely large map (although right now seems mostly empty of POIs)Uses a proven game engine, so the graphics are decent for such a lite client.Uses theHunter's tracking system.Great audio queues.Cons:Dinosaur AI can be quite derpy. The first dino I encountered was a T-rex, and after circling a wooden structure to avoid it, it seemed to become stuck in stuck on it. Dinos also seem to have some kind of 6th sense, and almost always wander straight towards you when you get within a certain distance of them.The starter gear seems woefully inadequate. If you're very lucky, you can kill a utahraptor with 1 or 2 arrows, but the 2 to 3 other 'raptors in the pack will kill you, and forget about even denting a T-rex, I plugged 1 with about 30 arrows in the head, it was seriously a pin cushion, and it did little more than♥♥♥♥♥♥it off.I only encountered 2 dinosaur species. I've read there's only 3 in the game.Extreme levels of challenge makes this a game not everyone will like, but if you're a fan of Avalanche's other hunting sim, you might enjoy the reversal of roles.

Early Access Review
								Considering the price, this is the best game I've ever bought on Early Access. It's got a great living ecosystem, well-functioning cooperative and competitive play, and a massive world. My only complaint is the constant pauses in gameplay due to players losing connection to a server (like if their internet goes off, for example). These pauses last no longer than 13 seconds but still can be rather frustrating. The problem is easily solved though by making your own server and ensuring everyone has a stable ping.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2015
												I got this game in a Bundle thinking it would be a really good game to play with my friends, However the gameplay wasn't enough to keep my full attention. it wasn't very exciting to travel less than 20 feet only to be killed by 3 Utahraptors that was the first time i actually played it. right then and there I knew something was wrong with the mechanics of this game. a few things I really didn't like about this game. #1 there is no hip fire when trying to get away from anything you can only aim and fire you cannot move away or even try to escape anything attacking you while trying to fire at it. #2 when you have traveled across the map and you die the map goes blank again like you were never there, unless you can get back to where you died before dying again and again. #3 this is not a single player game it is but it's meant to be played in groups of people the only problem with this is when you play a single player game you travel and so do others and when you join a Multiplayer map people are all over the place you can't ever find them not even your friends. it's a mission just to find anyone on a server. #4 the graphics on this game don't impress me not many settings not many options. #5 and A.I themselves get stuck if one is chasing you and you go up a hill it will get stuck on a rock and stay there allowing you to kill it. it won't go around it wont try to get unstuck it will just stay in that place and keep running. #6 Carry weight you can only carry so much weight and when you have the .700 Double Barrel Rifle it takes up a lot of weight 25% i believe, even though they claim it's the most effective rifle to take down the T-rex finding ammo for this rifle is almost impossible trying to stay alive while finding it is also impossible. Ammo in general is easy to find keeping it is another thing how many shots does it take to kill a T-Rex? everything you shoot at you run out of ammo they charge you kill you with one hit and you start the game over again and again and this gets a little repeitive. I didn't read any of the reviews on this game because I wanted to play it for myself and do my own review.  this game has a lot of potential but it lacks a lot of things that will make it a great Multiplayer game. #7 the glitches are very annoying the crashes are as well, you can't save your progress to keep your map open or to find your way back to the pile of poop to get your Map fragments that the T-Rex pooped out When it ate you. I was hoping for a lot of great things in this game but I only found that the more I played it the more I hated it. #8 the weapons or lack of them. 11 different kinds of weapons but no Machine guns no throwing weapons no explosives no shoulder fired weapons So the very basic weapons to survive the Dinosaur world, if your alone and you fire at one most likely it will kill you. maybe the devs who made this game had godmode and unlimited ammo because I highly doubt they can survive 1 day without it. #9 when you split ammo you lose some of it somehow could be a glitch but it has happened since day 1 and it's annoying. this is one of those games that you should look at watch some video's of it but keep walking. i would have hated to play this game right out of early access and now it's been a while I can see the problems with the game when it was released are still going strong. #10 in a group of 8 people we decided to go through a dense forrest to get to 4 other players who were on the other side Well between us all we had a small Army of weapons none of us made it out because the Velociraptors killed everyone they move faster than you can aim at them they kill you even faster they jump on your face start sucking out your eyeballs and move onto the next hunter when your dead. they are easy to kill but you have to be able to hit them. the game settings keep changing during gameplay if you set your aim at a higher rate and your look at a higher look the first time you encounter anything the game changes your settings so you can't keep up with the movement of the Dinosaurs and that is another reason I hate this game. needing to go back into settings but wait you can't you can only do that before you start the game what a joke. no game settings while in game? 2 Thumbs down on this game. I think ill wait for about a year before playing this title again.

content:
Posted: May 15, 2016
												I also received this game in a bundle. I honestly think it was part of a bundlestars bundle.When i received it i rolled my eyes abit, as most of my bundles I get from friends after I pick them up a game or two we kinda buy games for one another to try as a group. I saw the reviews and they seemed absolutely attrocious.Fast forward to playing this game. Asides from your items not saving on your person when the server gets shut down. I really, like the suspense in this game. Sure it's got afew developement glitches and optimization issues that could probably be resolved. So here are some of my pro's and cons.Pro: -Tracker is awesome, as well as your ability to see tracks and the estimated time the tracks were made.-The suspense when hunting a T-Rex is incredible, they don't auto run to you. Instead they sniff you out if your laying down and they've caught your scent.-Raptors will attack you, but if you fight them off they will dip, for self preservation.-Dino's will hunt one another.Cons-Some A.I.'s will occassionally glitch out(story: after two-three hours i fired afew round into a raptor that wasn't moving... i unloaded into it afew more rounds... it didn't die. I walked up to it...nothing)-No graphics settings, what you see when you log in is what you get.-Server's are host-player based and rarely Server, server based.-Zero PVP.All around it's pretty fun. I certainly wouldn't buy it for full price inless improvement's are made. But if you see it on sale or pick it up on a bundle. Try this game. Alot of these reviews are just twelve yearolds spreading the usual internet cancer.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												As shown, this review was made April 2015.This is a game about hunting dinosaurs. Most of the negative reviews indicate how hard this game can be. Hunting dinosaur  shouldn't be easy.Just like hunting the real world, you need to make your shots at the game's vitals. If you try to headshot a Triceratops it not going to work. If you patiently sneak up to and make a heart/lung shot with a rifle, you'll likely one shot it.Some other reviews indicate how Quetzalcoatlus, a flying dinosaur are overpowered. The developer has since then made quite a few nerfs towards them. Also, if your good they are easy to oneshot with a shotgun.A few bugs are present, but game breaking ones aren't very common.The developer seems to be continuously updating the game, recently just added quite a few weapons into the game. It looks like the game is going a good direction.

content:
Posted: September 23, 2015
Introduction:theHunter is best hunting simulator on steam. And now you can be a hunter on a prehistoric island. What is better than running around in an island with friends hunting T-Rex's and other dinosaurs? This game is a great addition to theHunter series. Being theHunter but with new prey to hunt is great. This game is very well developed, and has quite an active player base with dedicated servers to join friends or other random players. Pros:You can hunt DINOSAURSBeautiful graphics and animationsGood net code for online gameplayProgress/gear can be server transferredGood weapon mechanicsVery large mapCons:Few guns or weapons to choose fromLimited clothes/gear selectionSome dinosaurs seem to take too much damageNo vehicles so get ready to walk/run a lotSometimes repetitive kills of the same typeNo progression system except leveling which doesn't directly give you anythingConclusion:If you enjoy theHunter, theHunter: Primal is great addition to your library. This gives the same great realistic hunting experience but with dinosaurs that chase you. Only if the overall item list was larger and more diverse prey this game would be perfect. If you're looking for a realistic hunting game with a touch of fantasy this a good choice.For more reviews check out  Original Curators Group

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								If your up for a challenge hunt, then load in by yourself. Its not hard finding the animals.....they will find you. It starts you with a bow and from there you can use it to protect yourself as you branch out to find weapon and supply crates. If you enjoy a difficult play style then this will keep you on the edge of your seat.If you have a few friends who also have this game, a lot of fun can be had. The only issue, is you always have one friend that can talk your group into the worst ideas.....such as all 6 of you trying to take down a t-rex with only bows. Can it be done? I dont know, most of us got ate and the survivors spent quite a bit of time crawling out of the area to regroup. It was a bad idea and we all knew it but it was alot of fun.The people who are reviewing this, saying its too hard, are not skilled players or they have no friends....or both. Just as you do in any hunting game, where you place your shots matter, go for the vital organs or spine. Just keep in mind that the animals your hunting in this game, are not going to get spooked and run away.As of the time I am writing this, I have 12.3 hrs logged and 0 t-rex kills. But I will continue to play and quote Jurassic Park one liners. When a t-rex is charging a buddy, its too hard not to be yelling over the mic, "Shoot Her, Shoot Her" or when a friend dies to one 5 min into the game you just gotta say, "The t-rex doesnt want to be fed, she wants to hunt" Buy the game and experience what im talking about. Need a hunting buddy, join us on our teamspeak server at: ts.prismgamingnetwork.com

content:
Posted: May 4, 2015
												This is the best game featuring dinosaurs I've ever played.  The Cretaceaous style world looks and sounds great.  The dinosaurs sound realistic to me, meaning they sound like actual animals instead of movie monsters.  Their behavior seems believable as well.  This is a hunting game and not an all out action game, so patience and thought are required.  There is a minimal storyline that serves it's purpose, but this game is all about your experiences hunting, being hunted, and trying to survive.  This game creates some truly frightening situations.  You really feel like you're being stalked.I think there should have been a couple more herbavore species in the game, because as far as i know, the triceratops is the only plant eater in the game.  The rest are carnivores, which makes it seem less realistc.  The weapons are very scarce.  I'm glad it takes time and effort to get them, but sometimes they seem too hard to come by.  I always play alone, so this problem is probably not so bad in multiplayer, since you can scavenge weapons from dead players.  I would certainly recomend this game to anyone that likes dinosaurs and/or hunting games.  I'm already hoping for a Jurassic themed sequel or add on.

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 7, 2015
												I can see how The Hunter: Primal can be a hit or miss. The game has sub par graphics and many technical problems, so why am i recommending it. 1) The graphics are still good and it is accaptable for an indie game, i call it this because it is a small company. The graphics do not bother me in the slightest.2) The gameplay is difficult but very fun. You must learn where certain dinosaurs roam and avoid the dangerous areas until equiped properly. In many of my encounters i am killed quickly but i learned to avoid dinosaurs until i had looted a gun from a supply box. Tactics and teamwork is essential to playing this game.3) The developers are active and constanlty fixing issues and adding new content to their game.4) Supplies are always limited adding a scare factor to encounters. Inorder to survive you MUST pick your fights wisely, a pack utahraptors may be best avoided than going comando. 5) Each type of dinosaur has a different personality and tactic they employ. You need to learn the behavior of the dinosaur that you are hunting or you will become the hunted.6) Players are typically very helpful and friendly.Overall i would recommend this game to a player who is looking for a game to play on the side. It has many entertaining aspects and the community is very friendly.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 29, 2015
												Pros:A pretty big map, nice scenery and settlements, plenty to explore.11 weapons in the game, plenty of weapons to play around with, some powerful, some not.Fun to play with friends.You have to shoot at vital organs on the dinosaurs or end up wasting a lot of ammo, this is a nice accurate addition besides just shooting and the dinosaur dropping no matter where you hit.Raptors hunt in packs, coming from several directions.Dinosaurs make recognizable sounds, alerting you to where they are and depending on how loud the sound is, how far away they are and what they are.Pretty decent A.I, can be buggy at times but still pretty okay on that part.Accurate shooting, holding your breath makes your gun more steady, laying down and crouching do as well.Textures on dinosaurs are pretty nice looking and also vary.Several variants of dinosaurs like rare, uncommon, and common.Dinosaurs have different weights, each dinosaur has a mininum and maxiumum weight, some can be quite a bit smaller than others in that species.The heavier the dinosaur is, the more points you get from it and the more EG(in-game currency) and also the more xp you get from it.In-Game store when you die is a nice feature for getting ammo and new guns, although you need certain levels to get those.Leveling system makes it where you have things to work towards.About 67 achievements, very fun to try and get them all!You can grab rocks off the ground to throw and distract dinosaurs with temporarily allowing more shooting. Cons: Game seems to be abandoned by devs so far, no more updates.A.I is buggy at times for the dinosaurs.Quetzalcoatlus sometimes freezes after you kill it in mid air and finally drops out of the sky in a random location around you.Rexes come straight to you after you shoot them, there is no finding you involved, its just KNOWS where you shot it from and comes to get you, so you have to get several shots in, sometimes not allowing for good shots and leading to ammo waste.Game came out of Early Access before it was ready, making a lot of people annoyed and bringing up the negative review count.Getting your bag back after you die can get annoying if you don't have the money or levels to get guns when you die to escort yourself.Can be a hassle to find more ammo unless you just sit around waiting for camp boxes to respawn, doing this can take a while.Unstrustworthy people can steal your loot after you die if you're not careful when playing on public servers with people you don't know on the game.Items can dissapear from boxes if you split, say, ammo in it, put some in your inventory, close the box and open it again.Can be frustrating for new people and make them quit quicker than they would with a little guidance and help from a trustworthy player who has played for a while.Well that's all I can think of for now.TL:DRAll in all a fun game for a little bit at least, very fun with several friends to play with, fun to take down rexes like this.Decent A.I, some of it still needs work though.Devs pretty much abandoned game so far, so no more updates coming.Plenty of achievements to get.Dino's have different skins.Plenty of weapons to play with, both weak and powerful.In-Game store allows for re-stock when you die.When you play with people you can trust, you die less and have more fun.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 22, 2015
												I played this game for about 20 hours now and it seems ok. Every now and then I would encounter a bug such as a flying Utahraptor(or whatever their called) or a wall-clipping T-Rex. This didn't happen often but when it did I lost alot of good stuff and I got quite upset. My final complaint is that the AI in this game are really dumb or really smart and by that I mean sometimes they would spot me from a mile away when im crouching or prone, other times I could walk right in front of them without being spotted. In conclusion when the game is being fair I have alot of fun hunting and tracking dinos. I understand that this game is still in development but some of the problems are killing my gaming experience.[EDIT 1, 4/7/16] I came back to this game after not playing it for awhile and I am glad to see that some issues have been fixed but unfortunately some new issue seemed to have popped up as well. Crate spawns appear to be unbalenced. There are times where I would be walking for a hour without finding a single crate and there are other times where I would find 5 crates in under 7 minutes. I also tried playing multiplayer PVP. I joinded an almost full server and walked around the map for two hours without finding a single person. Until the developers add a way to find and track players quicker I would not reccomend playing PVP. On the other hand PVE seems to be just fine. In PVE you can see other players on the map so it is easier to find people. In conclusion this game has gotton a lot better since my last review but I believe It still needs more work.Pros:-Realistic Dino Tracking-Nice Looking Enviornment(Not The Best Looking But Still Good)-Money/Shop System Works Fine-GPS FeatureCons:-Dinos Sometimes Wall-Clip(Walk/Kill Through Walls)-AI Are Really Dumb or Really Smart-Spawns Are Horrible-Crate Spawns Are UnbalencedGraphics-7.5/10AI-6/10Preformance-9/10Gameplay-7/10Overall I would rate this game a 7.5/10.

												Before you make up your mind about this game due to negative comments or even positive ones hear me out.The game takes on a very slow paced hunting experience where you cannot rush and kill everything so I recomend don't get it if you have terrible patience. the main problem is that the developers gave up... I enjoyed this game so much and hate to give up on it because the developers would rather back other games that they own that ended up being very disliked (The hunter). This game has great potential as many people before me have said but it has not been updated in a very long time so unless I hear something from the developers im gonna keep this review negative. a personel note for the developers: please update this game it has amazing potential but you let it sit there and I personally have been looking for a good hunting game for a very long time and I want it to be this game so please get to it.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
												I have been meaning to create a huge, in depth review of this game for quite a while, so I hope it is helpful to some new players that, hearing things said from others, may be a little wary.History of theHunter PrimalThe developers of theHunter and theHunter Primal, Expansive Worlds are constantly involved with educational visits and there is normally at least 2 interns at any time working in the development team alongside the regular, employed developers. The development team have also had lots of requests in the past to add dinosaurs to theHunter and had been interested in doing so in the past before, but they felt it would ruin the realism that many players of the game (a fair amount of which are real hunters). So, behind the scenes they started work on Primal, which was originally given the name 'Project Flintastek' (which according to google translates to 'Flintstones Fry', the developers are Swedish). Project Flintastek also quickly become a program for the interns to work on and quickly became a place where new ideas, gameplay mechanics and... stuff, would be worked on experimentally, after Project Flintastek was starting to look more and more like a complete game, Expansive Worlds decided to make it as a full game and started more serious development on it and thats where we are today.The StoryStory clearly isn't the main focus of theHunter Primal, nor should it be really, this game is about hunting primarily, however it still manages to tell an interesting story, that is, if you are eagle-eyed enough to find the hidden logs and traces left by previous Pioneers and some kind of native inhabitants, or just, really loopy people. The story that we know first off is that you are sent down onto this alien world to kill (hunt) the native inhabitants, which just happen to be very similar to the dinosaurs that we know from our past. If you fail? Your close family will be offered up as pioneers themselves. So, dont fail. Whilst I say that story shouldn't be the main focus of this game, it would be awesome if it were included/integrated more, such as finding an old camera that would then play a cutscene of a settlement being attacked, or something similar. But, yeah, interesting story but sadly most of it is hidden away in log entries of abandoned old settler mates.Upon stepping into the game world for the first time...You will be equipped with nothing but a Machete, some basic clothing and boots as well as a map fragment, which will highlight a random settlement on your map (these are the only places to find weapons). It immediatley hits home the feeling of helplessness as you are stuck on an alien planet, with just a machete to defend yourself. However, if you are just starting out, find a map on the internet and go to a settlement. You are going to need a better gun, I would also reccommend playing only on your own for a while as this will help you get better at the game more than if playing with friends.In the first hour of playing...Within the first hour you will have certainly met your first dinosaurs and hopefully have found your first proper weapon, preferably in reverse order. This is when you will, probably start to get frustrated. This game, you realise, is hard as nails and I will admit, it is very unforgiving for new players to theHunter series or just new players in general. However, if you stick at it like I did and keep trying, you will get the hang of it and start hunting dinosaurs, instead of them hunting you.General Review of the GametheHunter Primal is, and dont get me wrong here, incredibly frustrating, at times very difficult and can, at its very worst feel like a chore, having to go and get your stuff of your dead body whilst avoiding what killed you. But other than that, the game is so, so enjoyable and when you finally start to get the hang of the game and get used to all of the mechanics etc... it is the most rewarding experience I have ever seen in video games, the sheer feeling of joy when you finally kill your first T.Rex or when you track down a wounded Triceratops to find it later, dead from bleeding damage and to claim it as a kill, or when you find ammo for your favourite weapon or just discover new things, these special moments are what makes the game so, so worthwile. It can also be a very eerie and creepy experience, so people who don't want to get their heart racing should probably stay away from this title... it can get so intense when a T.Rex is just metres away from you and you are just lying in the ferns and vegetation, hoping that it wont spot you and that it will just leave already, the way the ground shakes with its footsteps can be downright horrifying.So, to put it rather simply, theHunter Primal can be frustrating, but is an intensley rewarding experience that can both make your heart race with joy, or fear. If you are looking for a survival and building game, you wont quite find that here, despite being classed as a survival game this is a hunting game truly, you won't find crafting here.Quick Reviews of Individual AspectsGraphics - The Graphics in this game are very good and suit the tone of the game well, certain things could be done better, such as the character models and various textures being stretched on some areas of the environment, but this is a good looking game.Gameplay - This game doesn't play like your typical survival shooter and actually takes a while to get used to how to use all of the functions and elements to aid your gameplay. The controls will feel slightly strange at first but you will definitley get used to it. It plays like a more fast-paced version of theHunter, the movement is faster as well as equipping weapons and items, everything is just smoother and more slick looking, so I would certainly reccommend that you go play theHunter if you are not sure about whether you will like this game, the movement etc is the same however the world and animal species are of couse, very different.Updates - The developers have never yet missed a weekly update, except when they went on christmas holiday, which, to be fair, is totally acceptable.Stability -  The game is, admittedly, somewhat plagued by glitches that can hamper (or at times, even enhance your experience) but none of them are of the game breaking variety.The Future of theHunter PrimalEven though the game is 'finished' at the time of writing (11/05/2015 GMT) the developers have not missed a single weekly update (most commonly published on Thursdays) that will always either contain bug fixes, new content or changes and tweaks to the existing game. The developers say that there is no guarantee of new content to be added to the game however the future looks bright. As theHunter Primal has and will continue to be not just a standalone game, but also a place for interns and the developers to test new ideas and mechanics so it is very likely that, maybe not as frequently as we have had new content recently but it is not unreasonable to assume that as things are experimented with that we will see new content in Primal.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2016
												If you like dinosaur games, this is one of the best. Although it is a hunting game, and has strong hunting elements such as tracking, score awarded for kills, and certain shots being more deadly than others depending on which vital organs are hit, I get much more of a survival-type game impression. The player must scavage around abandonded settlements to find better weapons, ammo, and clothing, while avoiding roaming dinosaurs and hostile other players. The dinosaur element, despite the variety being small, is very good. Dinosaurs, especially T-Rex, and its stronger Primal cousins, are very good at hunting players down, where the numbers of Utahraptors can be just as dangerous. This game reminds me a lot of a more modern Jurassic Tresspasser, and has the right element of fear when hiding from dangerous dinos and fighting for one's life.

content:
Posted: March 5
												Honestly the game is extremely broken right now. I don't know why the devs thought it was a good idea to have a save file  that anybody could edit with notepad and give themselves unlimited XP and Tokens to buy weapons. Also the save file doesn't even work correctly because it will not save your level or inventory after you leave the game. The game has decent enough graphics and the gameplay is very similiar to the original theHunter, but the numerous bugs, problems, and game breaking issues ruin it right now. The only way to even get the save file to work is to edit it with notepad, but what is stopping people from giving themselves unlimited XP? You guessed it! Nothing. Another thing is that online multiplayer games lag so bad that a lot of the time players lose connection to the host. This issue seems to get even worse when more players join the server. I have noticed that when the server has 8 or more players, de-sync gets so severe with the animals that they will freeze for a few seconds and then reappear several meters away from their previous position. Imagine the difficulty of shooting at a moving target when this happens. Also, if the host leaves the game, you will lose any progress you made during that match because of the broken save file. If they would simply implement host migration when the host quits the game it would make the game at least half as frustrating as it is. Dedicated servers would be a better alternative, but at this point that is wishful thinking. There are guides on how to fix the save issue but honestly to me it is borderline hacking because you can be a new player and give yourself 1000000 tokens just by editing a save file.I can only recommend this game if you are a die hard theHunter fan and this game is on Steam sale. Casual players, it isn't worth the $10. If you really wanna try it out, be ready to deal with the numerous bugs, random level reseting crashes, and laggy online gameplay.I have also submitted a support request to theHunters support page on their website and one of the developers emailed me that they are aware of the issues and are looking into a fix. When that fix is and what they will do is beyond me. If you are interested in buying this game I would wait a month or two and see if they release any patches first. Fingers crossed.

content:

Early Access Review
								Well, those that played "The Hunter".. have always imagined a PvP against the other hunters.. here it is.. with the added feature of Dinos!! Not only can you set the 16 player servers to PvP, you will have to outsmart some raptors and T-Rex while hunting some triops.. small bugs in the early access stage but a pretty good looking game from the start!  You have to find items to build up your armament to take on these creatures.. You most likely will start with a longbow found in a pod.. pretty good feel in the game and massive size for the island.  You finally learn why crouching and staying "quiet" is an advantage ..  worth the buy in!!  Still.."the best forest" in any game! if you're thinking of TheHunter: Primal before xmas... good suggestion.. install "The Hunter" first thru steam.. then buy The hunter Primal.. you will recieve a free shotgun and 30 days premium in "The Hunter".. win win..  give it a shot..primal has PvP as well as Dino hunting.. still "The best forest" in any game!! IF you already have a "The Hunter" account outside steam.. you have to "link" it to the Steam version for teh gifts..easy..easy.. just install the hunter from steam and play it. The first screen that pops up allows you to add the hunter account you had outside of steam right to it.. works like a charm.. after, you can keep the steam version or just disconnect the steam version and go back to playing it thru TheHunter website.. hope this helps.

								Overall, and accounting this is in early release/access, it’s a pretty decent game and I really like to play it.Like theHunter, it has great graphics (I love those sunshine/sunsets!) – it’s the same engine :) and really sweet sounds. The t-rex walking sound… is simply superb! And you can imagine that this game will get better and better over time, as EW by this many years doing the theHunter are experts in hunting games.Unlike theHunter, it’s a fast paced game where you will enjoy every minute. Sometimes I got bored in theHunter because I would rush and eventually scared off the animals ending up not seeing one or taking a lot of time to find one. In theHunter: Primal, you don’t have that problem. If you can’t find an animal, they will find you! (and you might regret it… lol). Also, there’s nothing else to pay in the game. In Primal, you just buy the game and that’s it. Everything that’s in game it’s yours and you don’t have to pay for anything else.Complete opinion at http://www.hucorner.com/blog/thehunter-primal-early-access/

content:
Posted: June 27, 2015
												This game is actually really fun.Regardless of what may or may not be going on with the developers, the game seems to work fine and it has had updates since the devs have supposedly left, so I guess the game is being maintained by ghosts or something.Now then, gameplay.Gameplay is alright, you waddle about as you do in the regular theHunter, it is a shame that you waddle at a painfully slow speed unless you run which you can do for all of 5 seconds every minute or so.You find little boxes filled with gear and there are lots of nasty things out to get you.Sound simple? It is!Staying alive is very difficult because everything kills you.That's a nice pink plant, oh wait no, it's killing me, oh look a herbivore, hello herbivore, oh it killed me that's great.That's pretty much the whole game, there is a level system but I don't ever see myself maxing it out.This means the game can get painfully dull if you don't set yourself objectives, you know the sort of thing, find a certain gun, kill so many of a certain dino, attempt to go up the mountain.But wait there's more!There's multiplayer, now I've only played on non-pvp public servers and it's pretty cool, you'll see a group of people just destroying t-rexes like they're nothing, then you'll see them all get taken down by a triceratops.GraphicsThey're niceThings that I don't likeYou can't swim, you're on an island with rivers and stuff and you can't bloody swim.YOU CAN'T SWIM ON AN ISLAND.IT'S AN ISLAND MATE COME ON THE FASTEST WAY TO GET FROM ONE PENINSULA TO THE OTHER IS BY WATERIT'S NOT EVEN LIKE YOU DROWN YOU JUST STAND NEAR THE WATER ALL CONFUSEDThe freaking not pterodactyl, stupid bird thing that just swoops at you, glitched out looking like it's stood up, absolutely awful to look at.The spawn system, you spawn rougly 60 seconds from where you die, which is good and bad, you die to a raptor that's fine you'll get him, you die to a rex and say goodbye to that server.All in all a decent bit of fun 7/10 actually good.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												DETAILED PROS AND CONS - TL;DR PARTS HAVE THESE THINGS [ ]Pros:- Looks pretty. Really pretty.- Runs on a toaster at 60 frames, even if it says 3 ghz processor my buddy can run it fine on low with a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ laptop.- DINOSAURS.- Rewarding when things go to plan.- [Dinosaurs have all of their internal organs mapped out and different weapons will have different effects in the sense that you probably wont penetrate the skull of a T-REX with a bow.]Enemies have lungs,heart,spine,neck, all that good♥♥♥♥♥♥just like all the animals in theHunter and they respond accordingly. If you put holes in a T-REX's intestines, he is going to bleed out very slowly. If you damage it's legs it's going to move slower. The more blood it loses the more it is stunned and once it is really not feeling well it'll likely try to run away to the safety of others T-REX-es.- [Tracking system of theHunter, including the ability to find DINOSAUR♥♥♥♥♥♥ ]Scan tracks with the PDA to get detailed information rather than just looking at them, but if you're a badass following them as they run away in fear (like me) you can just look at it and the finer details of the track are physically able to be seen on the ground (bright red blood for lungs/heart and darker for body). This also includes if the animal is fleeing or just roaming an area, or whatever, just like theHunter.- Dynamic experiences in the game can make for some very memorable moments. A friend and I were in a large open area on a huge volcanic rock formation when we heard raptor sounds on the other side. Suddenly spanned 10 meters apart infront of us, 4 raptors slowly started to walk towards us. We fired, they charged, had an epic showdown where my buddy almost got killed as 2 we did not see earlier decided to flank us hard along our right, which was covered by rocks.  Another time we both managed to stealth our way past a pack of T-REX(es?).- It seems [certain types of dinosaurs inhabit certain types of terrain], a pack of T-REX can be found in a valley and around it for a while, while we encountered many raptors in dense forest (p.s: spooky as ♥♥♥♥)- Variety of terrain, has swamps, valleys, large dark forests, large bright forests, forest clearings, large mountains, volcanic rock stuff, deserted settlements etc.- Map is pretty ♥♥♥♥ing big. And I mean, pretty ♥♥♥♥ing big.- Really nice atmosphere, rebuilt sound system from theHunter to give you a really nice experience with a world that feels alive (can see butterflies and dragonflies and all that♥♥♥♥♥♥ mice on the jungle floor at times).- [Can find datapads with lore and further story of the game found on them, mostly diary entries of characters that had spent their time there before.] Can usually find decent loot here and they're near settlements or camps and♥♥♥♥♥♥- (Opinion) Game isn't meant to be easy and you do have to learn as you play to know how to survive. I managed to get it down quite quickly since you can take from the mechanics of theHunter. It's similar to theHunter except much more rewarding to successfully evade your enemies, since they are essentially hunting you at times when you need to hide.- (Opinion) T-rex likes to nominate you for their space programCONS:- [Dinosaurs DO NOT ATTACK EACHOTHER.] Seriously this one was the worst to find out, big ole triceratops was rushing a T-REX I was hiding near and he just runs right past to have a sip out of the water. Worst ♥♥♥♥ing thing, I was expecting him to go FULL ♥♥♥♥ING BRAWL/BRO MODE. But nah, never happened. Hopefully this gets added in.- [Only FIVE types of dinosaur are in the game right now.] Hopefully they add more but right now they have Utahraptors, T-rex and Triceratops, Velociraptos and the Quetzalcoatlus. - [Not too many weapons in the game, as I've found all of them] (.44 revolver, .700 double rifle, .308 marksman rifle, the 12G pump action, the bow, the machete and the extremely rare .50). Hopefully more come in future.- AI pathfinding can SOMETIMES be a ♥♥♥♥. And by that, I mean the T-rex sees you, you go prone, and it just runs up to you and stands on your body where you can go crouch and fill the ♥♥♥♥er with arrows without it doing♥♥♥♥♥♥ Also utahraptors and velociraptors like to stop and have a smoke sometimes rather than attacking you (this is somewhat fixed but it is still there).- [NO ♥♥♥♥ING VEHICLES]. While I don't really mind that much since I played many hours of numerous walking simulators and sleeping games (modded arma 2, dayz, breaking point, EVE online) I'm probably going to get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥at some point that I don't have some sort of lame vehicle or something. Let me ride a Triceratops, devs. Let me be a dino-rider and relive childhood. That'd be so ♥♥♥♥in' baller.- (Opinion) Not really a big one, I like hunting and all, but after the first encounter where you find out that most times raptors have the common courtesy of letting you know they're there before attacking, alot of the horror element subsides. This might be just me not being afraid of things because I'm a STONK HAIRY MAN and if you're a little ♥♥♥♥♥ (that's okay, some of us are) you might always see horror in this game aside from the first encounter.Now, I know tips are more of a guide thing but I honestly can't be ♥♥♥♥ed making a guide, I'm the god of hunting dinosaurs (not really) and I have better♥♥♥♥♥♥to do than write a guide. Still, I want to help so take these tips and don't quit early.TIPS:- DINOSAURS ARE TOUGH ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥S. DO NOT FIGHT T-REXs ALONE WITHOUT LOTS OF AMMO AND A GOOD VANTAGE POINT. DO NOT FIGHT TREXs WITH FRIENDS WITHOUT LOTS OF AMMO AND A GOOD VANTAGE POINT. 6000 KG OF SCALE ARMOUR AND REPTILE♥♥♥♥♥♥ DON'T DO IT.  Fight raptors all you like though. If you manage to spot them first and you want to fight, see how many there are. With starting gear and not much experience you could probably take down one, then once you know where their weak spot is at the front take on more and more, depending on how capable you are with aiming. - In regards to the last tip, fighting them is the best way to learn how to kill them. If you manage to bring any dinosaur down and he's alone, take a screenshot of the kill page and look for vital spots to try shoot at next time. Be careful, raptors are rarely alone. - Use stealth. It's the only way you'll survive to find a shiny rifle and ammo, aswell as some camo clothes and all that dandy♥♥♥♥♥♥ You'll learn more about dinosaur behavior that way.- Always assume that the highest % guess of health from blood sprays is what the dinosaur has. A friend of mine was tracking a T-REX for quite some time, thinking it had basically none left but it had a high end scale % he didn't quite take into account.- This game is not supposed to be easy. I mean it is for me, because I'm so cool, but if  you're a quitter, you shouldn't buy into this game. It will take time to know what you're doing unless you have a friend guiding you that knows whats up. The challenge is what makes the game rewarding, and thats what I really really love about this game.Anything you want me to address let me know, will update review as the game is updated.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2016
												This game I see has got alot of negativity, mostly from those who havent played the game more than a few hours and rage quit after getting killed a few times. There is no doubt that this game takes a while to get used to, even I used to get extremely frustrated at not being able to locate settlements with weapons. But once you start to learn thestructure of the map and the mechanics of the game, and you start to learn new skills and stratagies, this is an extremely fun and exiting game to play solo and with friends. The concept of theHunter: Primal is great, the graphics and enviroment is breathtaking and overall this game truly does deserve more attention. I highly reccomend this game to anyone who loves survival, dinosaurs, action and of course having a great time.For those who are just starting out, here are some useful tips:Survival: The Hunter Primal is all about killing dinosaurs, finding gear and most importantly, survival. You may find the best gear but if you don’t know how to survive and keep it, it’s pointless. If you come across a dinosaur that you are not equipped to fight, you must hide. The best way to stay undetected is by crouching instead of walking if you hear something, and lying in thick bushes if something gets too close… Around the map, you can find health canisters which you can use if you are struggling for health. So if you have one and you need it, don’t save it, use it! When you come across a cliff or steep drop, you should never take the chance of just walking off to get where you want to go, you will most likely just fall to your death…  Killing Dinosaurs: Utahraptors: To kill these vicious beasts, it’s all about hitting them in the heart. You can hit them as many times as you like anywhere else and pretty much nothing will happen. To hit their heart, you must hit them directly in the front center of the body. Hits such as in the back of the spine or in the lungs (which are in the center of the side body) are effective too. It is recommended to use a weapon such as a pistol or shotgun against these. Velociraptors: These turkey sized predators can really mow you down if you are not careful, there is no set way to kill these, all you have to do it hit them and they will die… Using a machete or axe is by far the best option when fighting these things, although be prepared as they can come in packs of up to 12… Tyrannosaurus Rex: I reccomend NOT attacking this alone! You should always bring a friend along. (by playing online) If you choose to take on one, be sure to bring powerful guns and plenty of ammo. You need guns with at least the power of a 308 Rifle but a 700 Rifle or .50 Cal is recommended. When firing at this beast, you want to be hitting the heart which is located in-between its small arms. Triceratops: When taking on a Triceratops, you need to have a decent weapon with plenty of ammo, it is unlikely to attack you but you never know. When trying to hit it, go for the lungs, spine and heart. It is recommended to use a 700 Rifle or a 308 Rifle with plenty of ammo.Quetzalcoatlus:This flying dino can be annoying considering it can be hard to hit, the best way to take one down, is to shoot at its body as it attacks by swooping down on you. They are quite fragile creatures and can be taken down with as little as two hits from almost any gun. Settlements & Gear: Finding Settlements: It may seem hart at first, but finding settlements is very easy. When you start the game, you will get a “Map fragment” when you use that, you will be revealed a settlement on the map, all you have to fo is set a waypoint there by going on the map and clicking a point and go for it! Finding Weapons/Ammo: Weapons and ammo spawn at places called "settlements" these are marked by little symbols on your map. The best place to go is the settlement at the top of the volcano in the center of the map. This is the ony place you can find the .50 cal rifle, however it is still extremely rare. At this settlement you are likley to find shotguns and good camoflauge equipment.

content:
Posted: February 11
												Well, people seem to complain to no end in their reviews about bugs and that devs do not release new content. Take a look at how long I played this game, I haven't noticed any bugs but it is true that the devs abandoned the game a long time ago. I think what people are actually angry about is NOT the quality of Primal itself but the fact that devs simply left it even when it has a lot of potential!It was made by the devs of 'theHunter' as a side project and was as far as I know not even meant to be an openly available product on steam but rather something the devs made internally as a joke which eventually turned into an actual game. I don't play it much anymore nowadays but still have it installed on my hard drive, cause it is really an excellent game as long as you are fine with nothing more than walking around on an island with dinosaurs! Nothing more, nothing less. If you are the type of guy who expects more from a game like this I suggest to simply don't buy it. Atmosphere and sounds are amazing and the people I met online were all quite nice. It is perfectly fine for one or two hours every once in a while but nothing for serious gamers which expect to squeeze daily 8 hour gaming sessions out of it.See Primal like a snack you have during the day, not the main course..

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												After being eaten through trees, stood on top of by triceratops', and spawning directly next to tyrannosaurs I am done with this game.Calling this a survival game is laughable at best. There is no crafting, there is no real permanent shelter or objective. You walk, crawl, and run around hoping that the buggy glitchy dinosaurs dont ignore the multiple shotgun slugs to their heads and kill you. The newest addition, quetzocoatalus, is the biggest annoyance of all. Spent HOURS collecting items, guns, and ammunition? Too bad. death from above one hit killer.Utahraptor, velociraptor, tyrannosaurus, quetzocoatalus, and triceratops are the only other living things in this game. Its a little pathetic that in 2015 a game developer has only 5 dinosaurs in their DINOSAUR HUNTING GAME.Saying this is release worthy is embarassing to the devs, and insulting to everyone who paid for early access. If I could return this piece, I would. Don't waste your money on it.

You should always bring a friend along. (by playing online) If you choose to take on one, be sure to bring powerful guns and plenty of ammo. You need guns with at least the power of a 308 Rifle but a 700 Rifle or .50 Cal is recommended. When firing at this beast, you want to be hitting the heart which is located in-between its small arms. Triceratops: When taking on a Triceratops, you need to have a decent weapon with plenty of ammo, it is unlikely to attack you but you never know. When trying to hit it, go for the lungs, spine and heart. It is recommended to use a 700 Rifle or a 308 Rifle with plenty of ammo.Quetzalcoatlus:This flying dino can be annoying considering it can be hard to hit, the best way to take one down, is to shoot at its body as it attacks by swooping down on you. They are quite fragile creatures and can be taken down with as little as two hits from almost any gun. Settlements & Gear: Finding Settlements: It may seem hart at first, but finding settlements is very easy. When you start the game, you will get a “Map fragment” when you use that, you will be revealed a settlement on the map, all you have to fo is set a waypoint there by going on the map and clicking a point and go for it! Finding Weapons/Ammo: Weapons and ammo spawn at places called "settlements" these are marked by little symbols on your map. The best place to go is the settlement at the top of the volcano in the center of the map. This is the ony place you can find the .50 cal rifle, however it is still extremely rare. At this settlement you are likley to find shotguns and good camoflauge equipment.

content:
Posted: February 11
												Well, people seem to complain to no end in their reviews about bugs and that devs do not release new content. Take a look at how long I played this game, I haven't noticed any bugs but it is true that the devs abandoned the game a long time ago. I think what people are actually angry about is NOT the quality of Primal itself but the fact that devs simply left it even when it has a lot of potential!It was made by the devs of 'theHunter' as a side project and was as far as I know not even meant to be an openly available product on steam but rather something the devs made internally as a joke which eventually turned into an actual game. I don't play it much anymore nowadays but still have it installed on my hard drive, cause it is really an excellent game as long as you are fine with nothing more than walking around on an island with dinosaurs! Nothing more, nothing less. If you are the type of guy who expects more from a game like this I suggest to simply don't buy it. Atmosphere and sounds are amazing and the people I met online were all quite nice. It is perfectly fine for one or two hours every once in a while but nothing for serious gamers which expect to squeeze daily 8 hour gaming sessions out of it.See Primal like a snack you have during the day, not the main course..

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 8, 2015
													Been playing since early access with over 160 hours of exploring the game solo and with groups of up to 6 people. Overall I like the game. I’m not going to go in to the balance and state of the game as of this review because that changes from patch. Instead I am going to cover how I play the game, and some of the notable aspects that struck me. Side note, I have never played any hunting games (The Hunter or otherwise) and do not have an interest in doing so. I have yet to try any of the PVP but having played the original DAYZ mod for Arma 2… ya I’ll just stick to the PvE where the humans can’t ruin your day.	First off, the visuals started out very decent and just got better over time. Now in April of 2015, the weather effects are absolutely fantastic and wandering around the island is still breathtaking. And it’s not just grand vistas, it’s the attention to detail. The little PDA you use that shows what you are looking at in game is accurate when another player looks at your PDA for example. You can see the world reflect in other players eyes, the leaves from trees blow in a uniform direction to denote wind. It’s little things like that which impressed me.	Another interesting feature of the game is the sound. This is one of the few games where it actually matters. Almost any game I have played, I really could blair music or have a movie playing at the same time and not be affected. In Primal, everything is silenced but the game sounds. Even after you get comfortable with the game, the sounds are essential to knowing what’s coming and what it is. I found that having a nice subwoofer is one of the best early warning T-Rex detection systems available :-).	My third point is the most subjective but you are reading my review so you’re going to get my opinions. In my opinion, the game is beyond my patience and skill to play solo and enjoy; it’s too hard. I found I had much more fun with a small group, even if it was just one other person (WITH VOICE CHAT). If I did not have friends to play with, I probably would have abandoned the game after a few hours of exploring and being eaten. Not only can you be overwhelmed by dinosaurs but the supplies in the game are relatively scarce. This is not a complaint; I LIKE that things are scarce and that you are often down to a few precious rounds and if those fail, you are likely to die. But because there is that element of chance and that “being in the wrong place at the wrong time” aspect, the few people working with you can avert a total loss into a narrow escape or only a few deaths. Even after you are pimped out in the noble came and have whatever weapons you wanted, you are just as frail as you were when you landed and having the most powerful gun does NOT mean you are safe.	So overall, I am pleased with the game. You need 2-3 hour sections of time to really enjoy it when you hop on so don’t think you are going to play for 20 minute and be fine when you log on next, but I am happy with the time I have got out of it to date.

												This is easily the worst game i've ever had the displeasure of playing. Putting aside the fact that it looks like absolute garbage compared to the trailers, the controls are easily the worst i've EVER had to attempt to use, and even after changing them to controls i'd be used to, it's still just so slow and clunky and uncomfortable to play. I spent the entirety of my time avoiding Utahraptors, literally just walking fast enough that they couldn't catch up to me, and not being able to do anything but continue walking away from them. I started out with a Bow, but no arrows, and i lost that useless bow as soon as i died from that Utahraptor relentlessly biting at me. The sprint bar goes down extremely fast, with practically no real speed bonus, and only recharges at an acceptable rate when you're standing still. I wandered around for about what i'd say was a mile, being attacked by several Utahraptors along the way, and saw nothing at all worth my time. No other dinosaurs, no weapons, nothing to interact with other than rocks and dino♥♥♥♥♥♥ literally just those ♥♥♥♥ing Utahraptors. Altogether, I'd have to say that i wasted $30, and i really wish that i could refund this steaming pile of dogshit. All i can really think is that this game was thrown together by a couple of Jurrasic Park wannabe-fanatics with 0 talent in 3D modeling and animation. Truly pathetic. 1/10

number of helpful: 6 of 10 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
												In theHunter: Primal you're exposed on a planet similar to our earth millions of years ago. The beautiful landscape askes to be explored. The motivator: Hunt dinos to level up and earn money, both to be able to buy better equipment before you respawn after a dino got you. Also there are multiple abandoned bases on the rather big island you play on and chests with equipment (guns, ammo, healthpacks, clothing).So far it's all nice. Unfortunately there are only 5 kinds of dinos: The small Velociraptor, the big Utharaptor, the Triceratops (the only herbivore), the T-Rex and the Quetzalcoatlus (flying). Encountering the dinos is well done: You might hear some raptors, but you won't see them, you move along, and still hear them, knowing that they're stalking you. But soon you will find out that the dinos are incredibly stupid in fights: Except for the flying dino and the T-Rex to some extent, they all can be easily killed with the starting machette only, if you keep moving along their flank and back.Frequent bugs like frozen dinos (e.g. a Quetzalcoatlus stuck in the air), Quetzalcoatlus flying through the terrain or T-Rexes who do their death-bite even if you're far away from their head further take away from the atmosphere the stunning land- and soundscape provided before.The unfinished game has a lot of potential, but it has been released from early access, thus i don't assume that this potential will be used. I don't recommend this game.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
												This is a dinosaur survival game based on the popular hunting game theHunter. The game's engine is known for solid weapon simulation and detailed immsersive environments.  There is no crafting, you only need manage your health, clothing, weapons, and ammo.  Once you have leveled up with points accumulated from kills you can spawn in with better equipment and the game becomes more hunting orientated, less survival orientated. It feels less arcadey than ARK with a heavy emphasis on accurate gun physics. Be warned this game can be a bit of a walking simulator and despite being both beautiful and terrifying the AI leaves a little something to be desired. The game supports both cooperative and PvP game modes. theHunter Primal is definitely worth it in sale!

content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												Thehunter: Primal has all the potential to be a great, awesome game in many regards. You hunt and explore alone or with other survivors (multi-player) and are also hunted by the creatures of this game. Experiences can make you feel horrified if you forget your actually playing a game to some. What started out as a mega promising game fell to the wayside with no updates or patches for almost a year. A NEW DLC has been released with some new fixes along with a great mission to kill the Primal Queen T-Rex. You must first seek out the rare T-Rex and aquire its gland to lure the Primal "Queen|' out into the open. She is must stronger than the normal Rex's found within the game.  New high tech weapons are gifted to the players skilled enough to bring down the Primal Queen.  A new survey for players was put out by Expansive Worlds asking numerous questions about future things that could possibly make the game better. New DLC's and such. There are some bugs still noticably found in the game that are said to be fixed soon. Hopefully the Devs are now onboard with this project permanently and can give us tons of new explorations, more creatures to horrify the faint of heart. The game deserves to be updated and new materials added frequently even if it means spending money on new DLC's by its fanbase. There are not many Dino games out there that are worth anyones time. This one has the potential to be a great one. Great game, needs some Dev love before it loses its fanbase and is lost forever. Time will tell if the effort is put into it. We hope so......

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 16, 2016
												Primal is one of the few games that sincerely and beautifully implements the idea of dinosaur hunting; I'm not talking about some Turok style title where dinos are just a more exoctic kind of antagonist/cannon fodder for a player.  I mean the kind that truly gives a player the thrill of hunting these creatures, but also the feeling of being the hunted.  Bought it when it was still relatively new (had only three dinos; utahraptor, tricerotops, and t-rex), and it's made a few steps by adding two new species since.  Landscapes are beautiful, the game of cat and mouse is as exciting as it is nerve-racking...  Unfortunately, it seems as though Primal has been doomed to the graveyard of those other titles where the developer simply got tied up elsewhere, or (sadly) just stopped caring about it.  I haven't given up hope completely; if you've followed Stranded Deep, the game went MONTHS without any new updates, but the developers eventually came back to it, and have been working on it, as if showing remorse for the long period of neglect.  Perhaps Primal might share a similar fate, but perhaps not.  Definitely worth the buy, but only if it's on a sale.  It's fun for the first few hours, but the developers haven't given me much of a reason to dive back in again.  Fingers crossed though

Buildings: I want there to be more sophisticated ruins or buildings. There are towers and runied forts but there are no doors or you can't enter any of the old buildings. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								For an early access game, theHunter: Primal is satisfactory. Not the best, but certainly not the worst.The main draw of the game is survivng on an island full of dinosaurs which is a ton of fun. Although the dinosaurse's AI is mediocre at best, the thrill of being hunted by a pack of raptors or chased by a T-Rex is pretty terrifying. The scenery and sound effects are extremely impressive, adding life to a massive jungle world, which gives the illusion that the animals are talking to one another. Unfortunately there is not much to do but make your way across the island, hunting for loot while the combat and weapon options are limited.As it stands at the time of this review, I only recommend it if you have close friends to enjoy it with. That being said, if the development of this game continues at a reliable pace, theHunter: Primal has the potential to be a great game.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								I would easily give this game of the year award but atm, it crashes wayyyyy to often. I was hosting a game of 15 people and my client crashed. So many people get dissapointed when playing. It's a pain really, but IT'S WORTH IT. It's seriously so much fun that i've given up on all other games. Getting stalked across the landbridge by a pack of raptors, getting eaten by a t-rex that comes out of nowhere, taking selfies with triceratops that got their head stuck in a hill. What more can you want? Remember that you actually need to aim on vital areas of the animals. If you shoot head on you're likely to be eaten. I hit a raptor from the front 4 times with shotgun slugs, but it still ate me, but you can one-shot them with bow and arrow if you hit straight in the heart! Taking down a t-rex on your own is not impossible. They are afraid of walking down really steep hills, so if you find a ledge, it's easy to get a few shots on the rex to make it start running away, then you pick out your marksman rifle and take it down but this game is best if you play it with friends.Map knowledge is key. There some settlements spread across the map where you can find various firearms. If you find a settlement, write down the coordinates, which you can find in the hand computer.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								Most realistic hunting enviroment I've played in to date.  Awesome game physics and highly detailed landscapes and dinosaurs make for a thrilling hunting experience.  An air of caution to those easily scared. Do not play in the dark with headphones.The experience starts you off in a space capsule that lands on a planet filled with blood thirsty dinosaurs.  Your main objective is to hunt, kill and rid the island of these man eating beasts.  You start off with a bow and few arrows to tide you over unitl you eventually find crates scattered around the map, containing different weapons and ammo.  When encountering these larger that life beasts, I recommend you use the environment to your advantage.  There's plenty of undergrowth to conceal yourself until the perfect shot presents itself to you.As an early release for $19.00, you get more than you pay for.  You'll find the plush and vibrant island environment and a variety of three Dinosaurs, anough to contend with until further developement.  The targets include the infamous Utahraptor, T-Rex and Triceratops.  As developement continues, more dinosaurs will be added along with more objectives i'm sure.  This is a single/multiplayer interface where you can either go it alone, or team up with others.  Power in numbers!!And good hunting.....

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Caution: This game requires patience. I'm not a patient guy. That being said, it is quite rewarding when you get used to the ideals of the game. I do agree with most other reviews which often say "This game is basically still being developed and it shouldn't be a full release yet" Because it's true. There are only five species on the island so some variety would'nt go amiss. A couple more herbivores too. What I'd also like to see is being able to construct some sort of shelter, I know it's included in a lot of other games now, especially those with a bit of survival in them, but this game is literally all about survival yet we wander about for the entire duration.There are bugs. Some are infuriating. For me I've been able to ignore them, and I'm still discovering the game. Overall this is a fun game, feels great when you get on top of the local meat eaters and the ability to team up with people helps too. Needs more content and a couple of dodgy bugs fixed. That's all. I hope within two months of writing this review there'll be a little more to chew on.Edit - It's been seven months. Devs have done nothing to update the game whatsoever. What once had the potential to become an exciting game has stagnated and melted away in the shadow or ARK and other such games. Go buy ARK instead, it actually gets updated.
