content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Great Game! Harldy any bugs for Alpha, those it does crash now and then (fortunately that's at the game menu when starting not half way through a hunt) It's a slow paced game but a highly rewarding one and the encounters with the Dinosaurs I'd describe as more frequent than the original Hunter game, and perfectly balanced between realism and entertainment.If you don't think properly when you start you may not enjoy the game, you cannot aimlessly roam on your own with a bow and expect to live. I teamed up with someone else so if we did encounter a Raptor before we got a gun, we'd both have a good chance at taking it down together. Gradually you build up your weapons and ammo, and now I'm roaming around taking everything out. The introductions of pvp optional servers give you more to shoot at for impatient gamers, but also dents your survivability as often people gift you guns in non pvp.I'd recommend viewing the forums for a 'base map' - there are 25 so far in the game and if you know where they are you can enter the game and run to the base in the hope of getting a big gun. I'm now kitted out in full camo gear, i have a sniper and scope rifle, and a shotgun. It's really, really fun, especially seeing the holes you can blast out the dinosaurs with the rifle. I'm totally impressed and what a bargain at 15.99 for the hours I've now put in (16), I can't wait to see what else is added as the game develops - a really throroughly good effort.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								If you've played The Hunter (no I'm not going to type it like this: theHunter), then this is basically The Hunter but with dinosaurs, and if the idea of that floats your boat, then by all means give it a go.If you've not played The Hunter before, then basically it's a hunting sim with dinosaurs. You get a large tropical volcanic hawaiian style island to roam and explore at your lesuire which looks fantastic. As with The Hunter they've done a great job on making the environment feel very natural and believable. Fancy a quick break somewhere nice in the sun? Then go for a hike around this island. Of course you won't be able to completely relax because the place is also inhabited by dinosaurs, which you can either try and avoid or hunt down. The current premise behind all this is that you're a prisoner/pioneer in the future who has been dumped on this planet and tasked with clearing it of dinosaurs. Evidence of previous pioneers is still littered and dotted around the landscape in places.To aid you in hunting you get a sort of hunters mate. A little electronic PDA style device that you can use to scan foot prints or scat or even dinosaur calls to help give you a idea of their directional location. It's not always 100% on the ball so you have to use a bit of your own judgment as well. By default, evidence of dino tracks are highlighted with glowing red markers making them much easier to spot in amongst all the thick vegitation. You can turn these markers off and rely only on your own abilities to spot the foot prints and mounds of dino poo. Trust me, even without the glowing markers, trying to spot even a 3 foot mound of poo is tricky, let alone a foot print in the grass. The PDA however will still chirp up and notify you when you do stumble over some evidence of dino tracks.So what weapons and gear do you get to hunt down these dinos? Well it's an odd assortment considering it's set in the future and that you have been specifially tasked with hunting down dinosaurs. You'd think they'd give you a suit of armour and a gun that could knock down an elephant, but instead you start dressed in a t-shirt next to a pod that contains a bow and a tiny clutch of arrows. Yes, they gave you bows and arrows to take down dinosaurs. I guess the folks in charge back on earth must have been reading the Turok comics in order to formulate their dino eradication strategy. As you move around the landscape, you will come across crates with other weapons, items of clothing and medi kits. Mostly you will find more arrows and bows, but there are also shotguns, pistols and rifles to be found. Annoyingly you won't always find the ammo with the gun, meaning you will have to decide whether to haul around a dead weight with you in the hope of finding some ammo for it. All items affect your overall weight, which in turn affects your movement speed and how long you can sprint for. Clothing items currently seem to offer no bonuses, it's just fancy dress right now. Another issue is that items will not stack at the moment either. So if you have 5 arrows and you pick up another 3, they will stay as two separate amounts in your inventory. Fortunately inventory space is not a problem right now anyway as there is almost no way you could fill it with the current weight limitations. However when you equip the 3 arrows it won't automatically then use up the bunch of 5 after you've used the bunch of 3. You will have to then equip that bunch of 5 manually too. All simple issues that will get sorted in time I'm sure.The weapons themselves for the most part handle well. The bow is a bit of a pain, as you need to aim it before charging it for firing and you can't do it in quick succession. Meaning if 3 raptors get on your trail and all you have is a bow, then you're dead meat. You might take one, but the other two will get you for sure. A shotgun fully loaded with slugs will even up the score some what. As with The Hunter all the beasties take location damage to things like heart and lungs etc and even if they do a runner they can still bleed out and die later. If like me you have no idea of the internal anatomy of dinosaurs, then taking them down with shots to the vitals will be more about luck and guess work. Currently there are only 3 dinosaur types in the game, the Triceratops, Utahraptors and the T-Rex. The dinos are not omnipotent and you can generally sneak up on them with reasonable ease if you stay low and stick to cover. They can of course also sneak up on you. A few times as I've been strolling along I heard a rustle from behind me and turned around to see a raptor sneaking up on me. If you see 3 snooping around behind you trying to pick up on your trail, then get worried. Avoid the T-Rex. Triceratops is a herbivore and is the best one to actively hunt down yourself without worrying that it's going to eat you instead.I haven't tried playing it with other folks yet, only "singleplayer", so I can't tell you how good the network code is etc. To play, you have to create a game and set the usual things like how many other players you want to be able to join in and give your game a password. So currently to play it single player just set the players to 1 and password it. In the 3 hours I played last night, I did not encounter any major show stopping bugs or crashes. It all seemed pretty stable to me. Playing it on an i5 with 8 Gb of ram and a GTX770, all on max settings and it all runs just fine.Right now the game is a bit content thin as previously noted. Only 1 island, 3 dinos, a small smattering of weapons and not a lot else. However of course I expect that to change as the game is delveloped. What is currently there though, is in a very playable state, and if hunting and exploring are your thing then this should provide you with a good few hours of enjoyment even at this stage. The Hunter is currently the best hunting game out there (shame about the microtransactions), so this game already has a good foundation in that respect. It's more or less really just going to be a case of waiting for them to develop the content with this one.What would I like to see going forwards? More islands with different biomes like windswept deserts and dunes, arctic areas, temperate woodlands and plains. More dinosaurs of course and interactivity beween the different dinosaurs, as I haven't really seen any evidence of that yet. More kit and perhaps a bit of minor base building maybe. All stuff that I'm pretty sure we'll see eventually anyway.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								This new error 16002 where you can't connect to the game is not good.  19 days not being able to play now so still thumbs down. Other than that I like the game lots of fun playing with friends.  No comments from the Devs in the forums also not looking very good.       (edit)   Well I had to edit my review finally after some updates I was able to play again.  There are still some issues that need to be addressed 1. in multiplayer if your not the host your shots are not counting when shooting animals.  So if you shoot 30 times into a T-rex and your friend shoots 30 times only his shots count.  Same with the other animals as well.  2. The shotgun has issues off and on with the different ammo types, have to take the shotgun out of the slot place it into inventory then replace it back into weapon slot.  Was killed because of this 3 or 4 times.  Also sometimes the shotgun doesn't want to fire not sure what is causing this but it does happen.  3. The power of the ammo doesn't seem to be strong enough at times one time it drops everything no problem.  Then other times its like you have to shoot for example T-rex 60 times to kill it point blank something wrong with that.  First came out I was able to get a T-rex with 4 to 10 shots not anymore.  4. The grouping of dinos odd load ratios.  Raptors seem to be in larger packs of 7 to 9 more often now.  Triceratops seem to be in groups of 3 to 6 .  If your unlucky like me at times you get the 3 and 4 T-rex at one time.  Most of the time can get 1 maybe 2 of them but then the other 2 get you.  The ammo stacking has made things alot nicer able to have ammo with no worries now.  Still kinda buggy at times with it but not as bad.  Now comes the weather I was dreading the day when the rain from hell would hit the game.  I do not care for the rain system had it in the regular thehunter game.  Is way too loud needs to have a way to lower the sound level.  Try playing this game with headphones in TS when it rains you can't hear anyone and it gives you a headache.  I haven't tried pvp yet first off I don't want to lose the clothing it took me days to find.  I really would like to have a second game profile so I could have one for the regular game play and one for PVP play. That way I wouldn't care if I lost what I had when in PVP etc.  Other than that I like the game nothing like the ROAR of the mighty T-rex .  Then the foot steps the screen shake then  the first sight of the Mighty Rex.  You hide where ever you can it walks past you then suddenly stops and sniffs the air. Your heart races you wonder do I shoot or do I stay still.  50/50 chance I say go for it.  I would now have to recommend this game now as I do hope they keep updating with goodies.  I say 8 out of 10  as it is now.   After more things are added I will see about updating my review and see if it should get a better score.

content:
Posted: August 2, 2015
												I bought theHunter:Primal during its' Early Access phase but it sat barely-played for several months. I just happened to try it again last week and wow what a difference! This is easily now one of my favorite games (and I've never bought a hunting game before except for Carnivores many years ago). The updates seem to have fixed the issues I had pre-launch. This game is immersive with the graphics cranked all the way, and there have been quite a few times when I've actually felt dread (like when I shot and killed a Utah Raptor with the .308 and a T-Rex comes over the ridge to investigate and comes within yards of me on my belly cowering behind a tree). You don't want to die and lose the items you've collected (like improved camo-clothing, Marksman .308 with scope, shotgun with slugs, etc.).The island it beautiful and pretty big, the dinosaur AI seems great, there are more types of insects now, there are birds and I'd swear I've even seen a rat scurring around on two seperate occasions. I saw someone mention there were no graphic options, and there is, you just have to go through Options on the startup screen rather than through the in-game Options available when you hit the Esc key while playing. Someone also said there is no guide but it's there too...I absolutely do recommend this game and I don't think we've seen the last from the developers.Brian

content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
												Starts out fairly hard, it's easy to die and it takes awhile to find the weapons you need to take down the big stuff.  It's a fun game if you can get past those parts. It's easier if you join a group and hunt together since you can cover each other. Shot placement is extremely important; try to hit them in the heart.  Well worth the 7.49 I paid for it on the Steam Summer Sale.  Now that I've got good weapons, it's hard to quit playing. I've had the game crash a few times but haven't lost my gear because of it.  If you die (and the server is still running) you can go back to where your body lies and gather up all your gear.  If you like a challenging hunting sim with dinosaurs where the hunter can become the hunted, then you will like this game.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Even in early access this game feels polished. The dinos act how you would expect them to. They are challenging and feel natural. The environment is huge! so there is plenty of time to expore and get a feel for the place. You might not encounter a dino right away but the suspense really keeps you on your toes. Especially when youre in a dense forest and they are camoflaged so well (another reason I love the realism of this game).A few times I thought I had avoided a raptor then came face to face with one or more only to realize they were hunting me. When you hear them and cant see them you really get a sense of F**K I'm going to die.For rougly half an hour I had to camp in some ferns and wait for a female raptor to move away. I had to listen for a call to know where she was so I could scurry to more cover. In reality if dinos were real I feel this game nails it. I dont care that I had to wait half an hour to escape the raptor because it felt like she hunting me. Later I lured her to my hiding spot and murdered her in cold blood (she got a couple bites in the process). The thrill of killing a raptor is awesome and the kicker of getting to take a trophy shot is just the icing on the cake.There are definately some things I would like to see in the finished versions like more herbivors and carnivores of carivous sizes etc even pterosaurs would be aweome! Aside from what I want if the developers continue to provide polished content there is no reason not to get this game especially if you love dinosaurs.There is so much potential for this game. I can only hope they flesh it out with a greater variety of wildlife to make the island really feel alive (it already does but what I mean is more so). I am happy I did. I hope that with more people buying this they can push out more content faster. This game litterally drops you in the middle of no where with a bow and arrow a GPS tracker and thats it. For a game to do that it has to be good and this one is. I can't praise it enough. If you buy it don't expect a finished product but do buy it to help this game reach full release. Its awesome.

content:

Early Access Review
								Hi people.My first look about this game:I start the game and the first look is great, a very good world with many variants, very nice sound and a sensation of fear. I start to explore and i have my first dinossaur, a female raptor calling. Is great, but i only have a bow with 5 arrows. Ok, i need a rifle or something better to kill this lady, then i move 200m and i see a T-Rex, he make a creapy call and i try to get back slowly, but i have the lady in my back. Ok, i die... I get in again and in a few minutes i get my firt kill, a triceratops. This is a early version of the game, and we know is a lot of work comming, but now is alredy a good game.Problems:This game is great, but have a few problems.- The volume of the T-Rex call is very low.- When a dinossaur (triceratops) go for a hole in the midle of the clifs, he stuck in there and you shoot at 3m, he dont run and dont see you.- So many dinossaurs in the map (i realise is because we have only 3 species yet) is very dificult to move without step in a carnivor.- Not the call, but the noise of a triceratops (presence noise), looks like a carnivor in my opinion. The call is perfect.- To many crashes on the servers.I'm a big fan of TheHunter and now of TheHunter: Primal and for Expansive Worlds and all the people envolved in this game, thanks for this great game, nice work.(Excuse my english)

content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												Intro-                                                                                                                                                                                             theHunter Primal is a hunting survival style sim for steam. You can hunt alone or with friends on a large prehistoric island map. You search for weapons and clothing with hungry T-Rex's and other dinosaurs stalking the large area.Will you be the hunter or the prey.. Pros-                                                                                                                                                                                      Graphically it seems to be nice lookingYou hunt mostly dangerous dinosaurs with a range of weaponsNice large continent map to travel   Sounds design is nice and atmospheric                                                                    The difficulty is just right to have you feeling helpless when chasedCons-                                                                                                                                                                                             There is a somewhat limited amount of clothes or gear to pick fromNo vehicles on map so you will need to do alot of walking or runningSome dinosaurs especially the T-Rex can take way too much damage                                                                                      Perhaps more dinosaur variety is needed for this gameThere is only the one map no matter if its size is large                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 .......................................................................................................................................................................................My Final Thoughts-                                                                                                                                                                        While this game can give the player a good feeling of a realistic hunting experience,being replaced with dinosaurs.This is a game needing perhaps patience and or friends as a group to keep it interesting and fun.This game seems to be quite well developed having a somewhat active player base and dedicated servers at the moment.So overall a good game for the more patient and hardcore hunter among you.Hope this helps,thanks.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 30, 2016
												I have played the orginal Hunter for many years now on and off since it was very new and in beta phase, and it always brings me back. Sadly, the same can not be said for The Hunter Primal. The graphics are great and alot of the animals look real enough (I dont know fully as I have never seen a T Rex in the flesh) but its let down by a very clunky old style engine, It is what The Hunter was using in the original beta from the feeling. The Animals charge you, then sort of mill around doing nothing for 2-3 seconds before running off and charging again. My other couple of gripes with this that annoy the hell out of me, is the weapons and gear factor, unlike The Hunter you dont have an account with all your gear saved to it. Its what you had on you when you last logged out, This is fine, apart from when it bugs out and you lose what you have, Or worse yet, due to personal hosting, If you die and are running back to your corpse to get your gear, and they decide to log out. Bye bye gear. Meaning you start from scratch again and have a near impossible task of trying to open some containers with ammo and weapons in. Its crazy you have to be level 10 to even buy your first gun. The Quetzalcoatlus are far too OP, they are a nightmare to try and kill and bug out constantly, with a werid flying animation. The Dino noises can be heard from so far away that they sound like they are on top of you when actually they are 500 metres away. My honest advice is to save the money you would pay for this, go to The Hunter, pay for a 3 month bundle and play that, its so much more fun, its not hunting dinosaurs, but a bear can make you just as dead as any T Rex.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
Early Access Review
								As a fan of theHunter this game is great! As an early access title there is still not much to hunt, you have the choice of 3 dinosaurs all with unique AI and attitudes. What this game does really well is the sense of how epic these animals truly are, going up against a T-rex alone is truly a deathwish most of the time, you're going to need some perfectly placed shots to take it down. PVP servers also add to the chaos, with full-loot pvp you can trust no one in this world and it leaves for a very Jurassic Park-like survival game. The loot system is very dry and could be improved and of course dinosaur selection can be expanded but I'm sure that will come.Overall 8/10 and easily a 9 by release.

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												Great game. One of the best and most realistic dinosaur hunting sim ever. Great graphic, advanced and realistic A.I., dynamic weather and day-night cycle. Spectacular environment and an iteresting backstory that you can discover in details finding abandoned documents. Dinosaurs are scientifically and anatomically accurate. Even if there are only 5 species (yet), they are really balanced (Triceratops: herbivore population, very common. Tyrannosaurus: apex predator. Utharaptor: medium sized pack hunter. Velociraptor: small but dangerous, really funny to fight a pach of them. Quetzacoatlus: flying scavenger and small animal hunter). A must-have for anyone.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
Early Access Review
								I say a positive recommendation because this game has great potential. Beginning with nothing but a self made bow and 5 arrows, you must trek across a massive island hunting and being hunted by two types of prehistoric dinosaurs, utahraptors and the mighty t-rex. These are not the only dinosaurs, there is also the ever illusive triceratops. This is my only real criticism, with such a huge amount of background available, there are only three trackable, huntable, lethal dinosaurs to be found in this massive island. That being said, the game is tense, rewards exploration and if you're into big game hunting,the game doesn't get much bigger. Less so however is the inclusion of modern paleantology, the dinosaurs in this game don't have feathers for instance. But I doubt if this really matters much, the game gives the classic hunting dinos of Jurassic Park feel. Lots of fun.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 25, 2015
												After almost 20 hours I realize what this game is trying to do, it's a fine game, but not more than 5 dollars in fines.You're Roland in jurassic park 2, a hunter that got so bored with deer he became bald and decided to hunt dinosaurs.A dinosaur shooter can have you replace the dinosaurs with pokemons, or zombies, it won't feel much different, you shoot the small once, the big twice. However this is a hunting game, with dinosaurs. Hunting games have its roots in realism, covering mechanics of smell, wind, weather, anatomy, bullet calibres, camouflage. These features all play a part in your success of hunting the prey. In other words, shooting everything in the face won't work out when your'e facing an animal with the skull thickness of armor plating on a T51 tank and the capability kill you before you finish reloading a magazine.The game doesn't give many tools, because it wants to be a survival game, they expect people to come in, know how hunting games work, and apply that to survivalism and dinosaurs, when most people think this is killing floor with dinosaurs, myself included.A big realization of the difference of this game is, how your prey will almost always outrun you when its health gets low. This occurs almost all the time, provided that everyone spawns with a knife at level 1, they run faster, hit harder, and have more bodies than you.So what do you do to succeed, you run, you hide, you scavenge other players bodies, and abandoned outposts for weapons. Because in this game, access to weapons doesn't mean it gets easier, it just allows you to make more mistakes. A player can use a bow and one shot a triceratops if you aim for its heart and because ammo is limited, it is encouraged to do so.You hide in the woods, listen for the noise and stalk the pack, finding one triceratops by itself muching grass, by watching the foliage you figure out the wind direction, staying downwind, so it can't detect you by smell, you crouch up to its side of the belly, drawing the bow, aiming for the spot behind the joint of the foreleg, a direct hit pierces its heart and kills it instantly, while the kid that plays call of duty is shooting it with a 50 cal, 11 times on the crown of its skull doing 1% total damage. If you miss, you aim for its lungs, then its intestines, because it won't run as far without proper respirations, and it will bleed out if you shoot it in the intestines.I hope this helps you understand this game better.

content:
Posted: January 20, 2015
Early Access Review
								I felt the same sense of immersion and enjoyment as a kid playing Carnivores 2 on the family win98!Getting hunted down by a pack of raptors, hearing them chirp back and forth to one another,knowing they are hunting you. The feeling of accomplishment when you take 5 minutes to crawland inch closer to a raptor, just to get a perfect shot with your new .308 rifle. Playing with friends, coordinating a crossfire on a triceritops, unleashing a hail of bullets. Taking a group pic and laughingabout how awesome it was. Then running when you realize we used up most of our ammo and that aT-rex can heard our little cannonade. Seriously though, this game is amazing.The game has its core features down, and it's alot of fun. Me and a few friends own the game now, and its always a blast to play together. I'll admit, it has issues like crashing and missing features,but the devs are releasing a patch at a pace of about once per week, and are listening to community feedback.Since I started playing the game the devs have already fixed my biggest gripes about the game,which is new to me on a game thats still in early access.Thank you Expansive Worlds! Thanks for all the enjoyment The Hunter and Primal have brought, and for your listening to the community, as well as continued updates!

content:
Posted: December 26, 2015
												I cannot recommend a game that was built as a side project by the devs of The Hunter, and then seemingly abandoned by them a few months later after they milked the steam community for $20 something dollars.  We only see updates once every few months now and they dont fix the fundamental problems of the game.  This is listed as a survival game, that they are 100% correct on.  They dont give you enough ammo to survive on so you either spend all your time trying to sneak around the dinosaurs which usually end up sniffing you out no matter how well camoflauged you are and you end up wasting your precious ammo on trying to kill them because the devs dont add enough ammo in the boxes they spawn in that you are supposed to use to keep yourself stocked up on.  There are numerous bugs and glitches that they need to fix and in order to survive you usually see people exploiting them just to get enough ammo to survive, that or you spend all your time throwing yourself off cliffs to "buy" ammo which is only purchasable in your death screen.  There arent enough dinosaur varieties in the game, especially herbivores and you never see the carnivores interact with the herbivores, they completely ignore each other for the most part no matter what is going on in-game.  There are a few "crown" or good camps that drop decent gear so expect to do nothing more in this game but running between those camps trying to outfit yourself enough to take down a rex and getting eaten many many times in the process.  If I had a dollar every time I screamed at my pc: "Devs, fix your game!"  I could replace my current setup with a triple SLI'd Titan GTX PC and go pick up ARK instead and run it at ultra and 60 fps.

number of helpful: 4 of 7 people (57%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 25, 2015
Early Access Review
								While the game has a good concept (which is why I bought it) there are a lot of issues.To start - you start with nothing but a machete, and you're supposed to go around finding better gear, but there is NO GOOD WAY TO STAY IN STEALTH AROUND DINOS. I can't hardly find my way up the freakin' volcano to the research center to get better gear without being killed by a dino that shouldn't of seen me. Prone does nothing, crouch does nothing, moving slow does, guess what? NOTHINGThen there's the 'store' to unlock and buy better starting gear. There is nothing telling you how to level, there is nothing telling you how to earn the stuff to purchase things (such as the bow) from the store. I can only assume that you have to kill dinos and get the trophy ones to gain xp and coins, but again, if found it IMPOSSIBLE to do this without the proper gear, which I found IMPOSSIBLE to gain.There's also the fact that this is labeled as a survival game, which I indeed am in love with as a genre. Here's the thing, this isn't a survival game. This is a 'run around like a chicken with it's head cut off, falling off a cliff and dieing multiple time as you attempt to get gear to kill stuff' game. There is no crafting, there is no 'good' way to get the improved gear, you can't build a camp of any sort for any kind of protection. It's run, kill, run, kill, loot if you can, and try to SURVIVE the dinos, but there is no way to actually do this. It's not a survival game because you have to survive, it's a survival game if you have to survive WITH THE MEANS TO DO SO.Lastly, maybe this game isn't just for me. I'll be honest here and admit that. I think I would enjoy it with the ability to craft better items, maybe some resource gathering? BUilding up a base camp for protection, make me need to eat and drink, or at the very least, GIVE ME GEAR AT THE START THAT WILL ACTUALLY HELP.With these things being said, I'm giving it a down vote for the time. I understand it is still in development, and I understand that it's probably got a long way to go. The thing is that at this stage, I don't see an appeal to it, and don't recommend it to anyone that's looking for a fun game that they can acomplish something with. I'll revisit it in the future some time and see how it's going then, but for now, I'm deleting it, and not planning on checking in for a few months, hopefully it becomes worth the 20$ soon!

content:
Posted: May 31, 2015
												For me, this is the best dino game to date! I love playing it, its a little hard on single player but that also makes it fun, and its a blast in mp. The graphics are great, physics are great, AIs are great, the team that runs it is great/amazing, I really cant say enough good things about the game and devs! This and thehunter, in my opinion, are two of the best games out there, they are both very well developed with a team that is constantly adding updates, new features, and killing bugs. I am trying to think of a few cons to add to this, but i currently don't have any, except I do really miss the original raptor skins, and while the new ones are nice I would still like to see the old ones sometimes! The thing about this game that i know receives criticism is that there is a lot of walking around, and if your not properly equipped, getting killed. It just takes a little bit of planning and if you can find a group of people that's the best, but when you start out you will probably die a lot while you learn the game, and this is totally ok!

Early Access Review
								In its current state the game is good, but not great. Its in Early Access and the devs are adding more dino types and game play tweaks so it should improve. Also the devs are active in the forums which is very good. The one thing that, for me stops it from being very good is the survival aspect, all this involves at the moment is just not being eaten by a dino. You are being asked to 'survive' but without any crafting abilities. So add some basic crafting elements, like crafting arrows from trees and dino feathers, health packs from the islands fauna and even teepee type structure made from dino skin and sticks, this would allow you to create a spawn point for the player. Expand on this and get your team to build some teepees together, then you've got a team camp to start your hunting from. If this kind of thing was added the game would be superb and should be on top of every dino hunters list. There are loot chest around the map which contain guns and ammo, but this feels like a 'cop-out' from providing any kind of true survival game mechanics.EDIT: and whatever you do, dont, and I mean REALLY don't, under any circumstances mention the word 'ZOMBIE' mod in the forums because you will get Phlamed by the games narrow minded FANBOYS.

content:
Posted: March 13
Product received for free
												I really do not like to leave negative reviews on a game since I am a positive person overall, but this time it is different.First of all, I have played theHunter when it was a pay to win broser based game. Even though I did not buy anything I had a good time looking for animals, discovering maps (they are huge), and hunt the ones I had permission to. I spent around a long 20 hours with the game and was happy when it moved to Steam. However I did not buy it because I felt I would not play it.Then came theHunter: Primal with the genre combination of Survival/Hunting. I felt excited, I like both Survival and Hunting games and this could be the one game that I would love. The dinos made me even more interested and after a few days I decided to buy the game with a friend (I got it gifted since I had no cash FeelsBadMan). Well, let me tell you, this game, this one wannabe-masterpiece, was my biggest disappointment ever. This pile of junk could be the best walking simulator of the year. "B... But why?!" you might ask. Because this game is: Is not a survival game  - You literally have to rack up 60 tons of ammo and weapons before being able to solo-kill a "Big" dino, and you also have to track it down (While doing that the chance you die is up to 90%). You have no hunger levels, no thirst levels, only some stamina and your finite inventory slots with the most boring gameplay ever.  Is more boring than the Rock Simulator 2015 could've been  - You literally have no clue of what your purpose is, no point to play. You only, stack ammo, track, shoot, die, stack, track... and so on.The game ran well on my computer not counting the times when it randomly crashed. I meet the requirements to play the game but it did not go well. Not sure if they fixed it now though.PROS:- Can be fun with friends for some time (around 2 hrs)- ???CONS:- Bad graphics- Boring gameplay- Crashes randomly- Tons of bugs not being fixed- Small repertoir of dinosaurs- everything else.My rating would be a hardcore 2/10 - The only good thing in the game was the roleplay we did with some friends. After killing two dinosaurs we got bored though. Not recommended to anyone, I would like my wasted time back. Buy the original game instead, at least that is kind of worth the money.

number of helpful: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												If you have an interest in dinosaurs and shooting games, this is a definate purchase for you. I have played since early access and the game has improved slowly and steadily, to the point where there is a decent amount of content.The learning curve is very steep for new players, even for a seasoned player losing all their gear and starting from scratch can be difficult. Don't let this put you off as the game offers many rewarding experiences once you get your bearings. You start off with a machete and must explore and loot settlements and chests to find gear. Once you have a few kills under your belt you may buy items from the store which strictly uses in-game money, there are no microtransactions.You will die often to begin with but with practice you can drop every dinosaur with a few arrows and then theres the other weaponry, which are all diverse and good for different purposes. Pistol, machete and .308 rifle are good for smaller dinosaurs, whilst Shotgun, .700 double rifle and .50 sniper rifle are good for big prey, like T-Rex.Killing every dinosaur is rewarding not only mentally but earning XP and money too to level up and buy items. When you kill your first T-Rex alone or with others, it's a very good feeling, and leaves you wanting more. Overall I recommend this game to those who are patient and can apperciate a good looking game, where stealth and aiming your shots plays a huge role. As I said before, if you are into dinosaurs in any way, shape or form then this is a must buy. Please don't let the bad reviews put you off, there has been significant patching of the issues mentioned in them. The game is very enjoyable as of writing this.9/10

number of helpful: 9 of 17 people (53%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 1, 2016
												Hello, my name is Blackmagix95, and this is my review on TheHunter: Primal. I been playing this game ever since it was early access, and judging from my experience with the game, I recommend this game ONLY to people with a lot of patience and a sense of intelligence. Besides, most of the bad reviews on this game were made by players who played less than 30 hours or gave up on the game because the developers were barely adding content, even though they were working on new games like Mad Max or Just Cause 3. TheHunter: Primal is also nowhere near a survival game. It is more of a hunting stimulator, but with dinosaurs. If you really want a dinosaur survival game, go to freakin ARK. Last thing I want to see on the game's community discussions is more ARK favoritism and hateful rants.     Anyway, when I played the game at launch, I did had some terrible experiences with TheHunter Primal, but eventually I managed to learn from my mistakes and applied them to my skills.It is true, this is game is hard for new players but it is part of the learning process and requires patience. Once you begin the game, it is recommended that you find a group of people to hunt with, especially if one of them has experience with the game, but ASK FIRST. It is also important to put time into the game in order to have a basic idea on the game's mechanics and to understand the strengths/weaknesses of certain guns/weapons, the dinosaurs and their AI functions/behaviors, the hunting advantages/disadvantages in certain environments, and what parts of a dinosaur's body is best to shoot at. And lastly, do expect to walk a lot; the map layout is pretty big and there are some momemts where you don't run into many dinosaurs. That is where patience and intelligence is needed. If you can't dedicate the time to learn from the game, too impatient, or lack basic common sense, DON'T BUY THIS GAME. I used to join groups when I was a noob, but now I can solo-hunt with just a bow, a .44 magmum revolver and a machete/hatchet. Also, there are a lot of guides made to help new players out, and most of us pro-players are willing to provide tips/tricks for the game. Take advantage of them. Who knows... perhaps someday I may run into one of you new players. Do expect me to hunt naked since I got rid of all of my noble clothing to get more inventory space for stuff. DON'T DO THIS STUNT UNLESS YOU UNDERSTAND THE DINOSAURS. YOU WILL BE DINNER!

content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
												I went into this game after watching Jacksepticeye play it and i had high hopes for it: a dangerous planet full of dinosaur life and you must hunt while scavenging for suplies and survivng. While it sounds good on paper and sounds like it would be like the iOS game, Carnivores, this game is sadly a tedious attempt at a great game. Where Carnivores had good hunting strategies, sudden death as always a fear, fast travel, and a way to find your prey, this game lacks most of the listed. It is merely a running simulator, where you can literally press Q to automatically walk. The hunting system in the game is interesting to say the least. If you pick up on your prey's trail, you can actually track them on your device through their footprints and whatnot. The area is pretty well designed to say the least, giving the impression of a vast, open, and terrifying open world, but that is not the case. There are hardly any dinosaurs and the combat is done so♥♥♥♥♥♥poor its nearly impossible to kill any of the dinos. Not to mention walking around waiting for something to happen can get pretty tedious after a while. All in all, i would not recomend spending your money on this game. If you want to, then by all means go for it. Its not a terible game, but it will become boring.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 12, 2015
												I felt like I should write a review for this game.  First of all, I had a lot of fun playing it when it was first released.  The devs promised a lot more content, so I stuck around for a while.  I really love hunting games, and this game gave me dinos.  The AI at first was okay I guess, but barely realistic.  When the devs messed with the AI, the game became sort of broken.  Nothing was hard to kill anymore, even the trikes are stupid easy.  After I killed a rex with a bow, I got bored.  Almost 100 hours of mostly fun game time, though.  When this game becomes a three dollar sale, go for it.  Just know that it is very unlikely that this game will go anywhere.  ARK: Survival Evolved is taking over as the Dino Niche game for now.  I have that game, too.  It's much more fun, imo.  However, I can't REALLY say that I dont' reccommend the game...I can just say that it's not worth the current retail.  It's largely unfinished, and there are just too many bugs to make it a solid game.  Hope this helps.  Giving it a thumbs down over all, but wish I didn't have to.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Entered the game for the first time and decided to just run around to see a dino before playing seriously.After about five minutes of running around picking up rocks and scanning piles of dino-poo, I finally heard something unusual and turned around to see the male Utahraptor I had been tracking sprinting right at me.  Took me multiple times to figure out how to fire my bow but after four arrows and me crying like a little girl I finally killed the damn thing with a sliver of my own health left. ...Except I wasn't expecting the female to be right around the corner.  I managed to duck into the roots of an old tree fast enough to avoid being detected right as it ran by.  After accepting that my pants would be forever soiled I decided to play it ballsy and take on another Utahraptor with only a single arrow.  Three minutes of getting myself lined up later, I finally took what I thought to be my last shot before dying a violent death... Except the raptor dropped almost instantly.  Shot through the heart and got an insta-kill.  I'm not even mad that my butt got torn off by a T-Rex several minutes later while trying to find more ammo.  Worth it.Game needs some serious polishing still but shows a ton of promise for an early access game.  Would recommend.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2015
												Hi Everyone! I bought this game 100% random & out of bordom to find something new to play. Both me & my friend bought the game, downloaded it and started playing @ the same time. A few good things about this game is that 1.) it will keep you busy and curious looking for new items to make you a better and more effective hunter. 2.) the hunt can quickly get difficult to keep you on your toes and making sure you are making every shot count.. but there is also some cons I have ran across while playing the game thus far, Like simple bugs in multiplayer as well.. But nothing too bad to really effect your gameplay too much. there is a leveling system in the game as well as a store in game asking you if you would like to buy items you can get in the world with coin that you get for hunting down and killing dinos! the thing that I find painful and boring is that there is no other way to travel.. Basically you will be walking and running.. Hiding and etc.. CONSTANTLY.. No fast travel, No swimming & no cars etc to help you get around faster and your stamina is horrible.. But, with a game that will have you constantly running I think they should make it last longer than it does.. Also something that really bothers me in this game is the fact that it is a survival hunting game, But yet you don't have to worry about food, shelter or etc.. so the game is NOT so in depth.. it's straight to the point here aim and take your shot and claim your beautiful new trophy, That is the 1 and only point to this game! if your looking for a more realistic and more in depth exsperince this game may not be for you, also there is no ability to build or craft ANYTHING.. and there is not really a big variaty of weapons here either.. But honestly it's something to play when your bored. so, the main question you may be wanting to know here is: is the game worth the $29.99 asking price... NO! Save your money.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 8, 2015
												After playing this game for  quite some time, its time for me to update my review of it.The graphics and evniroment in the game are very very nice, in fact so much so that I have logged in at times just to get screenshots to use as desktop wallpapers. If you have a machine capable of reliably running this at the hightest settings, do so, its amazing!The gameplay is a mixed bag, there are issues like very low stamina and  lack of being able to swim for even a few feet or climb anything that put a lot of undue hardships on the player and kills what is otherwise a really nice immersion factor.The search for better gear is a bit tedious too and could have been handled a bit better.The actual hunting part of the game is quite enjoyable and is a nice mix of  fun and fear. The multiplayer modes are what you'd expect, PvP and PvE are both playable altho the hosting setup can be a bit buggy at times.The dinosaurs models are all very nice, altho the developers seem to have a feather fetish, and put them on damn near everything. The Dinosaur AI is.....well, OK at best and notably arfy at worst. At their best, the dinosaurs act like you would expect them to, nd its sometimes fun watching them from afar. I've seen a T-Rex seemingly following a heard of Trikes, and watched Utah raptors interacting with each other in a manner that seemed realistc. I would LOVE to see some actual dinosaur on dinosaur predation though, that would add immensly to the gameplay. On the other paw though, the dinosaurs seem to have senses and abilities that defy physics at times, able to climb terrain that they should not be able too, and detect things that they simply should not be able too see/smell/hear at times and be totaly blind to things they should be able to see/smell/hear at others. An animal the size of the quetzalcoatlus (as modeled ingame) should not be able to fly with a man sized object in its claws. They also have supernatural stamina, unlike the player, and can and will run clean across the damn island when wounded. Any animal that bleeds out to a noted point of say below 20% health should not be able to run for any notable distance....EVER! On the whole its still a fun game to play but the asking price is way too high. this is at best, a $20.00 us dollar game. Get it on sale, or part of a bundle and then its worth it.I would reccomend it conditionally, get it on sale, just don't pay full price for it.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 19, 2015
												I went into this game after watching Jacksepticeye play it and i had high hopes for it: a dangerous planet full of dinosaur life and you must hunt while scavenging for suplies and survivng. While it sounds good on paper and sounds like it would be like the iOS game, Carnivores, this game is sadly a tedious attempt at a great game. Where Carnivores had good hunting strategies, sudden death as always a fear, fast travel, and a way to find your prey, this game lacks most of the listed. It is merely a running simulator, where you can literally press Q to automatically walk. The hunting system in the game is interesting to say the least. If you pick up on your prey's trail, you can actually track them on your device through their footprints and whatnot. The area is pretty well designed to say the least, giving the impression of a vast, open, and terrifying open world, but that is not the case. There are hardly any dinosaurs and the combat is done so♥♥♥♥♥♥poor its nearly impossible to kill any of the dinos. Not to mention walking around waiting for something to happen can get pretty tedious after a while. All in all, i would not recomend spending your money on this game. If you want to, then by all means go for it. Its not a terible game, but it will become boring.

												After playing this game for  quite some time, its time for me to update my review of it.The graphics and evniroment in the game are very very nice, in fact so much so that I have logged in at times just to get screenshots to use as desktop wallpapers. If you have a machine capable of reliably running this at the hightest settings, do so, its amazing!The gameplay is a mixed bag, there are issues like very low stamina and  lack of being able to swim for even a few feet or climb anything that put a lot of undue hardships on the player and kills what is otherwise a really nice immersion factor.The search for better gear is a bit tedious too and could have been handled a bit better.The actual hunting part of the game is quite enjoyable and is a nice mix of  fun and fear. The multiplayer modes are what you'd expect, PvP and PvE are both playable altho the hosting setup can be a bit buggy at times.The dinosaurs models are all very nice, altho the developers seem to have a feather fetish, and put them on damn near everything. The Dinosaur AI is.....well, OK at best and notably arfy at worst. At their best, the dinosaurs act like you would expect them to, nd its sometimes fun watching them from afar. I've seen a T-Rex seemingly following a heard of Trikes, and watched Utah raptors interacting with each other in a manner that seemed realistc. I would LOVE to see some actual dinosaur on dinosaur predation though, that would add immensly to the gameplay. On the other paw though, the dinosaurs seem to have senses and abilities that defy physics at times, able to climb terrain that they should not be able too, and detect things that they simply should not be able too see/smell/hear at times and be totaly blind to things they should be able to see/smell/hear at others. An animal the size of the quetzalcoatlus (as modeled ingame) should not be able to fly with a man sized object in its claws. They also have supernatural stamina, unlike the player, and can and will run clean across the damn island when wounded. Any animal that bleeds out to a noted point of say below 20% health should not be able to run for any notable distance....EVER! On the whole its still a fun game to play but the asking price is way too high. this is at best, a $20.00 us dollar game. Get it on sale, or part of a bundle and then its worth it.I would reccomend it conditionally, get it on sale, just don't pay full price for it.

Posted: April 1, 2015
												The idea was good, but the delivery not so much.For a hunting game, the handling of the gun is no where near good. Must of the time you can only shoot one bullet by 2-3 seconds.... and I talk about hand gun here. No change in behavior when a dino get shoot. You cannot stop theyre attack.The bird kill you one shot. Most dino have too much Hp. Dont get me wrong, they are dino, but with 2 shotgun at pointblank range, we only manage to scare away a triceratops... who just don't charge...  They are big coward. (and don't think about tracking them you will surely die from a bird attack or just never see him again)A lot of frustration await you if you buy this game.Yes this game can be save, but it will need a lot of polishing.Me ? Im done with raging, going for a next game.

												Well now that it's not early access, it still kind of sucks. Honestly, if you're looking for a good dinosaur survival game, this is not one you should purchase. It has some ups and downs, like any game will, but this game is just not fun. You run around trying to find better crap, but die trying because all you have to defend yourself is a machete. By the time you're able to purchase the next weapon (a hand gun) you will have probably invested more time into the game than you should of. Unless you really feel that this game would be fun to you, save the money.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								Really enjoying this game, always was interested in a Day Z like game but zombies are realitively easy to deal with. Having to deal with 5 raptors stalking you and avoiding trex's however isn't so simple. This game requires some patience to learn, and it's all about being stealthly.I'm enjoying the pvp aspect of it the game as well, and for those of you who aren't into that you can disable the pvp altogether and enjoy the co-operative nature of the game. Definitely grab the four pack with friends.There's nothing quite like silently walking through the forest, running into another team of players and hell breaks loose. Half your team is dead, the other team is in the same rough state, and from all the gun shots you attract 3 raptors and a trex on what's left.The game can go from relaxing to very tense in just a matter of minutes.Yes I wished there was more dinosaurs, yes there are bugs, but it's a very enjoyable expierence and they went with the most interesting dinosaurs first. I would expect more species to come in future dlcs which I will happily purchase.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2015
												{ A big pre-review what to expect in the game }First time i bought this game i quited in RAGE just because i didnt understand it. But after giving it 5th try i saw LOVE in my eyes. This game is so hard but so rewarding when you do your first kill of a Raptor, Rex or any other dinos in the world. Sneaking following trails with your ipod-map (not sure what to call it really lol but its your best friend) is so scary sometimes when you can hear a REX or Raptor closing in.This game is all about survival in a land where dinos rule land and air. So being a hunter you are also the hunted. This game is by no reason EASY it shuldnt its all about survival in the unfriendly island as a hunter.You start by landing by a pod randomly each time on the island. You start only with a machette and a uncovered map. So the first goal is to search for hidden chests in old bases or randomly placed over island. Do note that you will not allways find a weapon or ammo. Somtiems its just a map fragment or cammo clothes.If you are lucky you will find pistols,  rifles, bows, small bit of ammo and even health if you are lucky. The most important many seems to forget is that there is cammo clothes. They can make big impact how long you can survive. Crawling with a cammo can manke life changes many times when predators are close by.The only negative i have to say is that I dont understand why you cant jump up on cliffs or any other stuff like on bases roof? I would love if there was some sort of safe areas where you could SAVE your loot and equipments. Now you have to quit game for it to save it. Safe areas could also be used to discuss with all other human hunters in your game. Plan a REX hunt or any other specified animal. This could then be setup by a ADMIN if there was such controlls.End words, you get the most out of this game by playing online with friends. Singleplayer can be SAFE but its way harder. The forum community shines. So dont be affraid to ask anything. GFx: 9-10SFx: 8-10Gameplay: 7-10 (why cant you JUMP?)Scary YES worth it YES. Recommended all the way. Go for it!.. I still sleep with eyes WIDE open after hearing loud footsteps lol  :)

content:
Posted: August 28, 2015
												Ok, so this game as an early access game was super impressing. It was new with a surprisingly familiar feel to it, and was superior to most other dinosaur games of that time. But several months after being available at the store, it was soon revealed to be "finished" and was somewhat abandoned with a lousy variety of 5 dinosaurs. It is true that during the early hours of the game are great fun and a good challenge, even to the seasoned gamer (unlike myslef XD) however after a few hours of similar game play, wandering through the forests with nothing but a machete and getting killed by the same sodding species of dinosaur (the Utahraptor) I truly grew bored. I would definitely reccomend ARK Survival Evolved over this game. It is truly a greater experiance and provides better gameplay. 6/10

content:
Posted: December 11, 2016
												I think this game gets a bit too much hate. I personally think it's pretty good, but I can sure see where some of the complaints come from. The game isn't updated by the devs (at the current date of 12-11-16) which can be a big negative. Pros:- Good graphics, they look nice and pretty, and some of the scenery is pretty great.- There's a wide weapon variety to use to hunt dinosaurs down with.- The game also sounds well. You can easily tell the direction of dinosaurs, and identify which they are.- Multiplayer works well and is fun. Teamwork is highly recommended due to the dangers the game has. I've also had no issues with lag or bad pin.- The game is also quite welly optimized. I had no frame drops in my time playing it.Cons:- As of 12-11-16, the devs are no longer adding content, but they have done a bugfix update a few months ago.- There's a low variety of dinosaurs to hunt. I'd say the game needs about 3-4 more, and then it would be enough.- 1 map isn't really enough for the game. It needs 2 maps at least, althought 3 would be quite nice!I think this game gets more hate then it needs. I got this game for 10 dollars. It used to cost 20 dollars. At 20 dollars, this game isn't worth it, but at 10, I think it has aroud enough to justify the price tag.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												This is a strange one, its difficult, frustrating and downrght annoying but can be compelling and thrilling at the same time.  I have however wasted many hours in the persuit of avoiding large dinosaurs intent on eating me.  The worlld is beautiful with a cycling day, rain, storms, fog etc, you can spend hours wandering around the huge island with lush landscapes just admiring the view if it were not for the nasty reptiles hunting you.  And they do hunt and smell and follow and flank.  All very clever stuff.  It is not a finished game and needs more to do, more dinosaurs and a purpose but I love it, it makes me thing, anyone looking for a shooter type experience will not find this enjoyable, its slow paced, guns and ammunition are scarce and even when you do amass weaponry, dying - which you do frequently, will be lost and you have to re track to the point of dying to retrieve, another game in itself.  I can understand why its not universally liked but what it doies it does well, occasional blips and the odd bug but nothing serious and stable as hell on a lan.Highly recommended as is but in anticipation of more dinosaurs to come and NOT chargeable dlc please.

number of helpful: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 18, 2015
Early Access Review
 The Hunter: Primal Early Access Review  Positives	- Dinosaur's are highly detailed,fitting Sound and movement animations ( since last patch)-Terrain is absolutely beautiful (set to max resolution)-The majority of the community is friendly, and willing to help out a hunter in need of assistance.-The Terrain is large and comfortable size, your stamina recovery rate is just perfect to make sure you can run and keep an eye out for predators.- Weapon sound and animation's are spot on- gives you a customizable option to wear selected camo such as Merc Spec - Ops, Noble Gear, Settler gear etc.They've included feathers on the dinosaurs (which personally i have really enjoyed as it gives them such a unique look like no other dinosaur game has done, like the Utahraptor has an amazing look thanks to the Feather pattern. negatives	- Have encountered a few pesky,annoying bugs.-If you fall in the water, you cant swim out and you have to helplessly watch yourself drown...-Game has crashing issues, however they are working towards fixing that and so far there has been a drastic improvement.-Some dinosaur spawn point's are glitched - Take for example i joined a game and had three T - Rex's in the area, I did not survive as expected.-inventory space is quite small, hence you will have to be very careful as to what you keep in your inventory because take for example if a t rex is charging at you from a distance you will want to start shooting at it with your scope, but when he gets closer you would like to switch to iron sight but you may have a full inventory space so you would have had to drop it..-Some dinosaurs get stuck in the terrain, which is rather unfortunate in my opinion. My Summary	i am going to write from an honest point here, i think the game is absolutely brilliant, The Dev's love the community and are willing to help the community in any way. Playing with other hunters is a must do, because sometimes you can get yourself into a really sticky situation it's always best to have someone watch your back.Some situations can be so intense for example hiding under a bush when a T Rex is standing right next to you.Or the absolutely wonderful feeling you get when you find a .700, or noble gear for example.Even walking halfway across the map to meet up with your fellow hunter just gives you this great feeling of relief and joy.For an early access game, i say this is a MUST PLAY! so go on, get the game - support the devs they really do deserve the support!Thank You

content:
Posted: September 13, 2015
												This is quite possibly the worst 20 dollars i have ever spent on a game. I have reasons why i don't reccomend this game.1. as soon as you spawn in and get your machete you think your fine. wrong you walk 50 feet and raptors kill you.2. thier are only 5 dinosaurs in the game and all of them except 1 cant be killed with the machete.3. the developers do not give two ♥♥♥♥♥ about this game anymore thier has yet to be any content changes since i bought the game 6 months ago.4. this game is filled with bugs to were dinosaurs hit you from ridiculous distances and dinosaurs getting stuck.5. your stamina is pointless you swing a machete 3 times and your guy gets tired. you sprint for 5 seconds and you guy gets tired.6. you just got done fighting a T-rex and climbing a volcano to a base and whats your prize hmmmm ♥♥♥♥ing nothing just same old♥♥♥♥♥♥that you already have.7. why is this labled a survival game when their is no thirst, hunger, injury, or weather effects, i want to feel like i truly need to survive.These are just a few reasons why i hate this game. Now onto what the game is good for.1. the environment of the game makes you actually feel alone just hearing the growls of raptors you can't see.2. it was a good idea making a challenging game that encouraged you to take risks and hunt danagerous dinosaurs.3. the use of team work in this game is important always have a buddy never go alon i like that aspect.unfortunaley these are the only good things about the game yeah i could say it looks good if it were 2012 but its no it looks average, but no i do not reccomend this ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game

content:
Posted: January 18, 2016
I came, I saw, I killed queens.I can't say that I strongly recommend this game, but that doesn't mean that I don't recommend it at all. For those who are interested in hunting, tracking, dinosaurs, and cooperation read on. The game is far from perfect and at times there are graphical issues that I do feel shouldn't be a part of a 'finished' game. When you use 'x' to free look for example, you can see through your character models body. It isn't a terrible issue that makes the game unplayable by any means, but you can't help but feel like that was something that the developers just decided to leave as is, instead of cleaning up the code and flushing it all out. I've also felt this unfinished feeling when a raptor charges me only to get glitched into a rock or the surrounding environment.The auto run feature, which you use by pressing 'q', is an amazing implementation and I wish more games would incorporate such (listen up DayZ devs, I'm shouting in your direction). If you like dinosaurs, the hunting experience and are able to handle some wandering around across a pretty large map this game is exactly what you are looking for. It is difficult, however, so be forewarned that nothing about this game is easy...especially if you are after the queen rex. I spent about 45 minutes hunting my first rex with a buddy of mine and this was both a stressful and satisfying experience that most games don't offer. The actual feeling of accomplishment upon taking down such a large and terrifying creature was worth the pain staking game of peek-a-boo we played while implementing strategical shots to the beasts vitals. I personally enjoy the hell out of this game. The display chart of where you hit the beast is an exceptionally well done & very rare feature of the shooter genre. You want to go for the vital organs as headshots on dinos don't do too much damage. Remember how they have tiny brains? To top off the chart, it shows who did what, how many shots you each hit the dinosaur with and where. (ex: the lungs, the kidneys, the heart, the spine, intestines, liver, body shots, etc.) and then it continues to break up the stats into a nice percentage read out. For example with the t rex we took down, I dealt 88% of the total damage and was able to see my shots highlighted on an x-ray chart of the dino, likewise, my buddies fired shots that hit and overall damage (22%) were displayed. You then get to take a screenshot of your accomplishments for all to see. You are able to determine your location and meet up with other players via the GPS that you spawn with. Yes, you can place markers on important locations and yes there is a distance displayed on all your squad mates so you can spread out and cover more ground. As you roam, keep the GPS equipped in your left hand and search for others dead bodies and loot spawns. The GPS is also an incredibly valuable tool with which you will be able to track dinosaurs and recieve updated information about them (their species, their sex, etc.) You will also be able to tell how damaged a beast is that you have already wounded, what % of life they have left and where you hit them.The weapon selection/dino variety is limited (I believe that there are only five dino species at the moment, all of which are aggressive, even the herbivores) and this is something else that makes the game feel slightly unfinished  -- lack of content -- You can find clothing that increases your ability to hide (ghilly hats, shirt, pants, etc.) but again, there aren't many customization options for your character. There are a few attatchments you can add to weapons, only optics related: red dot, scope with zoom, etc.  No suppressors or compensators, extended magazines, flashlights, etc. A couple weapons I've used so far include the .308 single shot pistol, the .700, the shotgun with slugs ammo type, the .308 rifle with scope, the riot shotgun, the assault rifle and the anti .308 along with the bow and arrow setup. I know that a .50 cal sniper rifle is in the game, but I've had no interest in using it after having the .700.There are dinosaur calls used to attract certain breeds and you can use dino eggs to cover your scent. You will find mushrooms littered throughout Eden, but be cautious as they can lead to death!Two of last things I'd like to touch upon are the graphics and the audio of this game. The vegatation/forestation is epic. The night to day transistions are graceful and seem wonderfully natural. The dinosaur models are quite detailed. The weather effects are something to pay attention to as the rain/fog cuts your vision. It becomes crucial to be able to listen in the distance for the raptors calling to each other and planning their attack(s) or to hear the mild thunder of a Rex off in the distance looking for prey.Final Word:Pick the game up when it is on sale, don't expect a "Triple A" experience, and don't play it alone. If you aren't into dinosaurs, hunting, or co-op don't bother.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Game has potential and i love theHunter original game, however at this point its not a good game its a how long untill you die game.  Graphics look great like the original, sounds are cool and imursive which is what you want.  The gameplay not so much.  You start off with just a bow and 5 arrows in a world that currently only has tricerotops which act like deer when you get close and tyranasaurus and raptors.  Now thats all cool and dandy but the fact your suppose to find better gear in this huge world with only 5 arrows to start and your surronded by these predators makes for very not fun gameplay.  No matter where you spawn there willl be either a raptor or trex near by, no joke.  also one major bug ive noticed is when you attack a raptor pack (yes i said pack they are never alone) if they kill you that same group will stalk right to you when you respawn. NO JOKE, try it attack one group die and start walking and you'll noticed there is a group stalking you.  If  you had better gear id accpet that but 5 arrows folks thats it. Also attacking is not easy you can shoot your 5 arrows into a raptor and he still will not go down, which make self deffense very hard to do when hes attacking.  And running away lol come on be realistic.It has Potential but at this point its more frustrating then fun, i'm still giving it a positive review because i have high hopes for it, and i know what they did with the original hunter so *fingers crossed*

number of helpful: 17 of 35 people (49%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 13, 2015
												I honestly wanted to be able to recommend this game, but I just can't. Not as it is right now.The level system is an interesting concept, even though it's only a means of artificial prolongation, however... You need to be level 10 before you can even buy a pistol, which means you're stuck with a bow until then, and I had enough money to buy 15 pistols by the time I was ALLOWED to buy one (even though I also feel the pistol is over priced for what it offers). "But you can find guns in crates and sparse ammo" True, that is something you can do, but as it stands right now over almost 12 hours I've encountered more T-rex than ANY, OTHER, SPECIES, PERIOD. (And 90% of the time there's been one OR TWO T-rex in one of the limited areas where a gun is likely to spawn.) Currently, the rex tanks bullets from anything like a massive sponge. Shoot it in the brain, heart, lungs, intestines, doesn't matter; takes 30 or more shots to bring it down. Add with that the extremely clunky mechanics or firing and it does nothing but frustrate the hell out of you. They also camp on your body after killing you and if you're close enough to hear their footsteps then they're already walking towards you. They haven't noticed you, yet, but they will. Even walking they move faster than you, try to run and they'll see you, lay still and they'll walk up and stomp you to death; so you can forget about going back to your body to get your gear. - The level system needs to be rebalanced, badly.- T-rex are entirely too hard to kill, a dozen 12 gauge slugs to the chest, at least half to the lungs and heart, doesn't even phase it. Same with buck shot and .308, currently they just soak whatever you throw at them and refuse to die until you've emptied clip after clip into their organs. (Though I will admit I haven't tried the .700 or .50 cal yet, mainly because I'm not allowed to even buy one...)-There are only 4 species currently, and of those expect to see more T-rex than any other species hands down. In order of frequency, from most to least, I encountered: T-rex, Utah raptors, Triceratops, Velociraptors. They both need more variance and need to rebalance how many there are. I've run into 2 T-rex in one place at least 5 times; that's just silly. - You move so slow. SOOOOOOOOO slow. Stamina runs out very fast, regenerates rather slowly, takes you forever to get where you want to go only to run into a T-rex and die instantly. Well, not instantly, it SEES you instantly, then you empty every single round you have into it, face, chest, intestines, whatever tickles your fancy; then it eats you. - Audio, especially the rain, cuts in and out frequently. Textures also act very weird, mainly trees when they're on the edge of rendering distance. Trees looking like they're made out of netting is the best way I can describe it. Once you get close it fixes but during play it's no bueno. There are a lot of negatives about this game right now, it's glaringly obvious how unfinished it is, and that's fine. It's early access, that's what you should come to expect, but it is NOT worth buying in its current state unless you are an incredibly patient person. The game looks pretty good, it might give you some feelings of nostalgia if you played Carnivores when you were younger, but that's about it. (There's also no trophy room, like we had in Carnivores, and I feel like that would be a great addition.) I've tried really hard to like it, and been nothing but frustrated the entire time. Most of this stuff can be fixed, and hopefully it will, but like any early access game it's a gamble. It feels like a pre-alpha at the moment with the horrendous balancing and lack of content. If you like the game as it stands and think I'm being too harsh, I'm happy for you, you're a more patient person than I am, but I experienced 11 hours of frustration and maybe 30 minutes of enjoyment.TL;DR: As it is now, I strongly feel it's not worth buying. Wait until it's more polished, if it ever is, and since you don't know if it will be that's why it's not wise to buy into it now. It's extremely frustrating and there's a distinct lack of anything resembling entertaining content at the moment. Save your money for when it's more polished (again, if it ever is) or go spend it on a game which won't make you want to throw things out the window.UPDATE: Still poop. Only now it's "officially released" poop.
