number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Survival isn't easy at the best of times, even less so against ravenous Dinosaurs. So don't expect an easy ride here.There are a number of complaints I'm seeing in the review that suggest to me that most people are out of their comfort zones with this game.I'll say this; This game is awesome and compelling but not the sort of thing you should expect to be great at right away!When I first began I got mauled by a T-rex within about an hour. Then I met the Raptors and got eaten alive. Slowly but surely I got the hang of the noises they make, their movement patterns and how to use my inventory effectively.I treated it like a Rogue-like and got better as I went on, I'm now playing on a file where I'm armed to the teeth and still going after several hours of surviving! It feels great to have gotten to this stage.I don't usually do this but I'll lay out a few pros and cons for this game as there are a few things I feel could use some polish to really put the cherry on this tasty Dino-cake;Pros:1) Huge, lush, GORGEOUS environment with varied lighting and weather.2) Intelligent, smoothly animated Dinos with unique features and weak points.3) Easy to use inventory system4) Feathered, (almost) accurate dinosaurs! At last!5) Raptor selfies! (Trophy shot option)Cons and nitpicks:1) Some dodgy sound transitions, especially when approaching the beach. The ocean sounds don't fade in very well.2) Online features could be better implemented. Not a huge problem for me though as I prefer to play solo anyway!3) NOT ENOUGH DINOSAUR SPECIES!! Come on guys, this is my main complaint.I love this experience as it is but seriously; ONE herbivore type? Hell just stick some un-killable Sauropods in there if you must but please add some more to the roster. T-rex and two types of Raptor is challenging and cool but again a bit more variety would be nice.So, in conclusion:This is a great survival game if you can cope with its tough difficulty curve. It's a genuine pleasure to master it but time and patience is required; for tough-guy shooty action, look elsewhere.I can't think of a better single player Dinosaur experience on Steam at the moment and my only reall issue is with the severely limited variety of Dinosaurs in the game.Add some more herbivores and perhaps one new mid-sized carnivore and this would be a must -have.[EDIT] With reguards to 'Game breaking bugs' people have found so far, it's poor form for a dev to have left so many in there at release. However, my review doesn't mention them as I have had the good fortune not to have encountered any of them in my playthroughs!This review is my opinion based on my experiences playing the game, if you don't like it, that's cool. You'll have to excuse my ''Glass half full'' attitude.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
												Let me start by saying that based on what i can tell about this specific title it's a bare bones EA title that was labeled as finished prematurely. The game is for all intent and purposes D-E-A-D! The reason i say this is due to the fact that it was released as a supposed "finished" product before any of the promises were even made, updates are almost non-existant, any bugs from when it was EA and labeled as finished were never fixed, in addition to the fact that the amount of content in this game is 5 dinos and a massive forest.Granted the world and the dino models are beautifully done, and i admittedly haven't played much of this specific title it is good as a generic time waster while waiting for an update on steam to download. Other then that, you're better off spending money on stranded deep or even the isle then this one.

												This game is alot of fun,especially with 3-6 or more players. However, when there are that many players competing for the sparse amount of ammo it presents an unwanted competition. content:
Posted: May 6, 2015
												I do not recommend getting this game as it is now. However if its on sale definatly check it out and to support the developers. (Its also a lot better to play with friends)The only thing I really dont get is that this is a full release, but really it should still be in Alpha.Alpha is mainly the additions being added to the game.Beta is mainly the fixing of bugs and glitchs from those additions, etc.It seems like the devs are doing both of these at the same time in a scatterbrain sorta way.Pros:-Open world-Great Graphics-Amazing Sounds-Easy Controls-Nice dino animations (can be a little glitchy at times)-Co-op and multiplayer is fun and smooth (depending on host)Cons:-Many bugs-Can't swim-Cant climb/Jump-Cant build/place anything, not even traps-Only 5 dino types in the world-Weight system is very limited (leaning more towards realism)As for the content in the game so far, its quite playable but limited in the variety of dinos to hunt.there are lots of different "biomes" and areas to explore in the world.I would love to see more herbivores added as there is only one. The ratio is 4:1 (5:1 counting pvp) so be very cautious this is a survival game that relays on your senses and judgement for life or death. Tip:If its storming out, wait it out. A T-Rex came charging at me full speed and I couldn't react becuase visability was so low. Nearly had a heart attack.Verdict 6.5/10Playble, fun online and rewarding (when you finally get that T-rex down)

content:

Early Access Review
								Yes, I do recomend this game but there are a few thing's that are coolGoodFun to roam around with some friend's and lootGreat graphics in my opinonLove the theme.It's fun all around.Bad-The Utahraptor's alway's seem to stay in the same area that your in. I know that they can smell and everything. But it doesn't really help sitting in a tree Prone for like 30 mins just to walk around and do the same thing.-The T-Rex seems to be a ninja some time's just randomly knowing where your at.-I like the bow and everything but it' not that good. I can see that you dont want it to be too OP. But when you first play the game and the raptor's or the T-Rex's are right next to you it does not help. I could run around stop for about 20 seconds while walking and be able to run again another mile.I still love this game even if this happens. I have the highest of hopes for this game. number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 9, 2015
												Save yourself $32 CAD, and go buy Ark: Survival Evolved.theHunter: Primal was released before the defined date by the developers. The intentionally cut the game short to release "version 1.0" which only has five dinosaur species. It honestly sounds like the game isn't getting anymore major patches either.Defeinitely disppointed in the developers.Pros:DinosaursActual hunting mechanics. Shoot a vital organ? Does more damage. Too many bad shots? You ruin the trophy.A very realistic game. You need to camoflauge, and survive against the dinosaurs. They'll also actively look for you through scene.Multiplayer is generally a friendly community.Cons:There's no more major updates as it looks like. Which effectively kills the game.Each "pro" factor mentioned above is fun for about an hour or two, until it gets boring.The game can be fun if you play multiplayer, otherwise you're going to get bored quickly.Progression system sucks to begin with. You are given a makeshift machete, and will have to die repeatedly, maybe getting a kill in to progress. You progress by killing dinosaurs. If a dinosaur takes too much damage, it will run. It will run faster than you, and thus your melee attacks will render you incapable of getting a kill, halting your progression before it starts.Would not recommend. I did a first-impression to the game if anyone is interested.

content:

												There really should be a third option for whether or not you recommend the game. That third option should be 'Meh'.  I do enjoy playing this game but I find myself spending more time retrieveing my corpses than I do hunting. The Devs really should fix the level requirements for purchasing weapons when you die, for example, the first hunting rifle you can purchase requires level 30. Hence, spending most of your time retrieving your corpse to recover any decent weapons you've already found. I really don't see myself playing this game long enough to hit level 30 as it is now.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
												Yes this game has bugs, yes this game has glitches. But its still in development, and as far as i know, hasnt been dropped by developers. One of the only downside to this game is the lack of content; dinos and weapons. the lack of dinos makes this game a little repetitive and quite boring if on your own. But this game is great with friends, you get the thrill and excitement of having a t-rex hunting you down, but the boring travelling or stalking parts are contered by being with mates.   Dinos become less of a problem as you learn to be able to escape and evade them, and once you have learnt where to shoot certain dinos, all weapons become very good, and not underpowered as some people mention.Overall, this game is worth the £7, especially if you have friends who will join you. The thrill of managing to stalk a trike, and the accomplishment of killing it with a single arrow will makeme smile any day. And the ability to hide under a Rex's or Utahs nose without being killed is a nervous ordeal which makes this game play incredibly enjoyable. and not to mention the lush surroundings and fliping creapy calls and growls from certain dino's.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 19, 2016
												I played for about two hours and got killed zillion times. You can't enjoy the game if it keeps killing you every 10 minutes. How it goes: at first you have your machete and you walk around with it. Then you see a dinosaur and you die. The End. Ok, that's what's going on most of the time. I do managed to kill one utharaptor with my rusty machete, and then i bought bow. And I was thinking "oh my, at last i can shoot at things!", but then i had to exit the game (lunch time) and when i ran it again - my bow was GONE. It seems if you have something, you must use it right away to earn more money. Yeah... then i tried to kill another utharaptor with my machete so I could buy another bow, but i just died, died and died... If you're theHunter or Carnivores fan - I DO NOT recommend it. Avoid it at all costs. But if you have masochistic needs... go on, buy it. Graphics and sounds ar nice. Yeah, those are really nice. 4/10

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 14, 2015
												Okay the first thing I want to say about this game is that it's clearly had a LOT of work put into it, Incredibly beautiful veiws on the island, the detail in graphics in this game is second to none !! don't take my word for it, go ahead and buy it and see for yourself !! I sat watching the sky for like 2 mins just because I was literally like dammmmnnnn at how amazing the thunder and lightning storm looked !! this is without mentioning how real the dinosaurs in this game look, havent played a survival game for a while now thats had me so drawn in, YES it can be tricky to start out in this game but be patient ! Its so tense laying on the ground at the edge of a tree line looking out onto a big opening and seeing a Tyranosaurus slowly step by step getting closer and closer, do you shooot ? do you run ? or do you lay still??? this game is constantly making you think and I for one LOVE how they achieve that, the online playis also very good teaming up with other players to track dino's down together. Hard to stop bigging this game up as im addicted to it it really is fantastic !! to sum it up then id give this game a solid 9/10 and I highly doubt we will see a better Survival game of this kind for years to come ......

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2015
												I started playing this game a few weeks ago and began liking it. The game is enjoyable in single player or multiplayer and the progression of items and levelling provides incentives for progression. The difficulty is a strong draw for me (though other players may not like intense difficulty). However, the numerous string of bugs that have gone on unfixed (after reading well before I started playing) is frustrating. Of note the recurring issues I experienced were: inventory items not saving, level progression not being saved, frequent game crashes/false starts. More frustrating however is the reaction the devs have to constructive feed back - no responses/acknowledgements nor plans for fixes. The patches target minor glitches that rarely negatively impact the player base -or- increase content. Content increases aren't a bad thing at all, but when there are no published plans or discussions for fixing major game issues it's a problem because it indicates that fixing major issues is not a priority. Further, it appears that efforts to discuss these issues are censored from their discussion forums as numnerous posts I have made (and others read) were subsequently deleted within a day of writing. The posts were professional and constructive in nature and contained no derrogatory language.Note: The discussion forums are moderated to not allow negative discussion of game facets (even in a professional and constructive manner).

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												I have played this game fpr awhile now and I have decided it was worth my money. There is no sub fee or any way to use real money to become better then others. There are only 3 dinasaurs at the moment but they all provide a challenge. The utahraptors travel in pack usually. Sometimes you'll find one alone. The Triceratops wont attack unless you get to close or attack it. And they are hard to kill. The T-REX is difficutlt but not impossible. When dinasaurs get hurt badly they run away or attempt to. Thats what the T-REX did it ran because it was near death. I almost killed it but didn't happen. The game has around 6 or 7 guns. You do have to find all your weapons and when you die you do start over but its a survival game. I rate it a 9/10 in early acess. I will update this later.12/19/2014-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------So i'm back! I started playing this game again and I have to say they added a lot of new things. You now get currency when killing dinosaurs and you also level up. Now you can buy items depending on your level and the dinos you've killed. They have also added quite a few dinosaurs and it feels just like the hunter now.2/4/2016-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

												A wonderful gem of a game that is allot of fun to play. A mature aproach to hunting is required to benifit from the true elements of this game. Some claim the developers abandoned the game unfinished. That is not true. The game is in its finished state and is perfectly fine the way it is. It is better to leave it alone than to ruin a game with over development. Appreciate the fact this game will run on any pc and looks gorgeous. Its fun to just explore and take photos as it is to hunt dinos or humans. The PVP or PVE option will accomodate those who enjoy having thier stuff still in inventory should you quit and rejoin later. This is a wonderful game that is a true classic deserving of your collection. Everyone also google search " A gun for dinosaur.mp3 x-1" and listen to it before or during your first game. Happy hunting.

content:
Posted: January 18
												Positives;Hello all, Firstly I would recommend this game to anyone, I have so much fun its crazy, I've meet alot of great people and had alot of fun with them,(not like other on-line games), You can either sneak around and search for loot boxes and dodge the beasts (isn't easy) or you can go straight out and track, hunt and kill, or shoot what ever you see and trust me, finding a beast to shoot at is easy as there is plenty around, while looting you dont always get what you want but it can't be too easy can it, I mean we are hunting Dinosours after all, lol. Secondly, The story line is easy, you have been sent there to clear the land so it can be colinized,(simple hey), I've played over 100 hours and I still havn't been all over the map so there is still plenty for me to see, Usually I'm to busy hunting to explore but that would depend on your mood at the time I guess. As you progress though the levels you can buy bigger and better guns (which isn't needed but makes for some fun), Unless your a bad shot like me,lmao. Cheers to all who make the game possible as I will play till I can't. also there is pvp mode, player verse player, if your into that. The game it self is an open world so you can go anywhere you want and I just love it.Negatives;There has been some issues in-game but have been worked out (well for me there all good now after the new patch). So yea, buy it, play it, survive it, hunt em, kill em, lol. Cheers.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								First Impressions:The ambience and scenery are nice, though they could admittedly be a bit better and more realistic.  At present there are only three dinosaurs with two more coming...not exactly a wide variety.  In addition to more dinosaur types, I'd like to see a survival element added to the game (hunger, thirst, etc.) that could be toggled on or off since some hate mixing and matching hunting and survival.  The stamina bar runs out a bit too quickly for my taste as the average human being can sprint longer than say, two to three seconds.  With all of that said, the idea of hunting dinos is a rather appealing notion and I can't wait to see what else gets added over the course of development.  The price will increase at launch, so either buy it now or wait for a sale if money is tight.

content:
Posted: April 9, 2015
												As early access, this game was great.  Updates kept adding good things to the game, like new weapons, better dino behaviors and looks, the leveling system, etc.  It was shaping up to something good.  Then they decided to declare it done and release it... and added quetzalcoatlus.  Quetzalcoatlus is just buggy as hell, ridiculously overpowered and aggressive, hovers over everything and anything of importance, and it clips through the ground to pick you up, making it impossible to shoot at it as it comes down to swoop you off [you have a limit of how far you can aim up and down].  Just... avoid it.  Avoid it at all cost.  If you do feel adventurous, then wait for it to be on sale.

Early Access Review
								Love this game! lots of friendly players (as long as you dont play PVP ofcourse!), and lots of unfriendly dinos! to be an early acces game i think its incredible and still has lots of potential!it can be a little too tough start, when you have no camo clothes (so every predator sees you insanely easily), and a bow, but as soon as you understand how things works and whatnot its awesome!Ofcourse its a lot more fun to play with friends, since its kinda hard to communicate ingame (except writing in chat) and sometimes you just dont have time to write that a pack of raptors or a T-rex in coming straight for us and how to attack or where to hide.The one most annoying thing tough, is that there arent alot of game hosts, so when playing with friends there can be hard to find servers with space for all of us. content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												Hunt, Explore, Survive? More like Die to invulnerable dinos, Wander aroudn the same area, and have zero threat or challenge untill a flying trex comes down a mountain and lands on your face. A quick push out of a game, cheaply done in a VERY small amount of time, the EA lasted like four months in total, theres only 5 types of dinosaur in the game. There is zero "surviving" in this game, you just run around with weapons and either die to a dino, or kill it. There is no hunger, no building, no crafting, no traps, thers NOTHING! The amount of bugs is insane, flying Trex, yeah seems legit to me. I cant believe this company is pulling this and I will never support them again. There is no ♥♥♥♥ing content in this game, you wander around an island and shoot♥♥♥♥♥♥at dinosaurs who kill you 9/10 times because of zero balance, AND THATS ALL THERE IS TO DO. They promised it was P2P and that there wouldnt be subs or micro transactions, thats because they planned on releasing a half done game and calling it done, and then releasing weapons and dino DLC packs to once again nickle and dime their ♥♥♥♥ing customers, what a ♥♥♥♥ing joke I cant believe I fell for this scam.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Don't worry it doesn't have the same micro transactions as theHunter does. It's a one-time payment with no purchasing of guns in a store for real money. The game in its current state seems alright. It has some connectivity issues and some crashing. These are to be expected in an early alpha build. There are only 3 species to hunt atm, Triceratops, T-rex and Raptors. The AI seems to be iffy at times. They will stand around taking shots before they start attacking you or they will just out right not see you sometimes. But when the AI works it's terrifying. The raptors hunt in packs, both the T-rex and raptor will stalk you. The survival aspect isn't much yet. You don't have to worry about starvation or thirst. You can't craft weapons or anything yet. You basically survive by not being eaten. But they could extend on this as time goes on. If you are the least bit interested in a Dino hunting/survival game give this game a shot.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
Early Access Review
								Do not buy this game, if you love running and gunning, spraying and praying as you go. This is a squat and stalk game. Ammo is scarce and you only get a primitive bow to begin with. Did I mention you spawn in bright yellow pajama's ?  That being said this game has more immersion than most. You get carried away in the great ambiance of the jungle. The sound is amazing. The first time you get surrounded by a pack of raptors, or hear the booming footfalls of the T-Rex as it approaches the bush you're cowering in and lets out a screen rattling roar. It's enough to get the adrenaline pumping through your veins. As you learn the subtle clues of what is in your area and where they went you actually feel as if you are hunting game that can hunt you back. There is great satisfaction in out witting a pack of raptors and coming away victorious . As far as still being in early release this is by far the best looking early release I've played yet. It already feels very polished and runs very smoothly. I honestly expected to spend a lot of time tweaking the graphics in order to get the best FPS. Yet this is not the case at all. It already has the feel of a properly optimized game. I have played big name games that felt way less polished. And the Dev's actually read your feedback and forum comments and not only respond but patch the game when something new they've put in makes the game not what the community wants. That is a first. Of all the early release games I've tested errr. uhm played this is the first where you feel the Dev's care about the players and aren't just rolling their eyes at us.

content:
Posted: July 17, 2015
												230+ hours experienceI started playing this game early February during early access with some friends and we had an absolute blast playing this game. I have had more fun playing this game than I have playing any other game. When we first started out we were crapping ourselves with every noise we heard and were just about crawling from base to base. When we found weapons, the fun exponentially increased as we were able to kill our first raptors and eventually hunt our first T-Rex. But, even though we had weapons we were still at the mercy of the dinosaurs.We eventually had a shot at the PVP gameplay, with... mixed results. It was incredibly fun to play because the only way you could tell if someone was near you was by physically seeing them or hearing their gunshots. Playing PVP really kept you on the edge of your seat as you never knew if you were in someones sights and you didn't necessarily want to fire your gun in case you alerted people to your prescence. And hearing gunshots was just as terrifying because you can tell people are close, but you had to try and locate them using surround sound and the loudness of the gunshot. Although it was frustrating to lose your equipment, as my friends and I have lost the best gear several times, being killed by players or the dreaded cheater... The PVP experience was another amazing aspect I enjoy to this day.To complete my review, my feelings toward this game are that it is the best gaming experience I have ever experienced. But due to lack of care and the greed of the developers it has somewhat withered away behind other games such as ARK, (I do not plan to play ARK. Riding dinos? Really?!). Anyway, this game had the potential of becoming something much more that it was initially planned to be, but the developers have seemed to ignore the game and the community which has led to a LOT of flak from the community and players.My #1 suggestion would be to keep updating the game with patches and more content, but this seems to be out of the question. So I think the BEST option for the continuation of this marvelous game would be for the developers to open the game to modding in the Steam Workshop. This would mean more great content and patches for the game without consuming the time of the developers.

												As early access, this game was great.  Updates kept adding good things to the game, like new weapons, better dino behaviors and looks, the leveling system, etc.  It was shaping up to something good.  Then they decided to declare it done and release it... and added quetzalcoatlus.  Quetzalcoatlus is just buggy as hell, ridiculously overpowered and aggressive, hovers over everything and anything of importance, and it clips through the ground to pick you up, making it impossible to shoot at it as it comes down to swoop you off [you have a limit of how far you can aim up and down].  Just... avoid it.  Avoid it at all cost.  If you do feel adventurous, then wait for it to be on sale.

												Hunt, Explore, Survive? More like Die to invulnerable dinos, Wander aroudn the same area, and have zero threat or challenge untill a flying trex comes down a mountain and lands on your face. A quick push out of a game, cheaply done in a VERY small amount of time, the EA lasted like four months in total, theres only 5 types of dinosaur in the game. content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Don't worry it doesn't have the same micro transactions as theHunter does. It's a one-time payment with no purchasing of guns in a store for real money. The game in its current state seems alright. It has some connectivity issues and some crashing. These are to be expected in an early alpha build. There are only 3 species to hunt atm, Triceratops, T-rex and Raptors. The AI seems to be iffy at times. They will stand around taking shots before they start attacking you or they will just out right not see you sometimes. But when the AI works it's terrifying. The raptors hunt in packs, both the T-rex and raptor will stalk you. The survival aspect isn't much yet. You don't have to worry about starvation or thirst. You can't craft weapons or anything yet. You basically survive by not being eaten. But they could extend on this as time goes on. If you are the least bit interested in a Dino hunting/survival game give this game a shot.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								This has so much potential to be a truly great game but it has quite a ways to go, which I will get to. The atmosphere is fantastic even though I've spent most of the game alone trying to reach other survivors. You can sprint but it's loud so you have to desperately take your time and on the rare chance that you do meet up with someone, the feeling is great because you are two, now. The map is large but not infinite, allowing you to reach other players if you can survive the trek. It can be scary at times, when you're crouched next to a bush hearing something far off coming closer. Trying to guage where it's coming from. And how many they are. Very tense moments, like the first time you see a Rex from far off. The game does change a bit once you find a gun or two. I know it's a hunting game but when all you have is 5 bows, you aren't hunting anymore. You're fleeing to the safety of other players and the slim chance of good luck along the way. There are things that I love about this game. The 8 year old in me that still loves dinosaurs more than anything else loves the bejesus out this game. But there are some issues. The crashing is still bad. That is going to need to improve quickly. It's hard to develop a rhythym when players are constantly getting dropped. I'm on win8.1 and I'm not lagging. But it still crashes all the time. The other big issue and I swear it's not because I'm bad, but the aiming mechanism is awful. Bow"hunting" is nearly impossible. The guns are a lottle bit better because you don't have to draw them back but it still ain't great. The game gets choppy to the point of death. And then you respawn all the way across the map and have to sneak, crawl, and walk a good 4000m to reach the other players. The game has a way of spreading you all out .So. It has amaing potential but right now, developers, this has to get better. Like, $20 better, if you catch my drift. Please don't let this die.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								To the survivor who isn't dead yet...The forest was dense, very dense. The grass itself was at my waist, the bushes a sprawling wall of green and the trees...I feel so small on this planet. Small and insignificant. My first feeling is fear, I could almost smell it on myself. The sparse yellow outfit I was provided feels severley unquipped for the rigors of this harsh world. This was only  compounded by the fact that they felt it was suitable to equip me with a wooden bow and some arrows...have they ever crouched in a bush, the yellow of their outfit stained a filthy brown as they♥♥♥♥♥♥themselves in pure and utter terror, my bodies defensive response to a T-Rex not 3m from me, its nostrils flaring as it snorted the air...I'm surprised it didn't smell my fear let alone my pile of♥♥♥♥♥♥ Then again, there was a pile of its own♥♥♥♥♥♥just beyond us. Yes. Fear is all I know of this planet. I clung to that bush for dear life, even when the creature disappeared over the ridge, I sat crying at the bush. Time just went on by...and god knows what other creatures of death. I eventually slinked back to my landing pod, my one and only small measure of secuirty and safety. I write this now at the peak of the volcano...that was quite a trek. I haven't seen a dinosaur since that moment with the T-Rex. Despite this fact, every step, every step forward is pure terror. I can't see anything yet I hear EVERYTHING. The rustles, the groans and screeches, the distant roars...this place, I just...back home life is as many people would expect, happiness, friends and families. These are the norm. Here, on what I've dubbed a Green Vegetated Hell I only know fear, you will only know fear. You will never see them, you will just hear them. You will never out run them, they will just catch you. You will never survive...they will just kill you. Your no Primal Hunter. You're the hunted. You will learn that or you will die. Its not you surviving, your already dead. They just haven't found you yet. Trust me. They will find you.From a survivor who is deadAlright guys, first things first. Yes this is an early access game, remember that. Always when buying such games. Lets get into this.For an early access game this game is in quite a good state and stands on very promising ground to deliver an exceptional title. I love my survival games and ones with dinosaurs, vast maps and huge forests just grab my attention. This is definitely the best survival dino game I've played. There is definitely limited content to the game atm. There are only three dinos in the game atm and as of this moment I'm still unable to play multiplayer. Depspite this, god I've had some fun. Yes that first little letter is some roleplaying but that is honestly my first experience in the game. I survived for quite a while, imo anyway lol. This game is very beautiful, absolutely huge and completely terrifying early on. You're so insignifcant its not funny. You're hopeless against their attacks so all you can do in sneak and slink around gathering supplies and creating an arsenal. So during this time you explore much of the terrain, see much of how the dinos act as you sit there and watch. You survive. Barely.So rather than blabbering I'll list some pros and cons.Pros/Awesome stuff:Dinosaurs...big onesHuge and I mean huge map that is intricately detailed and beautiful. Love it.Presence. This game has presence. It has atmosphere. You're so small and helpless and you know it. This is done through the environment, the detail of it all, the atmospheric sounds of you creeping through the bushes, the call of all the dinos and the terrifying attacks of the dinos.Tracking a wounded dino...pretty fun in such a hostile environment. Killing it is even better.Its muliplayer capability is huge, I can't wait to get into some games. To track a T-Rex with a team and take down such a beast, definitely looking forward to it.The fact that your not the hunter, your the hunted. Never forget that, everything can change instantly. The enormous potential this game has. Giant sauropods roaming through the forest, a stampede of herbivores as they are chased by a T-Rex, the potential is just endless.Theres more and I could go on but you get the idea.Cons:I think weapons are a little too weak. Shot a raptor 4 times in the head with a bow, didn't die. Five shots with a shotgun...this game isn't meant to be played solo, the damage is proportional for groups of players not solo players. Remember that always.Not too much to do atm. I don't see this as a con as this is early  access its to be expected but people need to be aware of the state of the game atm. You need to be informed of such a thing. Not much to atm BUT down the road, ♥♥♥♥ yea.The stamina system, your like a morbidly obese person. Can't run much and you can't run far. Needs to change. Trust me, if you had a T-Rex on your♥♥♥♥♥you'd make Usain Bolt look slow. Btw you can't outrun one lmaoThats all I really have a problem with if you could call it that. Just things that you WILL encounter and perhaps need some changing.Things I'd like to see though:More dinosCrafting of any sort. Weapons, backpacks, houses, !!TRAPS!!! like deadfall traps etc etc, would be cool.Ability to capture dinosaurs. Would be cool. To capture a dinosaur. On the island there is what used to be a base surrounded by wooden spikes with two towers...I'd make this place into a dino arena. Thats just me lolI'm unaware as to the variety of weapons available but perhaps a larger variety. Tranq guns, lmgs, flamethrowers.In the crafting systems have skinng possible, ability to use their carcasses.Yes I know this is a title from a company that makes hunting games, yet this game can be turned into something a little but more than a 'hunting' game. If that is simply the end game scope for this game, simply bagging kills then that would kill the game for me. It would be such an anti-climax. This game has huge potential. Please don't waste it.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Top Notch! This is the best dino game that has been out for years. It has incorperated the surival system into to it very nicely, it makes the sense of finding a cache or camp/settelment rewarding. The looting system is implemented very well making it easy to grab and run and the GPS tracker "SettlerMate" makes navigation and tracking a dream.The dinos are difficult to kill which they should be, tracking dinos is also very immersive due to the fact that you may find tracks from a different Utahraptor then the one your tracking, also dino could be tracking you at the same time (bloody T-Rex). The Map is huge as well which is amazing, a lot of room for tactics on the hunt. The landscape has a very unique feel to it with plenty of places to hide if being tracked. The plants are spot on and the dangerous plants add a glorious mechanic to the game.The Cons are you can't swim yet, the Dino AI needs a bit of work (got tons of pics of T-Rex smiling for his close ups). The pathfinding needs to be refined around obsticles and no real character customization at the moment. The sound of T-rex walking sounds like a drum not a dino stomping around.ALL IN ALL IT HAS ONLY JUST BEEN RELEASED SO HANG ON.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								The graphics aren't the best, but there are some really stunning vistas and it has the potential to be something I'd play every day if they get the balance of the game right. If they take the focus off the player on player, and make it more about hunting the actual dinosaurs, I'll be alot happier. This is something I'd play alone, or with friends. I'm not into the whole Day Z experience, of working really hard on something then someone comes and robs all your hard earned stuff.If they add more dinosaurs, some herd based herbivores, and get some more survival aspects in there, this will be top notch. At the moment it is very unforgiving. You start with a bow and 5 arrows, which has not been enough for me to bag a raptor, as of yet. The problem with the raptor being the "easy" prey is that they travel in groups. Once they get some more dinos in, I will be more inclined to play.As of yet, I'd say hold off and wait for some much needed content, unless you want to jump on a populated server and run the risk of being camped by someone lacking thumbs.

								So. Here it is, a game review I can actually be bothered typing out. TheHunter: Primal is an early access title, still in alpha. content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								As a lover of TheHunter, I have to say I am dissapointed so far with this. TheHunter is a game that you can take slow, enjoy stalking prey and bring your own weapons to the field. What I loved about TheHunter is I can play by myself if I wish, and all I have to do if I need to pause game is bring up menu screen.... I understand during multiplayer this cannot happen BUT I do NOT play multiplayer. Being able to pause is very useful with a toddler and a baby in the house. Now my huge gripe... as I see so far, this game is totaly NOT solo friendly. I have played for hours, have found many backpacks and such to open, and all I get is a bow. I had a shotgun for 2 seconds before a Trex got me. So now all I have is a bow, and a couple arrows. First, after running around for 15 mins I see no dinos.... at all. The only animal that wont instantly attack me runs from me. I got a lung/heart shot on it with a bow and it ran a quarter of the map and never died, shot it two more times before I gave up. Doc would be ashamed! The second dino which I can kill, runs in packs..... and then the third dino all I see in desription is, dont hunt it alone..... So Tri/dont take down easy dont hunt alont, Raptor/runs in packs dont take along, Trex/dont take alone... I mean come on!!! Many other small issues so far, like arrows not combining when you find them. I still have yet to harvest my first kill... even with lung/heart shots... I just dont know..... I do however recomend TheHunter for people who like slow paced hunting games that are semi realistic.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2015
Early Access Review
								Fun for a while. Pro's: - It's truly terrifying when a Trex is standing right over you and you're lying down in some bushes or a pack of Raptors are circling your hiding place and all you have is 5 arrows. - The general foliage graphics-wise is not bad at all but there's a LOT of reused graphics over and over. - I've seen the creature designs from other dino games which were awful but they put some effort into these 3 dino's. The Raptors look a little different from each other but they're still raptors. - Water: The water graphics looked pretty clear and you make small waves when you walk through water. Cons: - I am sick and tired of being spawned right in the middle of a pack of raptors or a Trex is only 40 yards away. As soon as you try to leave the area, they magically know you're there. Even if you DO get out of their line of sight, they know exactly where you stopped to hide and will NEVER leave the area. You have to hope you can low crawl forever through some bushes but guess what? Even if they couldn't see you, they will follow you to the end of the earth. In other words, you either jump off a cliff and die or they kill you as soon as you try to run. - It's you against EVERYTHING. By that I mean, if you have 1-2 Raptors hanging outside the tree that you're hiding in and a Trex comes around, they will both team up to find you. The Trex doesn't scare off the Raptors. - No melee weapons. - You could walk right up the side of a fallen tree but a small rock stops you from walking forward. - No jump. As in..you can't jump up onto rocks or up cliff edges to get away from Raptors. If you can go there, so can they. Need:- Tree blinds or the ability to climb trees for a better vantage or better attack angle on smaller dino's.- Jump- Melee attack weapons- More types of dino's- Caves along cliffs and along the coast for hiding or shelter. - campfires for cooking meat taken from dino's to eat for health. - A damage/fear limit for the dino's. If you hurt one enough, they will run away but in reality, if you put an arrow directly into a Trex's eye, it should run off for a short time for you to get away. Conclusion:It was fun for a couple days but after killing multiple raptors and my 2nd Trex, it got boring.

content:
Posted: February 2
												More horror than hunting, this game is mindblowingly frustrating to new players, having no way of knowing what to look for or where to go, but once you get a decent weapon and know where to look out for enemies, the game becomes an addictive hunting sim that you may find yourself coming back again and again to. I was a fan of the Carnivores titles as a kid, and being rather disappointed in Carnivores: Dinosaur Hunter Reborn, I found some joy in this game, bringing the mighty T-Rex and the cunning Raptor back to their horrifying glory. I will say, there are only 3 main dinos in this game (T-Rex, Triceratops, and Utahraptor), with some irritating Quetzalcoatlus that really serve no purpose than to keep you on your toes in open spaces which were mostly safe before its introduction. There some others (I say some, I can't really remember any others besides Velociraptors, which are just mini utahraptors that hunt in larger packs), but really there is a lack of content in this game. The amount of content present doesn't honestly matter to me, but if you want a game to sink hours upon hours into then you might want to wait for a Steam sale or try looking on Gee Two Ay (why does this review system censor♥♥♥♥♥) for a discount (I personally don't recommend Gee Two Ay for indie games, as i always like to support the developers as best I can). If you want a "clever girl" simulator that you can run for your life in with friends, I definitely recommend this game.

content:

												I like this game because:* map scenery, the engine is incredible well optimized, look at the sky both night and day, look far in the distance, it's really nice* ambiance of the map* multiplayer with friends* dinosaurs* the concept of hunting dinosaursHere are some aspects that can be improved:* animations of both characters and dinosaurs* some dinosaur sounds* dinosaurs 3d models* weapons mechanics* some sort of multiplayer packet check to prevent cheatingKnown bugs to me so far:* dinosaur AI, they can get stuck* inventory keeps losing items* collision with dinosaurs (I was propelled into air by a raptor)* client multiplayer model allows cheatingClearly the game has been rushed to the market.Here is another game with huge potential, exceptional open-world engine and yet no vision from the people who run the business. Classic these days.I don't recommend this game to "consumerist gamers" who devour games in hours and get bored fast.This is a game for the dinosaurs fans. It doesn't have a great replay-ability value, but you can always have a little fun with friends or even alone just exploring.

content:
Posted: January 7
												Buggy, glitchy, imperfect, but yet entretaining.You really have to give the game a chance, at the start it can be a bit frustrating since you are disarmed and basically any dino is deadly and wont give you achance to escape once detected, but if you continue exploring, looking around asking for help you will eventually get to enjoy it, it can be very relaxing to walk around the island to check the view while tracking your next prey.You will have to be quiet, advance slowly and aim carefully for the kill, track the prey, cooperate with others. The biggest problem in the game is the tendency to eventually spawn and find out your weapons/level was lost either because your game crashed or simply, you exited. It can be frustrating.This game deserved more polishing, even so as it is I cant complain, it does its function, to give you a fun time.The game is most of the time a "walking simulator", you won't just spawn and get guns to kill dinos left and right, you have to explore, find settlements and beg to god you get a useful gun. Its a lot of fun and it deserves more updates, but for what it is, I got more than my money's worth

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7
												Buggy, glitchy, imperfect, but yet entretaining.You really have to give the game a chance, at the start it can be a bit frustrating since you are disarmed and basically any dino is deadly and wont give you achance to escape once detected, but if you continue exploring, looking around asking for help you will eventually get to enjoy it, it can be very relaxing to walk around the island to check the view while tracking your next prey.You will have to be quiet, advance slowly and aim carefully for the kill, track the prey, cooperate with others. The biggest problem in the game is the tendency to eventually spawn and find out your weapons/level was lost either because your game crashed or simply, you exited. It can be frustrating.This game deserved more polishing, even so as it is I cant complain, it does its function, to give you a fun time.The game is most of the time a "walking simulator", you won't just spawn and get guns to kill dinos left and right, you have to explore, find settlements and beg to god you get a useful gun. Its a lot of fun and it deserves more updates, but for what it is, I got more than my money's worth

content:
Posted: January 3, 2015
Early Access Review
								 Great game from am obscure publisher that mainly makes hunting games. The game runs great on my rig at maximum and looks fantastic. The dinos movement is realistic and they look like massive predators. Guns handle well, and sound realistic.  Though there are a few things i would like to see implamented.1)Base/Camp building. Setting down tents for storage, and perhaps sonic emitters to keep away dinos. Wooden barricades to keep out pesky thieves. Trips wires and more.2) A more informative/User friendly UI and Inventory. Perhaps a grid inventory system.3) Group creation on PVP servers.4) Hunger/Thirst implamamentation. Right now they have the workings of DayZ but it seems half hearted like they dove into the genre because its popular not because they know exactly what there doing. I could be wrong and it could be a big surprise hit. But for right now its a decent game, and fun to watch friends be mauled and shook around like a chew toy when the Rex catches their scent.

content:
Posted: October 18, 2015
												I have 46 hours logged on this game, so I can't say it's terrible. But I'm always wanting more from it, not just variety in dinosaurs but in gameplay aspects. There's nothing beyond get a gun and kill dinosaurs. You can skulk around and maybe ambush a few while prone, but that's it. Shoot and kill. I'd rather them put items like wood to build a tree stand, smoke bomb to escape a raptor attack, decoys to ambush dino's from a distance. I say these things because they seem feasible within the engine. I'll comeback to the gam every few months and go at it for a day or two, then get bored again. Bottom-Line: If it's less than $10, pick it up. You're fist dino encoutner will be exhilirating. The second will be your practice trials. The third will be taking on a trike probably. And finally you'll take on a rex. After that, the gmae is over.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								Has been playing this game most of the day now. If you like a realistic hunting game with dinosaurs, then you will like this. It looks good and has the right atmosphere, that make u feel that u are there. It also makes you sneak around a lot. The "cons" in this game, seems to be minor bugs that will be fixed anyway and the "pros" has already been mentioned. As soon (and they will) as more life is put into the game, I can't ask for more. Here is what I to see:1. That species roam specific areas, that are realistic to them. So you don't meet the same all over the map.2. I hope to see some function, that makes you feel you have an objective. Like to hunt a specific dino or with a certain weapon.3. Veteran or Alpha dinosaurs, with a nickname. Killing this is like killing a boss. It has to be rare. (1 per server).4. Hunger/Thirst/Temperature/Wounds <- Else it is not a survival. 5. Dinosaurs has to be affected by other dinosaurs. A raptor has to flee from a T-rex. Triceratops from all carnivores and so on.6. Meaningless critters and insects. I know they're there, but we need more. The more life, the better the feeling.7. Herbivores that is just there for the viewing and gigantic size, like Diplodocus or such.8. The ability to make shelter, a fire and roast the meat, that u also has to be able to harvest. <- I know this one might sound a bit far fetched, but that would really upgrade everything and give u a purpose for the hunt.9. The simple ability to JUMP! Even if it has no purpose, but the psychological feeling of having that freedom really boosts the gaming experience. Imagine if you didn't have the ability to reload (like in old games), but by giving u the option to suddenly choose and reload at the right time, changes the game a lot. So a simple jump would do.I can't really say anything bad, as all my need has been fulfilled, even in alpha. The above is just hopes and wishes. The negative stuff I can say is just bugs that will be fixed anyway. I have waited since childhood for someone to make a god damn game like this, and now I have it!

number of helpful: 8 of 18 people (44%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								Until there's a means to play an offline, singleplayer game I really wouldn't recommend this.  Though access to the internet is not a problem for me, I am not a fan of purchasing a game and then being unable to play it because an update breaks the ability for the game to connect, or similar nonsense. The concept is awesome, and the gameplay itself, while it can be improved, would be good enough in my opinion to warrant the price, provided what I said above wasn't an issue.  Currently there is no true single player game here, as you are still required to connect to a server even when playing in a world confined to one participant.  Connection loss is a real pain because apparently, things like supplies and items' positions are dictated server-side, meaning while you may end up reconnecting to the game should the connection falter, whatever items were in your immediate vicinity (like, for instance, a crate of supplies I spent a good 30 minutes trying to get to) will disappear.Hopefully updates come along which enable more consistent play.  As it stands I am too frustrated with losing my sense of progression to keep playing.

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												Was looking for a dinosaur-themed game to tide me over until the hype of Jurassic World would get some more dinosaur games going. I liked the premise of this game and finally convinced myself to download it, hoping it would fulfill the dinosaur-hunting void in my life. I played this game for about 6 hours before finally rage-quitting. I found the game very frustrating. At times I would be insta-chomped by a tyrannosaurus or pack of utahraptors without any chance of using my weapons In other lives I would be running away like crazy or staring down at a weak little velociraptor thinking about how nice it would be if I had ammunition and could therefore kill the dinosaur before it killed me. The ability to go back to your death-location and recover your weapons was nice, except that the game's respawn point was so far away from where you needed to go. The five minute walk to recover your weapons felt like an hour. All I wanted in this game was to kill dinosaurs. I couldn't care less about the "survival" aspect of the game. I finally did kill some utah raptors and velociraptors, but the amount of effort I was putting was not worth the reward. I thought about recruiting my boyfriend to play with me, but with the size of the map and the spawn points and death-respawn and all, there is no way we could have physically gotten close enough to each other to play cooperatively.If you want a dinosaur-themed game, invest $1 into Orion:Prelude and satisfy your dinosaur-killing urges. And now the trailers for ARK:Survival have come out and I am now in counting down the days until I get to kill dinosaurs AND ride them.

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Where to start in 100% honesty. I have over 100 Hrs put into this game so I know my stuff folks. I love Dinosaours, I love guns, and I love open world gaming. So that had me from the start with this game when I read the description. So many problems I don't even know where to begin describing them, the worst is the damn "Lost Connection to host," while you've died with a pack filled with goods. Straight up rage quit stuff right there. They should have it bounce to the next best connection worthy host, like most games (Just host your own). Not to mention the Dinosaur AI is horrible, they fall through objects, walk through them, you name it. The framrate drop in certain areas causes you to be killed because you can't aim the gun properly. I have an extremely powerful computer there's no reason this game should be that badly optimized. Yes there's Flying Dino's that are a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥ just hide in the trees or shoot them as they come at you. They're very annoying and I agree though, that they should be dumbed down in population.              But for some reason I keep playing? Why? Because I only paid $20 for this game that's given me quite a few laughs, scares, excitment, fun, and some new friends along the way. Really what do you expect from independent game companys that start out "early access." I mean for ♥♥♥♥ sake people, have you not learned from DayZ that this stuff is a work in progress, and really the only way to make any of you happy is to have a flawless game with nothing to complain about for the price of two meals from Mcdonalds? Get over it,  it's not perfect, but it's good fun. If you don't like it, you don't like it. There's tons of issues with the game, that overtime I hope they'll patch and work on. Until then, happy hunting everybody and don't let all these negative reviews bring you down. They make it sound like drawn stick figures being chased by a ♥♥♥♥ing Dinosaur made from Gomotion. Get real.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												This game is just aweful. Imagine DayZ with dinosaurs, cool right? Wrong, this game is just so poorly put together it is unbelievable. You start the game off landed on some "Primal" planet. You are given no objective, all you are given is a crap machete and a thumb drive or something. This thumb drive gives you the location of something... sometimes. Honestley I don't know what its for; sometimes it gives a location sometimes it doesn't, its emotional I don't know. So your "goal" I assume is to hunt things, judging by the way THATS THE NAME OF THE GAME! But all they give you is this crap machete that does♥♥♥♥♥♥for damage and drains your stamina. OH, did I mention theres stamina; this takes longer to regen then stamina in Darksouls. There is this huge map but it is impossible to explore because you move slower then the snail that won worlds slowest snail! It isn't like that matters anyways because by the time you get anywhere something will have found you and killed you. These Dinosaurs have more spatial awareness then you as a player could ever hope for. I know what you're thinking, "But that's more realistic!" ONE: What are you a paleontologist or a time traveler how do you know how dinosaurs work, and TWO: That's fine, but you can have that if you give your player nothing to defend themselves with. There are weapons, I assume, I only found one gun and bullets for others. Just like in DayZ you have to just wander until you find something, the differance is that in DayZ there are clear locations that suggest loot. Here it's just strait RNG, maybe you'll fine a box out in the middle of nowhere, maybe you wont. Maybe you do find something, it most likely won't have any weapons, just ammo to taunt you. I guess there are like bases that have a better chance of finding something but I could only find one. It's not like it matters that you find anything because guess what as soon as you die, you guessed it, you lose everything. Equipment, ammo, guns, rocks (oh yeah you collect rocks too, I don't know) and map progress... sometimes. I honestly do not know, sometimes you lose your map progression sometimes you don't and there's the random areas that are just reviled. There is a credits system that gives you money for killing dinos, but you never can use it because you can never kill anything. This just feels like the Taco Bell equivalent of a game, they just gave up. There is a game here, somewhere, but it just feels like they had an idea and then immediately just went “meh”. It feels more like an early access game, then most early access games do. This doesn't feel like theHunter it feels more like thePrey.TL;DR: It's like DayZ with dinos, only s**t.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								Nice graphics, great sound effects, and an interesting tracking system. Shooting mechanics on this game are realistic, but I think the bow and arrows need a little bit of work. The gameplay is pretty immersive. I nearly♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥my pants after a T-rex quickly snuck up on me while I was trying to get loot from a storage crate. I really enjoyed the time I've spent on this game so far. I've been waiting for years for another game like carnivores (except improved greatly), and I really think this game has the potential to fill the gap in the market for a quality dinosaur survival/hunting game.Since this is an early release, there aren't many dinosaurs to hunt, and there are just a few graphic glitches that I've come across. A save option (or a hive that saves your gear/progress like DayZ) would be great, and I'm sure they'll implement something like that in the time to come.I hope this game gets more publicity and traction in the gaming community because this game would be very fun to play with/against larger groups of people.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												Was a good game prerelease.  However with the the totally unrealistic  balance of predators to prey no claims of a serious hunting simulation can be made.    Most of the animals should be herbivores not carnivores.  I knew thay intended a March release but five total species with four of them being predators is just wrong.  Also the developers just squashed any hope of any further development.  In their latest post they said they would only be working on patches and would not be devloping it any further.   (See there April 1st post release round up).  In addition they said that the current sorry state of the game exceeds their original intentions.       I have backed several early access games and this is about the worst. (The Stomping Land takes that honor).  They took advantage of peoples assumption that early access games are to help fund devlopment.  They went from early access to release in six months.  This was basically having people pay to beta test.  This is a common complaint about early access but I have never seen one so blatant about it.

content:
Posted: June 9, 2015
												After having tried out The Hunter, and finding it to be wholly unsatisfying with its pay to hunt system, I took to The Hunter: Primal. At first the game seemed to have its core player in mind with prommosed content and no in game puchases to speak of. Throughout its development however, the development team has done little to stay ahead of the abusive douping and scripting undertaken by a portion of the player base. These issues made it impossible to play on public servers whereupon the need for a private lobby was pramount to actually enjoying the game with friends. It saddens me that this game is being, for all intensive purposes, abandoned shortly after its official release. I hope that this does not become a trend in game development where the content is shunted after its faithful beta supporters were made so many promisses.

content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												Instead of everyone complaining, I have some helpful things to say about the game. I would just like to state that first, the Q's can easily be killed, I killed one in one shot, they can easily be avoided and dodged too, and with the newest update they aren't really a problem anymore, but when you find them still a threat. I think this game could be huge if you update it lots and prove everyone wrong about it. The quality of the scenery is amazing, the sounds are too, there's birds and butterflies flying around, at night it's really sketchy and different, there's crazy storms that happen. I'm a big fan of this game and I have a few suggestions that I think other people will like. Definitely add the ability to swim and jump... those are pretty basic skills for people who just dropped in on pods. I also think you should add crafting, such as traps, and cutting wood, it would be so scary to try and harvest wood sometimes when you need to and who drops into this environment with no survival skills am i right? I feel as if there is a low field of vision, like you can't see dinos farther than a certain distance which makes no sense when you should be able to see them. I'm not sure why none of the dinosaurs attack each other, but I think it would cool if say a T-rex ate a Triceratops, and then after little raptors come in for a meal, because they're scavengers. I'm sure you're working on a lot of things already, but if you aren't I would like to see more guns, and silenced ones, maybe a stash for your items and overall deeper character and skill customization and possibly some vehicles or something cool. Being in a storm made me feel like there should be natural disasters, such as a tsunami, hurricane, or especially a volcanic eruption! But OVERALL, the number 1 thing that I would like to see ASAP, is more dinosaurs because I feel as if I don't run into as many dinosaurs as I normally would like to. Plus that there is literally 5 dinosaurs right now, the T-rex,velociraptor,Utahraptor,triceratops and the Quetzalcoatlus. You should add more flying reptiles and aquatic dino's such as the Spinosaurus, and maybe the Crocodile. I realize that you can only place dino's that are in the same time era but I have some suggestions for some must have's. The Pachycephalosaurus, Ankylosaurus, Stegasaurus, Brontosaurus and Pentaceratops. A few more random ones I would like are The Giant Sloth, Allosaurus, Iguanodon, Pachyrhinosaurus, Herrerasaurus, Scipionyx, also some omnivores such as the Abrictosaurus, Avimimus, and the Chirostenotes. Now I feel like if you guys updated a lot, and you see what I mean by these paragraphs, that this could be a game everyone loves. But if you flop on it like everyone thinks, someone else will take this awesome idea and make money off it. I'm sure everyone would love if you kept us posted on upcoming updates or things you're working on. Much love and thanks for the read, sincerely an avid fan!

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 2, 2015
												Played this game quite a bit, last session being a 10 hour stream on Twitch.Enjoying the game a lot so far. The dinosaurs can be really terrifying, especially when you are alone. Once you have a group and some guns (with ammo!) the Velociraptors and Utahraptors become fairly easy to kill.The Quetz birds are still very dangerous since they grab you and drop you (one of us got 'chain killed' by the birds at least 4-5 times hehe). They are huge and dangerous and really bring an added element of danger (death from above) when you are walking around in open areas.Of course the T-Rex is death on two legs as always and requires a good group effort to take down (or powerful guns, e.g. .700 rifle or .50 sniper).For more relaxing and hunting type of gameplay you can focus on the Triceratops, since shooting those means wounding them 10 times out of 10, so you end up having to follow their tracks and blood trails for follow up shots to kill them. They are not dangerous at all (never had one attack me) and the biggest danger hunting those comes from not paying attention to, or attracting due to gunshots, the other dinosaurs.My two main things that I hope to see improved in the game though:Better AI and dinosaur movement - they are sometimes a bit robotic, e.g. they run to a spot and then freeze for no reason. This makes it a little easier to kill them, but they are still lethal and can do lots of damage to you, especially if you play solo.More dinosaurs! - Sure there are 5 ingame now, but I am hoping they will add more dinosaurs. I'd like to see a mix of both docile (like the triceratops) and lethal ones.. both large ones and small ones!Overall though the game is really fun, especially if you play with friends!

content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												I know the games official release has recieved a lot of flak for the bugs and the new flying dinosaur, but even with these things the game is still massively fun. This has to be the best dinosaur game I have EVER played. Not many games can do it like this game does. The game shifts from survival/horror as you start out with only a machete and have to defend yourself against raptors and other predators. Then it shifts to hunting/adventure as you find more weapons and start to hunt your first dinos. Then finally, once you think you are the most experienced player in the game, you get killed by a T-Rex or a Pterasaur or maybe even a ambitous pack of hungry Velociraptors. And you shift back into survival horror as you hide from the monsters that lurk in the jungle.I agree the game is FAR from finished and I think they should have stayed in pre-release for at least another month, but the truth is if you love dinosaurs, you will love this game.I bought this game 3 days ago and I've already clocked over 24 hrs into it. It is rediculusly addictive and atmospheric.Verdict:6/10 - Gameplay10/10 - Replayability Value9/10 - ImmersionIs it fun? Is it worth $25.00?Yes.

Early Access Review
								This game is fascinating, and by far the best game I've played, but it gets boring get quite fast. If the original  "TheHunter" was not a subscription  based game, I would play it, and it is a bit misleading, since it  specifically   says,"Hunt - Explore - Survive The most realistic prehistoric survival game ever created. Featuring a huge Jurassic environment populated by horrifying all-stars such as T-Rex, Triceratops, Utahraptor." I misread it as you can be the dinosaur, but my mistake.And personally, I would have preferred more dinosaurs and a chance to BECOME the animal, but more or less, very interesting game.  This game isn't really for dinosaur  enthusiasts, since you are killing your 'precious' children, but more for the people who dream of slugging a raptor in the head.:::ALSO:::I do know this is a early access game, but I still, completely, believe the creators may make it a micro transactions surrounded games, which will make me extremely angry if they do so. PLEASE, LISTEN TO AL EAST HALF OF US, SINCE WE CAN HELP YOU!

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								If like theHunter and were a fan of the old Dino hunting game Carnivores then you will love this game!!!3 Dinos so far; Tryannosaurus Rex, Utahraptors, and the peaceful Triceratops.5 weapons; The bow, .308 Rifle, 12 GA pump-action shotgun, .44 Handgun, and the devastating double-barrel .700 Rifle.With 9.3 sq. miles of playable area you'll spend countless hours exploring and checking out every inch of this gorgeous world. All and all, for an Early Access game this is really well put together. There's hardly any hardcore bugs in this as well. For $20 you aren't dumping out a lot of money and with such a successful dev team this game will be moving along fast! (after the dev's Christmas vacation of course). Oh and it highly encourages team-play. No one likes going out against ferocious dinos alone ya know? And if you want someone who knows the ropes to come hunting with you feel free to add me if you decide to purchase :) I'll gladly help get you familiar with the game.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
Early Access Review
								Pros:Pretty great graphics for early acces.Has a good concept.Dinosaurs look pretty good for an early acces.Cons:Takes to many bullets just to kill a Utahraptor.Weapons are way to hard to find.Dinosaurs are extremely hard to find.Lots of glitches but thats not much of a problem since early acces.Only 3 types of Dinosaurs for such a gigantic world.Sprint button only lasts for like 10 seconds and takes about 30 to regenarate-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------About the first 10 minutes of playing the game i was already bored out of my mind because there is literally like no dinosaurs. After about 16 minutes into the game i finally here what seems like a Utahraptor. Turns out there is more than one and for me being alone with only a bow of course i died. That obviosly wouldnt have happened probably if i was with friends. 30 minutes in the game i finally find my first gun. But with no bullets. 40 minutes in i find 6 bullets out of 4 crates i check. As i was getting the ammo i see the ground shaking and then stop. i click out my inventory to see a T Rex right behind me somehow not noticing. I go prone and try to crawl away and it kills me.I know this game will be really fun after a couple updates. I suggest you not get it right now but surely in a few months

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 22, 2015
Early Access Review
								Can't jump. Can't run for more than 10 seconds. Very very very slow view/mouse cursor sensitivity. (I had to turn my in game sensitivity up all the way, still not satisfying) Finding a mushroom(recovering health) is like winning the lottery, except half the time you don't even need them. No melee attacks at all. I haven't even found a gun after an hour of running (walking) around this giant empty island. You find a package(random supplies) every 5-10 min of traveling, sometimes even longer. Raptors DESTROY you if you run into a pack. There is no escaping with this horrible stamina bar. They expect you to stop moving and sit there for 10 seconds while your stamina recharges... even while you already have a raptor chewing on your a$$... what is that about? You suggest hiding in bushes and trees.. never works. Never even came across a T-rex. I heard a Triceratops, but it was surrounded by 5 raptors that thought I was a better meal.. Where's the fire? Where are the basics to help me not get destroyed by wildlife? Why can't I start off building something I can retreat to when I'm the one being hunted? Where are the traps? Am I supposed to wander around looking for stuff on a giant island filled with predators until I die? Where are the resources? Where are the items I can use to create weapons/armor/structures/items? Where are the key elements to survival that make me want to actually play this game? Where's the creativity to make your game unique?This game has a lot of potential, it is nice to roam around for a while. Although, it seems like there are too many elevated areas in my opinion. Since I can't run very far and I can't jump, I am forced to go around most places just to get back up. This isn't very exciting since I'm not really finding anything useful on the way other than piles of dinosaur dung... Overall, the map is great but it get's annoying. This game to me really has no structure right now.. The fact that they have implemented a screenshot system for the dinosaur you kill over objectives and gameplay really annoys me. Who cares about your dinosaur kill....this is about surviving not showing off who killed the same model dinosaur.. I do not recommend buying this game anytime soon until you read or see videos on updated gameplay with ACTUAL objectives, such as making camps/structures, implemented.I understand this is an "early access" game, but I was seriously disappointed with how my first experience went. I will be checking up on updates in the future. I do have hopes for this game. R.I.P my $20.00(For early access, this game should only be $5 or $10. $15 tops)

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
												Don't take this review too seriously...It's as if someone attempted to make yet another generic early access dinosaur game, Except that all that was focused on was the dinosaur 'animations' and models (which admittedly aren't that terrible), and not the fun aspects of to be expected of  Hunting  dinosaurs?TL:DRIf you are a freakishly obsessed dinosaur enthusiast, don't buy this gameIf you like realism, don't buy this game.If you like hilariously broken dinosaurs, and dying to invisible forces, and feeling useless you may be in luck.Firstly the 'Plot'(This is my own estimation, going on evidence gathered whilst 'playing') You are a random prisoner (who I will refer to as Bob for the purpose of this review), who has been dropped down to the uncharted surface of a planet known as Primal Eden, which from satellite scans appears to be home to  an advanced civillisation of reptillian humanoids  dumb (but dangerous) dinosaurs. Bob is lucky, as he is the prisoner that has been chosen for today to try and terraform and populate the surface of primal eden on his own. Now, if you were a fancy space-age civilisation of humans, you would send down someone well equipped to deal with any dangers that may be present on the surface of the possibly inhospitable planet, wouldn't you think?No, your standard starting Bob is equipped with a crude machete and white trainers. You know, to kill all those triceratops and T-Rex?Onto the subject of actual game playThe A.I is pretty 'mediocre' to put it lightly (the dinosaurs frequently rotate on the spot, don't aknowledge eachothers existence and sometimes randomly run of when they attempt to 'attack you' they come back later by emerging out of the ground.)The weakest spot on a 'Utahraptors' body is its♥♥♥♥♥♥ and not its apparently missing brain or heart.Jesus the tyrannosaurus has also been witnessed, walking across the surface of the 'sea' only to smite my character down with an invisible attack that caused me to fall out of the world and into the hellish recesses of the low-res skybox.Also, watch out for the angry chicken dinosaurs that hover a few centimeters above the ground.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								Basically you're trying to be eaten by dinosaurs as rarely as possible, so you can sit your character down in a bush, go to bed and the game will play itself overnight.After a read through the manual and 20 minutes of walking, desperate to track down some dinosaurs to avoid, I had been presented with no trace or sound of anything dinosauric, and had found a single crate containing 2 health potions. My adventures were eventually brought to a white-knuckle climax when my path was blocked by a body of water too watery for even my heroic pioneer to consider. He could sprint for only 5 seconds before succumbing to exhaustion, so perhaps he was not the most bouyant of heroes.Fortunately there's an auto-walk key, so I can be off manicuring my toes while my hero wanders the terrain in search of house-sized carnivores he doesn't want to be anywhere near, happens across loot crates left in tree stumps by mischievous leprechauns, gets eaten by the carnivores, pretends he's lost any SPAS-12s he could've received from the leprechauns and starts all over again, all with the press of a button!One of the most convenient games on the market.
