content:
Posted: January 16, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game looks good, but as of now I would not really consider this much of a game nor is it worth $20. There are only three types of dinosaurs right now, raptors, t-rexs, and triceratops. You essentially get a bow to start and just walk until a dinosaur kills you. you can kill the dinos (difficult to do as the aiming is bad) and find other weapons in the game (far and few between), but there is no story and no progression. They say they went to beta to allow for users to decide which way to go, which likely means they have no idea why they made a dino hunting game in the first place other than that people will buy it. They have other theHunter games out there and my guess is the only way they are going to add more dinos is by making you pay for each new one. That is an assumption, but I have no reason to believe they will change their pricing model for this game. Like I said before this game is not even really a game. There is no story, there is no reward for hunting dinos, and you are not likely to win against one. Do I want a dino hunting game? absolutely, do I want to spend 20 minutes walking only to be somehow surprised by a trex comin out of no where and eating me, then starting a walk all over again? not really.edit:I wanted to explain this game more deeply. I still stand by my words, but that being said I think I was going at this game the wrong way. When looking at this game I was looking very much for a Turok style of go in and destroy a t-rex gun ablaze, run like hell so it doesn't eat you type survival game. That is not what this game is made for. This game is a trial in patience. You are hunting dinosaurs, but you are trying to hunt them like as if they were in the wild. You have to look for dino droppings, footsteps, and the like. It will take you a while to find one and when you do it will be tough to kill.Still this game does very much still feel like you were dropped in jarassic park 2 and expected to die. Not like you and the boys grabbed your favorite guns and beer and went out for a dino hunt. So now that that has been said would I recommend this game? No, not my cup of tea. If you enjoy hunting, but also enjoy the comfort of your living room, then you would probably enjoy this game.

content:
Posted: June 1, 2016
												So, I\'ve had this game for a while but never played it. Decided to for the first time today, and I have to say I\'m severely disappointed. I\'ve read reviews where they say you start with nothing but a machete, yet I started with absolutely nothing. I would pick up rocks, and my inventory would be taken up, but show nothing in it aside from the clothes on my back. There\'s no in-game menu to adjust graphics, which has been a must-have option since 2004. There\'s no sprinting or running. The game launcher doesn\'t close the first seven times you click Exit. For someone just coming into this series, there\'s no tutorial or guidance to make sure you understand the game. Overall, with the slow development, lack of content, excess of issues (not just bugs), and the fact that I wandered for about 20 minutes, only made it about 3 miles, and encountered absolutely no dinosaur life, I can\'t imagine how there are any positive reviews. Even though this game no longer says it\'s Early Access, it\'s really pre-alpha. I\'m not even sure they should\'ve released it.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
Early Access Review
								So far so good! Think DayZ with Dinos in a really pretty world. It's Early Access, so think BETA, some bugs to work out, definitely some balance issues...dinos are crazy hard even 1v1 vs a Raptor.I have only attempted once to take one down and that was after a few hours of exploring and getting my gear. And I failed so hard. Lesson learned: I ran from the next one.Pro Noobie Tips: Press "LeftMouseButton" on Poop, Tracks when they appear in fron of you and Sounds and/or "!" when they appear either in your PDA (Settlertracker thingie). It will tell you the dino it came from and approximate location. Crouching/Prone is your best friend when you suspect a dino, you will camofluage into your surroundings, just prone away from them...don't try to take one on as soon as you jump in, this isn't Call of Duty. You need to explore, get better gear/weapons, and use some tactics. Remember, Raptors usually aren't alone, they WILL call their friends over if close by.There ARE[/b] PvP SERVERS and they are pretty funny, because usually right after someone kills another player (PKing), a dino is close by to finish off the "bandit". Yes, it's full loot. IF YOU DIE: Try to run back to your death, you can loot your body for your items back, however, if you wait too long OR another player loots it before you get there, you are SOL. Last piece of advice, if you spawn near the mountina, try to climb it, I never found any dinos up there, BUT there were crates AND some "lore". I hope to see CRAFTING added to the game. As well as the ability to restack my items in my inventory. OH, and I WANT TO JUMP! And be able to DODGE and SWIM! Make it happen!Oh last thing: if they add crafting, just small things...make a camp tent, traps, etc. We need binoculars also please!Good stuff, you'll enjoy it, just don't try to play it like Call of Duty and you'll be fine. Stalk, gather, hide, wait for your prey.Good Luck!

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 9, 2015
												I'd like to start by saying that this game still has massive promise. And while it can become something that can be on par with ARK: Survival Evolved, at the current rate it'll never get there.The Devs of this game started off magnificently with introducing us to a brand new dinosaur hunting game that hasn't been properly seen since the days of Carnivores. They started well with trying to keep us up to date and happy with pumping out content as best they could but then things took an absolute turn for the worst. Content slowed, they no longer listened to their player base. Left MASSIVE amounts of holes, bugs and exploits in the game with no remedies in sight. Optomization never came either, thus leaving the game a Call of Duty-esque dino shoot-em-up riddled with hackers in the PvP games or if you're the PvE type, leaving you to forage and walk for hours and hours on end to obtain enough ammo to hunt a single animal. Not to mention the other gear needed to stay alive from the relentless zergs of Velociraptors, Utahraptors and unGodly amounts of T-Rexes roaming everywhere with laser vision that you stand NO chance of hiding from. Phew. Winded. Anyway. All in all, this game started great and literally went down the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ pretty quickly. Now, take allllll of that. And add in the fact that the game's own Devs stated, that they would no longer be replying to TheHunter Primal's playerbase via forums and would no longer be updating the game regularly so that they could return their focus to their mediocre Pay to Hunt flagship game TheHunter.In summary:Crappy weaponsCrappy weight systemCrappy loot systemCrappy spawn systemCrappy DevelopersMediocre dinosaur populationCarnivore overpopulationBugs, exploits, dupes, hacks and no optimizationCrappy DevlopersCrappy DevelopersCrappy Developers And lastly, crappy developers who have NO idea what they're actually doingSo! Don't get this game. Like at all. Ever. Go buy ARK: Survival Evolved. Those Devs know what's up, listen to their players and pump out content like pros and actually fix their mistakes. ARK has absolutely 0 complaints for me. TheHunter Primal gets a 2/10 from me and minus 10 points from Slytherin while ARK gets a 10 from me and plus 10 points to Gryffindor. Don't buy Primal. Buy ARK and profit and enjoy a more challenging game with better aspects, better players, more content and even more coming soon.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								This review is of 12/23/2014 - early access - I'm sure you have certain ideas about the game play, however, let me tell you what it really looks like. You get dropped in a forest. Then you walk around for about 20-30 minutes, yes, just walking... looking at a map. Foliage is like Skyrim, nice to look at. No mobs, no nothing. Once in a while you see a box appear on your map. You wander over there, get the contents (yeah, more arrows to kill a 18 foot T-Rex, how about sending me an assault rifle?). At some point you see a Triceratops which immediately runs away from you. You're starting to wonder why you're wasting your time on this "game"... then there's a T-Rex out of nowhere behind you. One bite and you're dead. Wow. Multiplayer must be better, right? It's the same. Only difference is that it's more frustrating, because every time someone logs off from the server the game literally pauses and announces it with a big, black screen that you can't exit until their connection has timed out. Keep in mind, this is early access... but for what it is right now, don't bother paying money. It's essentially a graphics demo.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
Early Access Review
								Noooooo.I love the Hunter, despite my constant ♥♥♥♥♥ing about how bloody expensive it is. A friend an myself play it quite frequently and we said after our first outing that if they released a Dinosaur version we'd buy it imediately, and we did.Hooooooowever...This isn't The Hunter anymore, it's "The 'running away from a velociraptor at a gentle jogging pace whilst the lizard follows you and doesn't quite manage to bite your♥♥♥♥♥♥off' Person".The game has this horrid fixation on being a DayZ ripoff, except (thank god) that the PvP is optional. This means that you start with a bloody longbow that gently inserts arrows into Dinosaurs in a sudo-acupuncture way instead of a proper gun of your choosing.The Velociraptors do add a nice tension, but they're far to abundant and are everywhere thus, the main focus of the game is not bumping into them, not hunting.My only hope is that, since this game isn't subscription based like The Hunter, that modders will rip it open and redesign it to be more like The Hunter, but with dinosaurs.In conclusion, WHAT ON EARTH WERE YOU THINKING?!?! Avalanche made a great Hunting simulator that was genuinely enjoyable, and would have only gotten better with Dinosaurs, but instead they decided to jump on the DayZ bandwagon with this god awful thing.Check back in a year and see if it's better, as of now, keep walking.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								DayZ with dinousaurs.Early access gameplay may change etc...Liked: Atmosphere, graphics, sound, dinousars, t-rex encounter the ground shakes and it just gives you an epic feeling, multiplayer with pvp or coop. Disliked: When somebody loses connection everybody on the server gets blackscreen and a window popup where you have to wait 12 sec (gamebreaking).Loot is very scarce and most items except .700 rifle is useless. The clothes do nothing and the shotgun/sniper is worse than bow. When trees are coming in to viewdistance they looks like invisible and made up of dots.Dinousaur AI is pretty dumb especially T-rex.Few dinosaur species and numbers.Map feels like a giant wasteland with zero interesting places.Inventory system is horrible you can't split or combine ammunition. You can't swim.You can sprint for 10 seconds then you have to walk for 5 minutes to do it again.No Vehicles.Many issues are from The hunter engine and that have been out since 2007. If they haven't fixed the issues since 2007, I doubt they would fix them now.Do not buy this game, the developers are interns that the company/studio don't pay for.This is a dirty cash grab that uses free/low paying workers to work on an easy formula with an already made engine.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								I am saying no only to the early access. I have now played enough to make an informed review. I have killed Utahraptors with a single arrow. I have also had them take 5 rouns from a 44 magnum AND multiple rounds from a 12 ga shotgun and still kill me. I have gone +20minutes withought even seeing a single track of a dinosaur then had 4 Trex appear in less than a 400m radius, I play TheHunter, I know how the gun mechanics and vital organs system works. I also know that the balistics in that game are fantastic. This game not so much. I played with my wife for 2 hours straight sneaking from camp to camp collecting guns, ammo, and gear hiding from dinos not taking a single shot. then when we decide we are ready and geared up we tried to take down a Trex. 7 rounds from the strongest gun in the game (the .700 double barrel) and 6 rounds of 12 Ga slugs. The trex turns and runs away like nothing happened. That being said people claim to have taken down rex's with just a group of 3 armed with only bows. So imagine my frustration with this game. Make it tough for us to get good gear fine. But dont make someone walk around for hours so they can die to the first dino they actually try and hunt.  3/10 for Graphics, sound, and you genuinely feel nervous when you are trying to hide from a predator hoping it doesnt find you.

								I gotta learn not to trust all the steam reviews I read...  Some people are impressed by so little that it led me to buying this...It should be noted for ANYONE wanting to buy this, it's a walking simulator... All you do is walk, with very little stamina, trying to find weapons, to shoot dinosaurs with.  The dinosaurs are incredibly tough, and your weapons probably won't do much...  Given that its early access i will come back in a few months and see if I change my review, but as of now, not worth spending the money on...  There is no "fun" as it is right now, and without fundamental design changes it won't be any fun regardless of early access or not...  I was skeptical as the other game by this company has a scam "f2p" model as stated by multiple reviews, but my wish for a cool dinosaur game made me buy it anyways, regretted it deeply...

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
Early Access Review
								Why NOT to buy this game:If you have friends that live farther than 100 ping away, you can not play the game together.There is no dedicated server, only listen servers ran by players.Single player automatically starts a listen server on your machine.You have to port forward to play games together, which you do not have to do in most current steam enginge games.The developers do not have plans to implement dedicated servers.The game is buggy, constantly clipping through walls etc.There is no jump, half the time you're continually running into a wall, or stuck on a piece of the world that makes no sense.The price is pretty high for what's in the game. Currently 3 types of dinosaurs and one big map. Sure there are a bunch of guns, but that's only if you find them.You can only run a short distance, i can understand this, the game isn't ver hard so the put limits on your to pretend it's hard.Graphics are sub par, and somewhat blurry. I played on the highest settings at 70 FPS and the game looked like a dino turd.This game has potential, obviously some people like it. I think it needs another 6-12 months before it will be playable.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2014
Early Access Review
								What I am writing its not a review, its my game session as soon as i bought the game, but if any of you is indecisive about buying the game it may help.1º I started the game, walked for around 100 meters heard a roar and got killed by a T-rex.2º I start the game pick up a bow and 10 arrows, so i start searching for bags to loot with my GPS, when i hear some screeches coming close, i lay down in a bush and see a Utahraptor I start shooting arrows at his belly, after 3 arrows he found me but i got him! I move down to the place i died, i see the T-REX really far away, but he seems to notice me and starts roaming near where i was so i just get away from him, i find a Rifle and 10 bullets, i shoot another Utahraptor that runs away from me, i start chasing him, only to find his poop saying he has around 30% health and his on the running, i keep trackin his tracks but without luck, so i just leave , i get to a place that looks like a radio station, when i see 2 Utahraptors rushing to me, i hide inside a tree trunk just to get the female Utahraptor bug out infront of the tree and stay there quiet for like 5m, so i gave up and tryed to kill them both, i shoot the female, and the male got me after.My 2 playtrough i survived 1 hour and 11 minutes, and walked for 7040 meters.While i did enjoy it, i cant recomend the game, i bought it because i want to support the devs, and because i like to see the game grown, i am the type of guy who enjoys coming here and trying the game once in a while to see how much it has evolved, so this is a nice game for people like me, because at the moment this is a game of great promise.Pros -Solid ControlsReally good atmosphere, with nice graphics and the dinosaurs sound great.The multiplayer is funPay to play without micro transactions ( this was said by the devs)A team with alot of experience on hunting gamesRuns great on a medium specc pc, so does look pretty well optimized.ConsA little buggy, as to expect from alpha, i had Trexs sitting on me without killing me, stepping also does nothing, dinosaurs rushing o watery areas and getting stuck,  or sometimes when a dinosaur is lured to you and even when he doesnt see you he may bug out and just camp you not allowing you to go anywhere.Lacks content, few guns, only 3 types of dynos the map is a little to deserted, plenty of dinos but atm scavenging equipment isnt all that much fun.Even so, so wait for the game to be more polished, while it is fun, if they deliver what their promising, this game will be a blast, but right now, only join if you want to help the devs test the game, or follow the development of the game.

number of helpful: 5 of 14 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
Early Access Review
								This game has a lot of potential. When I first seen screenshots and what the summary of the game said, I was imediatly excited for it because it brought back ideas of Carnivores. I loved that game and I've been wanting something like it, and this is a pretty good recreation of sorts but with more elements. I won't say that it's easy, far from it, but I will say, if the Devs listen (wich they are as far as I'm seeing) this game will be amazing. I'll go over a few things that got me all giddy inside and things that make me kinda ticked.Pros: There's defiantly qute a bit to this game and it has a lot of nice things to it.-Sounds : The sounds in this is amazing, absolutely astounding. Love it. -Visuals : The game is pretty, it's gorgeous and the dinosaurs look cool too.-Tracking System : I'll say that I'm new to theHunter "franchise" but I just adore the Settlernav. It shows where an animal is going or aproximate area as well as time when the "track" was left. And you can use it to put waypoints on the map as well, and I found out that if you're playing with a friend and they got a map fragment that shows a closer settlement thing, they can set a way point and you can see their waypoint they set so you can meet up.Cons: There's quite a bit that's kinda bad about this game, but they're fixable.-Wepons : EVERYTHINGS UNDER POWERED! Me and a friend shot one Utahraptor, point blank in the head and chest, with five arrows, 6 .307 rounds, and 4 .44 handgun rounds... Everything's way too under-powered and that's really upsetting when you can't take down a raptor running at you to save your-self.- Raptors : The thing is after we tried killing the raptor, me and my firend had no ammo and had to run... or shall I say walk away from the raptors. If you walk in a strait line, it's impossible for them to get you because their attack is " RUN. STOP. BITE. REPEAT." They need to be given actual attacks like pouncing and biting as they go. What animal stops THEN bites. None, they keep attacking. They also should have less health than they do now. They're fragile yet strong creatures. they should not be able to take a small army's worth of ammo to the head and keep going. No!- Aiming : Ok, this one may be my computer, but when ever I aim. My entire game lags... or should I say, my character lags. The dinosaurs go the same speed, but I lag and can't follow them to actually get their spine because that's one of the few places you can actually get them with decent amount of ammo (like 3 arrows). Also, as I'm lagging, the wepons CONSTANTLY moving down, I have to quickly keep moving my mouse up to be able to even hit it somewhere. And the Holding Breath mechanic doesn't really work because the guns going down all the time. By the time you get a decent shot, you let out and you gotta start all over again. It NEEDS RE-WORKING!- Server Set-Up : Ok, I'm onto the little things now. A nice little dedicated server set-up would be nice, but I'm sure the Devs are working on that too.- Dinosaurs : They said they're planning on more dinosaurs. But When they actually do, decrease the population of the raptors. They're oozing from the crevases of the mountains... And you can't get away from them, there's no chance to get them off of you so you can go get better things. They harass you untill you give up. You can't distract them when they're attacking as well because there's no pebbles or anything laying around to make them get off. There's a few pebbles in the marsh but that areas infested with raptors too. when something starts going after you. There's no chance at all to escape.- Raptor calls : They sound way to much like lions... I want something that sounds a little diferent than an animal of our time.- Trike feathers : The feathers on the Triceratops look freaking rediculous. The animals compleatly feather-less besides that mowhawk of feathers. It looks dumb. Add a layer of thin feathering then yeah, that'd be cool.IDEA: Might add to it.- Pterasaur Hunting : It'd be pretty awesome if you could hunt pterasaurs like birds of our time. Add in rahmphorincus' by the coasts. Make like a call, chuming and bird shot too. That'd be sick.- Dino Interaction: I would love to see dinosaur interaction. Like being able to see a pack of raptors or a rex bring down an herbivore and munch on it, and be able to stumble on a kill and be able to tell when and what actually killed the animal and start traking from there.- A little cabin of sorts for like saving yourself from the dinosaurs or a save point and able to purchase wepons and gear with the in game currencey and store.Conclusion.I would like to say I recomend this game, but I don't entirely. It's much too soon for it to be any real fun for a long time. The only way you can get from point A to point B in the game safely is prone crawling to it. It takes years. Running should be increased too instead of running 4 paces and can't anymore. But if you want to watch a game grow, expand, and recive tender-loving-care that I'm hoping it'll recive and like dinosaurs and initial testing of games, putting in your imput as well, get it. But for now, untill things get better sorry "theHunter: Primal" I don't recomend you.[I'll update as the game does. I REALLY WANT to love this game. I really do and Devs, coming from a dino nerd. Don't mess this up, please. Don't just add in 2 more dinos. Add in like 10 or 20! Make the HUGE map you made feel alive instead of feeling empty of any and all life besides you and the walking Mini-Tanks that are the Utahs. Please nerf them.]

content:
Posted: April 4, 2015
												First thing is please ingore the negative reviews espically on the "nothing but walking" bit. This game is thrilling and to survive can be a challenge. The beginning is a pain to play but once you loot a better weapon or learn how to use the blade correctly you'll survive. What negative reviewers fail to realize is, YOU DO NOT WANT TO RUN INTO DINOS, it's a freaking survival game. However you can try to find them if you learn to use the tracking.How long can you survive? That is the question. Five dinosaurs is a fair amount for game to hunt, but at the same time lacking. Now one thing I'm shocked about (proabably patched) is I haven't seen any flyers... Might be a good thing tbh. Also something else about this game is exploring, there are hidden goodies if you can find them. i.e logs. From the couple of hours I've put into it the diffuclty of the game goes as follows, easiest to hardest. Velociraptors: Decently easy to kill with the standard blade. You can one hit them, but if you are being attacked by a pack, they may kill you.Triceratops: Will take some time to take down, but they hardly attack. Unless you upset it.. then watch out for the horns.Utahraptors: These will kill you easily. I've notice they have different skin colors (could be my imagionation) and like the Velociraptors they will hunt in packs. You can scare off one if you can learn to dodge and fight with the balde, but if you want to *cough* hunt it... I suggest learning to use the bow or get the rifle.Tyrannosaurus Rex: Use extreme caution and RUN THE F*** AWAY! Unless you have decent hunting gear on you and with friends. I highly recommend you do not attempt to take it down alone, unless you are very skilled at stealth. Although the death animation is just funny.Flyer: ??? I have no data to give you on how to fight it. I would assume if you hear the flapping, look the the skies and try to kill it before it grabs you. Hunting can be a fun sport (I come from a family of hunters), and I was suprised they applied "vital hits". It's just like acutal hunting, quickest way to kill it, aim for the heart!I don't know what else to say about this game other than SURVIVE! Although I would like to seem more dino species in the future.

Early Access Review
								Walking simulator 0.1 might be a better title, since that is how I feel when I play the game.First of all it is a beautifull game on a large island. The dinos are beautifull.Well other than that, I did actual only see t-rex and non of the other animals anywhere though I walked 10km on the map. I saw many t-rex dinos and they are extremly deadly. However I did manage to survive an attack by hiding in a tree and laying still for 5 minutes while i could hear the t-rex walking arround outside with its big heavy food steps... After a while I thought it is gone and i slowly crawl away and thought I was so lucky to survive.. However the t-rex spotted me and I could hear it come running for me and then I got killed again.Other than that the game is about exploring. I would say it is a kind of survival game and not much a hunting game since there are only 3 animals so far, and it do require you to find som good gear to be able to do anything... This take alot of time and well the game feel like a "walking" simulator more than everything els.ALso the story of the game is rather strange. You walk from a-b to hunt dinos, but you have to find boxes of stuff here and there on the map before you can do so. To be honest I do really not understand WHY there in the first place are boxes here and there in a dino world without humans. Im aware there have been other people there to hunt and stuff like that but it still think it is very strange boxes are scattered over the entire island, it simply do not fit in.I hope this game will add many more animals for free and NOT release DLC's with new animals.Also i sincerely hope that the game will not become like "the hunter" where you are limited to only hunting a few animals and if you want to hunt more or see another island then you have to pay for it.In general i do not like the game it is simply very borring.. But ofcourse it is in development so lets see how it will evolve.I will maybe write a new review in the future.

content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
Early Access Review
								TheHunter: Primal is still quite clearly in early access.There are several issues with the game at the moment, not least of which being the AI, as a lot of people have noted before me. I will give you a short list of the things that are a bit weird/bad in this game:- Raptors are unable to attack you from behind if you simply walk away from them- Raptors act in very weird ways when you have your back faced against them, such as do not attack you, will try to, but are not able to or will just stand next to you and do nothing- Ai pathfinding is quite bad in a lot of cases, causing you to find triceratopses climbing mountains or t-rexes stuck in trees.- Pathfinding is especially an issue when the dinos are chasing you, stopping randomly and making 90 degree turns out of the blue or running around in odd patterns and not directly coming straight at you.- Raptors sometimes absolutely ignore you, even if you are literally standing right next to them.- Dinos often completely ignore the fact that they are being shot at and will not notice you until you have shot your 10th arrow into them.- The dinos will often freeze if you just hide in a bush and they come looking for you, causing them to get stuck into their idle animation indefinitely until you come out of the bush.- Multiplayer barely works.And here is a list of just general things I've noticed in the game:- Weapons do very little damage, HOWEVER this is not a problem and I hope the devs do not buff the weapons, at least not too much. This means that actually killing things requires you to know their weakspots, often this is not the head. This means that you really can't really mow down dinos with guns and have to instead wait for a good moment when you can get a clear shot at their heart, for an example.- Sprint is horribly short and the cooldown for it is horribly long. You can run for about 30 meters and you have to catch your breath for about a minute.- It feels very silly having to stand still for 20 seconds when you run out of ammo to let that raptor you shot claw you to death, maybe the game could use some sort of melee weapons, anything to make it feel like you are actually fighting back, even being able to use your fists would be nice, just give me something to make it feel less like I always just silently have to accept my fate whenever I fail to kill something and run out of ammo.- dinos do not attack eachother. Since when did t-rexes let triceratopses just chill right next to them?- Inventory stuff is a bit broken. You cannot stack smaller stacks of items to create one bigger stack. 1 bullet weighs as much as 20 bullets.- A HUDless mode would be nice, there might be one in the menu, but if not, adding one would be really cool. Although the current HUD is very unnoticeable, which I do appreciate, a HUDless mode would be even better.- You can lose all your items if you suddenly lose connection to the game server, which sucks,Even after all of that, I do really like the game. The sounds are excellent and it is very intense to hear that t-rex stomping behind you while you are hiding in a bush. The game manages to make some really memorable moments happen in its random world almost constantly and I mean that in a good way, not talking about just glitches. If I played this game in junior high, I think this would have been one of those games where me and my friends would just talk about all the crazy stuff that happened to us in this game during lunchbreaks. The gun sound and feel phenomenal, I don't think I have heard better guns in games before, granted I don't know too much about guns, but the guns actually feel like they pack a real punch and aren't just cap guns. The tracking mechanics work great and it is really cool to track down that raptor you shot and which is now running away. The world, albeit a bit bare, looks beautiful.However, even after all that good, I will say I do not recommend this game at its current phase, even though I have myself enjoyed it immensly. This is due to the fact that it is not right now a very good game, due to the bugs and balancing issues, a fun game (in my opinion) maybe, but a good one it is not. However if you are able to look past all the bugs there is a great game in here with an even greater atmosphere where you can easily lose yourself for hours.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												This Game ROCKS! Absolutely worthy of being a "complete game"Well balanced, visually stunning(when you're not deep in the jungle), and completely worth the money. As with most games of this genre, survial/hunting, it takes time getting use to. Don't start playing if you're just gonna get frusterated and angry(use dark souls as a litmus test).Personally, I didn't find a gun until hour 10, but that was for a lack of stealth and understanding. If you stay low and hidden, preferably with a buddy, you can easily play the game for hours.In short, ignore reviews that have less than 40hrs gameplay, it takes a few days to understand and appreciate what The Hunter Primal brings to the table.

content:
Posted: April 4, 2015
												Overall, a pretty good game, however I feel that alot needs to be added in terms of behavioural traits of the dinosaurs - not once have I come across a silent T-rex in my times of watching tv shows, documentaries, and series and witnessed one myself. I also believe that the basis of when a dinosaur is shot should be a more realistic outcome that what is in place now; I get that this game isnt out of beta or whatever, but still, for future reference. A more realistic outcome may be that they gain a limp/become slower when shot, because in real life, if something is shot, their stamina/whatever is shot is damaged considerably, especially if it is with a high-caliber sniper rifle atleast 20 times. I get that dinosaurs are alot tougher to kill than your average bear or elephant, but they dont require 20 .700 bullets to take a single triceratops down.To add to this, I do believe that the pack-size of certain dinosaurs could be tweaked too. I was lead to believe that T-rex's were solitary, not travelling in packs of 3-5. This element is something I would look into alot because it makes it alot harder for newer players to kill a dinosaur-not that t-rex's are hard enough to kill already- never mind stay alive.In addition, I believe, personally, that a goal is to be added so that the game isnt just leading to the survival of you and your team mates. Maybe personal/team quests could be added, or maybe objectives or something to add an element of challenge towards the game, and not just your "generic dinosaur sandbox-survival".Another thing, a positive, is that this game is very aesthetically pleasing. They fixed the aliasing so that this game is less of a headache to play, and not one thing was out of place. The game itself is very artistic and beautiful, and so i give credit to that.Anybody that wishes to buy the game I want to note that this game is still in beta, and so you may have to wait until the game you're lead into believeing is complete is actually polished. They are very frequent with the updating, so i doubt it would take very long to do this. This game would be well worth the money if it was out of beta, I bought this a while ago when it was on sale, so if you get the chance i suggest you buy it then.To sum up:POSITIVES-Aesthetically pleasing-Still in beta, more things to be added.-Good array of weapons and clothing.-Advanced detail in terms of terrain and terraforming.-Dinosaurs are well-textured and can sometimes change depending on their age/gender.NEGATIVES-Pack sizes too large with certain dinosaurs (T-rex's, Triceratops')-Map maybe a little bit difficult to traverse (not a big issue)-hit's need to be more realistic.-maybe a little bit too pricey.**Please note, I am aware that the game is still in Beta. I'm just stating some things that could be added**Overall, a good game and I would definitely recommend it to anyone.

												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.Eat.

content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
												The:hunter primal is a game about surviving on a dinosaur island for as long as you can. the game is multiplayer and is quite enjoyable for some people,myself included. You either love it or hate it.Gameplay: i recommend re-binding most of your keys when you start the game because they are not "normal" in terms of what you'd expect in a first person shooter.  The gameplay consists of walking,finding loot,see/hear dinosaurs,and shooting dinosaurs in the heart. It can be very very repetetive and boring sometimes,but you get to look at the beutiful world of "primal eden" in all of it's glory. there are 5 dinosaurs in the game: The T-rex,triceratops,utharaptor,velociraptor and quetzacoatlus. most of the dinosaurs can be really hard and frustrating to kill,but when you do you feel like a boss.This game can go from astonishingly beutiful to plain down scary,one momment you look at the beutiful sunset ,the other you hear faint stomping growing louder and louder, it is at that point you are standing 6 feet away from a t-rex face to face...then you get eaten.You can customize tha graphics in the launcher and not in-game.I really recommend this game to all of you dinosaur fans !   i rate it 9,5 out of 10Excuse my poor spelling skills because it is 03:04 in the morning and i am tired and cant think straight! :)

number of helpful: 19 of 44 people (43%) found this review helpful59 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
Early Access Review
								My time on Hunter: Primal a difficult time. I got in the game, my first encounter was some grass eater dino or what it's called, Dinos is not really a thing I now much about. I follow it for a while and untill it took me to a weary thick jungle, there I heard some weird sound and that something was moving between the bushes. I moved around for a while hoping that the sound would go away, I knew that it was something in great numbers that my tiny♥♥♥♥♥♥bow wouldn't stand a chance to defeat. 2min later I heard something roar and 3 raptors moved in attack mode straight to me... My second time playing, I thought that I should stay away from the thick jungle and try some other place, maybe more open. That's when my GPS thing start to pick up some loud noice, I follow the GPS coordinates to the sound. After a 300m walk I heard big footsteps I thought to my self "I'm screwd, ain't I?" And betwin the trees a big T-rex walked towards me. I pulled my bow and start to fire me arrows, but the T-rex was pretty much careless and just continued to walking towards me. I became T food. I finally found it, a chalange that I can go for, that T-Rex head will hang on my wall, I named him Glen. I know I can take out Glen, I just need to be more carefull and better equipped then just a bow, so I started to scavange for a while, I eventually found a shotgun and ammo, but Glen was stalking me. No matter where I go hes there, it mocks me, I know that. It barely tries to kill me anymore, it just stept on me, or just smack me with it's head, no it didn't eat me, it punched me with it's nose.After some time I found a box with a new map location... It looked like a globe or an atom the icon... Could it be? YES, science! Science can probably help me, I know they can, is there something science can't do? So I had my new destination, towards the science station. After my great journey to science, I could't belive it, Glen was here to, he was looking for me. I took a run for it to the science station, I could hear Glens big footsteps behind me, looking for me. I can't die here, I didn't walk 10 000m to die now. I run, I hide I need to get there, science must have left something good behind for me to take. When I finally arrived, I found two boxes, "finally, what could be in here?" I got the first one and opend it and found a shotgun... Well, this could be good, I read the ammo description and noticed it was was specially for big dinos. GREAT, I went to the second one and founda a magnum, this should work to I guess, if I lay down when I shoot I could take him on a mid range. I bucked up and headed towards Glen, he should have left some tracks after him, and he's weary loud to. It didn't take long till he start to roar so my GPS could find the posision the sound comes from. And there he was, Glen, my nemesis, the dino that have made my life to hell here on this planet, I will have my revenge! I found a good hiding spot in a bush, I pulled out my Magnum and aimed carefully on his side neck. If I get a good hit, he should bleed weary much there. I pulled out my first shot, but Glen didn't seem to care weary much. I pulled on more, he looked to the left with no care... WTH, I fire it again, and again and again and again. I fire him 16 times and Glen just didn't care. Then I took my shotgun and fired it. Glen reacted, Could this be it? His weaknes? Glen walked towards me, he knew I was somewhere around, he bypass me, I fired a shot on his neck, he turned around and start to stand over me. My heart start to beat weary loud, I have never been this close to him without him killing me. I couldn't tell if I did any great damage to him, but he walked pass me again later, and I found my chance, I gave him a shot on the side of his head. And I shot again, and again... After 10 round on the same spot, I couldn't believe it, he was still standing, after so much fire power Glen is still standing. Glen left after I feelt my defeat, and found some blood on the ground he left, I took my GPS and scanned it... No... how is it possible? The blood scanned showed that Glen still haves 99%hp left! It's not possible, I.... I... I don't know how to kill Glen... I... I need him dead, I have to see him dead now! I will continue fighting, I will have his head on my wall singing a fun jingle over my fireplace! Some day I will see him fall to the ground, if it so take me my entire LIFE!!!10/10 would Hunt for revenge again!

								Fairly basic game, seems like it took around 5 whole minutes to develope. The controls are complete garbage. Games now should not take multiple key presses to get one function to work. This game has massively delayed controls. Secondly, hiding is a complete issue, as the clipping of dinosaurs is almost completely no exsistant. Also, the map seems as if a child of really low intelligence made it. It has steep cliffs, and your character can't climb most hills, let alone you get massively damaged if you manage to slip on one of these. Oh, another thing, there are tons of islands on the game, non of which you can visit as your character can't swim and is paralized for several seconds apon touching water.This game is poorly programmed, poorly developed, and seems as if it were another game made by Sergey Titov, except that War Z was better programed when it was first released, and that says alot.

number of helpful: 2 of 10 people (20%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 31, 2015
												This game is most certainly complete, unlike what other reviews are saying. The mecahnics all work, the dinosaur AI has been vastly improved from what it was, and the number of bugs have been greatly decreased. The Hunter: Primal is a game filled with content and the developers were (and still are) consistantly patching the game and it will continue to get better.The most important thing to say about this game is that it is NOT for everybody. This is a game that requires time and effort to excel at and most people will get angry or give up when they first play. It is a survival/hunting game where you kill dinosuars. why would it be easy?The thing I like most about this game is the suspense. You start out in an unfamiliar island, armed with only a bow (or now a machete) and you have to survive long enough to find better weapons and become the hunter, rather than the hunted. There are heart pounding moments when you are crawling through the jungle trying desperately not to be seen by a pack of raptors hunting you or when you first hear the stomping of a T.rex as it approaches you and subsequently eats you. The Hunter: Primal is best played with friends. Trekking across the jungle to team up with a buddy and hunting and killing a T.rex is a great feeling and it takes a lot of what can be stressful moments away if you have a friend to be with you.  In review (get it) this game is fantastic and it only continues to get better as the developers update and improve it. It will take some getting used to and has a steep learning curve but if this game style interests you (and especially if you have buddies to play with) it can be played for hours on end. Plus who doesnt love dinosaurs

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 21, 2014
												December 15th 2015: ♥♥♥♥ THIS GAME, so full of bugs, bad spawning point and ♥♥♥♥ off, Just buy a game like ARK Survival Evolved.I played as a solo player so my evaluation might not apply for multiplayer.  My first impression is that this game is a hunting game where 99% of the time, you're the prey. Of the three types of dinosaurs that you can hunt, the tyrannosaurus is to player what he is to a ant. The utahraptor make you feel uneasy when it's alone and it get worse when they're in pack. The triceratops goes from "easy prey" to fast as hell when you manage to hit it, and you have to follow it to the gate of hell to hunt it down. This game is not a survival game, as the only threat to  your life are the dinosaurs and the water (because you can't swim). There is no consideration about sleeping, eating, drinking, infections and other hazard that we love to overcome in survival game. I didn't notice fall damage, especially when I fell from a huge mountain. Of course, the game is in early access so I'm sure the game will be a blast with a interesting start like thatPro:-Beautiful environment-The settlements seem to show potential for safe haven or some history -The dinosaurs are very well done and their behavior are interesting Con:-The shooting system is not great, especially in a tight spot-The basic bow is pretty useless no matter what you are hunting and to get better weapons, you have to search for hours. And even with better weapons, you need to use stealth like I never had to in other game.-The inventory does not combine similar items together, like arrow or bullet.-To have a true hunting gear, it's all up to luck and hours of search for almost nothing-There is no crafting-The variety of dinosaurs needs to be increased.

												Ok this is my first review so stick with me here.The hunter primal is a hunting game where you have to actually get off your backside and stalk the enemy there is none of this guns blazing so if you are impatient don't get it and if you do you've been warned so don't come here kicking and screaming after 2 hours of gameplay calling it s%%t there are pro's and con's like with all games of this caliber yes the devs could put more into it with updates new dino's and new weapons, they should also do something about the amount you can carry.you dont need real money to buy the better gear it can all be found in game or you get in game currency when you kill the dino's but you'll only get to use that when you die and trust me YOU WILL DIE!you are being hunted everything wants to kill you and on the pvp servers its twice as bad.if you like games where you hunt in the means of tracking the prey then stalking it actually aiming and saving ammo and getting that good shot in the head or heart top drop the "trophy" or shoot it in the lungs legs or wherever and follow a blood trail then this is for you.if you cant be bothered to wait around save ammo and try to find the biggest trike or something then dont get it.hopefully the devs will put more into it but there is a big emphasis on hopefully the devs will put more into this

Early Access Review
								Has the potential of becoming a true gem. Curious how it's gonna turn out.Graphics - 9/10Dino textures are top notch, world looks great, same texture quality as theHunterAudio - 10/10Best part of the game, adds huge immersiveness to the gameHearing those raptors allmost plotting their plan.Gameplay - 7/10 Needs some fine tuning. More dino diversity, but that's probably on the agenda.Points of interest should be worked out a bit more. So, final verdict. This is early access, but if all game releases would be like theHunter: Primal, there would be less complaining. It's more than a succes. Some minor bugs.

Early Access Review
								So far, I feel like it may be exeedingly incomplete. But, my experience may also be influenced by my computer specs. The trees looked like giant cones from only a small distance, and as I got closer the turned into real trees. The ground was covered in bushes that were surouned in grey polygons and I could hardly tell what I was walking on. I had no idea where I was supposed to go to get weapons. I could walk right through the pod I assume I came out of. I would like to hear some audible naration at the beginning at least. I hit control and ended up swimming in the groung or something. The controls were not really explained at all when I started playing. Also, starting up the game did not close the opening window that you would hit "Play Game" on. So it left multiple windows open. I reallly hope to see the game a bit more playable; I was reallly excited to play a hunting/survival game and it was not really playable on day two. Again, My experience may have been influenced by my personal computer. I really hope to see this game excel and become a long, hardly ending, fight for survival game. I want to run through the woods, hide in a cave for shelter, and Hunt dinosaurs for food lol! I really dont even care about a campaign  personally.

Early Access Review
								My first impressions of this game is that it is great and has awesome potential.  I love the atmospherics sounds, the feeling of am I the only humna alive on this planet, and the dinosaurs sounds.  Playing with my headphones on I was walking along when I thought I could hear a vary faint thump thump thump  in my ears.  As it grew louder I fell to the ground on my belly and waited.  Sure enough a T-Rex came over the hill and walked passed me within about twenty feet.  It paused and sniffed the air before giving a little roar and moved off.  It was a breath-holding experience.  Once it was far enough away I sneaked off. Fantastic!

content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
												I have no idea what the others are talking about, but this game is beautiful, the atmosphere is tense, and although there are only five dinosaurs, the world does seem quite full. My girlfriend loves dinosaurs, so we got this game to play, and I was very skeptical at first, and doubted the content it possessed, ready to demand a refund. After portforwarding so we could do a private game, we were plunged into a canyon, cut by a river. I tried to reach her and immediately, I was greeted by a set of teeth that belonged to a raptor. I got destroyed. Keep in mind this is five mintues in. I tried to go back to my corpse to get my items to then again, be greeted by an abnoxious raptor. I hid in a bush while it looked for me, and I heard the ground being stomped on. I thought "Great. I am f*****" and I was. A T-rex stepped over the bush I was in and looked at the little rapor, and I FIGURED they'd fight to the death. I was wrong. They teamed up and scanned for me together. After waiting for what seemed an eternity, the duo left and we continued our journey. Which ended in us getting trapped by the same T-rex, and we jumped to our deaths. 10/10 I love it.

content:
Posted: December 25, 2014
Early Access Review
								    This game is a lot different then i thought it would be when i purchased it. I love the graphics and dinosaur designs. There are more cons than pros in my opinion, at the moment though. I know this is early access but at this point in time your character walks incredibly slow, which isn't necessarily a bad thing, but the fact that running doesnt boost your speed that much, and the lack of stamina to begin with, just makes out for boring gameplay. My last complaint is the dinosaur AI. you can simply walk away from a Utahraptor without it harming you, and the voices of the dinosaurs repeat very quickly which makes it sound cheesy.      theHunter: Primal does have a lot of great things coming its way though if they can pull it off. But for what it has now is good enough as a dinosaur game by far. If you're a dinosaur fan and enjoy a beautiful open world, i highly recommend this game. I think its definitely worth it, especially if you want to support.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								TheHunter: Primal takes everything good about TheHunter and makes it more awesome. You still have the slow ramble through the wild while you look for beasts, listening for their cries, tracking them, and trying to sneak close enough to get in a good shot.. only now you're tracking dinosaurs. And they can track you back.My second time out in Primal Eden I came upon a Triceratops. After startling him I followed his trail for a while before I realized the growling behind me wasn't just part of the general atmosphere. Diving into a bush saved me from a Utahraptor who walked by and presumably kept tracking the same animals I was. But when I made to leave the safety of the underbrush, another Utahraptor brought up the rear. I froze.. but it was too late. I became his lunch.Great game, I'm going to play it for a long time. I get giddy when I remember this is in beta and it'll be even more awesome as time goes by. I hope for a lot of dinosaurs to be added in.Oh, and unlike TheHunter, there are no memberships or micro-transactions. You buy the game and it is yours, and you find what you need through luck and perseverance.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								In this game you are air dropped into a world inhabited by dinosaurs where you try to hunt and kill them for sport.You start off with a bow and a handful of arrows and must make your way on foot using a hand-held computer to find better weapons and gear, as well as track dinos.There are currently 3 types of dinos in this game: Raptors, Triceratops, and the T-Rex.  The other threat are poisonous plants.As far as I can tell - you do not craft or build anything in this game.Pros:- The map is massive - I'm guessing it's probably about the size of Maui.  - The flora is nice looking.Cons:- The bow is almost worthless.  The odds of taking out a raptor is very slim.- If you sprint - you run out of stamina after 20-40 yards/meters.- If you exit the game, you will lose all of your weapons, ammo, and other gear.- you cannot cross water that is knee deep (or deeper).Overall:In this game:  You walk thru the jungle.  When a raptor attacks you, you shoot at it with whatever weapon you have on hand (only vital shots count).  If you killed it, you scan the kill in your computer (yay points).  If you did not one-shot the raptor, you die.  If more than one raptor attacks, you die.  If you encounter a T-rex, you die.  This is a walking/hunting/dying simulator.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												I want to preface this review by stating that the game can actually be enjoyable in small doses with several people. The game has a plethora of issues between glitchy hitboxes, glitchy textures, glitchy movement, overpowered dinosaurs, underpowered weapons, a shortage of weapons, an incredibly large distance of aggravation for t-rexes, and a map that is simply too big to explore at the snails pace that you move.A huge game issue for me is simply the fact that after dinos are hit often enough they run away at a speed you can't match. As soon as they exit the camera it's almost as if their health resets. This is an infuriating mechanic for a game with the objective to actually kill things.An important thing to note is that firearms or a bow is almost required to kill a dino, and they are found few and far between.Ultimately, this is a game with a lot of potential, which was overall wasted.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 21, 2015
												This is actually my first review of a game (I believe), so I'll try to be very honest.I got this game in a bundle, and was thinking that this would be similar to Savage Lands, or Rust or any other game like that. Instead, I got very happy when I found out your main objective is to HUNT DINOSSAURS, which sounds and should be extremely awesome and fun. Instead what you get is a barely playable piece of garbageware.There are several things wrong with this game, but I'll start with the few that ARE good:- For the size of the island and the amount of things it renders, it runs very smoothly compared to other similar games, that are usually terribly optimized for PC;- The dinossaur models look really nice. They did an awesome job modeling these creatures;- The sound plays a very important role, which is always nice;- Multiplayer hosting is very easy and straight forward;And that's basicly all there is good to it.Everything else is pretty bad:- You can't run 50 metres without running out of stamina. Remember that you are playing a game where you fight dinossaurs, often bigger and faster than you, and you cannot run enough to dodge their attacks. I read the forums, some people view this as CHALLENGE, where I just view it being abnoxious, because the very moment you find yourself at the wrong end of a dinossaur, you're done for.- Did I mention that the stamina you use for running is also the same stamina used for attacking? That makes a hit & run strategy completely out of the question. you either hit and die or run and die a little bit later.- The fact that you can't run makes playing with friends extremely annoying, since when you die, you respawn nearly a mile away from a friend, and walking takes alot of time.- Your initial weapons are pretty much useless. Regardles of how much you manage to dodge the dinossaurs and attack, the moment the dinossaurs feel like they're getting too hurt, they run away instantly. This makes sense, and I can imagine it would lead to extremely fun moments where you'd race against the dinossaur or stalk him to his nest if, you know,  you could actually run.- Regardless of the dinossaur's difficulty, they're pretty dumb. If you circle them by the tail they'll just endlessly turn with you. Ocasionally they'll try to run forward and turn around to gain some space, but if you go after them you'll get them by the tails again.- There are smaller dinossaurs in the island that are actually killable. I figured they'd be for early-game, for people to hunt down these easier dinossaurs until you progress and unlock better stuff to kill the big dinossaurs with. Big F-ing nope. They attack you, take life easily from you if they're in a group, and give you nothing at all if you kill every single one of them. Not a single G.- The game is very undecisive when it comes to movement in various terrains. You aren't allowed to jump, but you can take fall damage from very small falls. You can climb up mountains that almost make 90 degrees with the ground at regular speed as if it were nothing, but good luck trying to go back down. Yeah, apparently all the dinossaur dung on top of the mountain made your feet slippery, and as soon as you touch the ground to climb down again you'll instantly slip and fall to your death.I could go on for several more points, but I feel like these are the main decisive points on why I recommend people to avoid buying this game. I have played bad games on Steam and never wrote a review on them, but I had to for this game, for the simple reason that it had everything needed to be a great game, and in the end it feels more like a slap in the face for ever buying it.4/10 - in need of a serious revamp.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2015
												This game is unfinished. It's glitchy and the interface is clunky. For instance, to change ammo types you have to open the equipment menu, drag the old ammo type off the gun, and drag the new ammo  type onto the gun. One of the first items I found was a shotgun sight that refused to be attached to my shotgun. There are only five types of dinosaurs. And only one map. While Perfect Dark offered us tons of bodies and heads  to customize your character with in 2000, in theHunter here are four (badly rendered) characters to pick from. I'm not even sure what this game is trying to -be-. I mean, a typical FPS would offer more weapon and enemy types. An action-adventure game should have mechanics for climbing trees, catching yourself as you begin to fall, and require you to catch food. A survival-horror game would involve puzzles, build tension, and have some sort of goal beyond shooting dinosaurs for XP.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 20, 2015
												I'm pretty torn on this game.  You're thrown into a new world through an escape pod and left with a machete and a map chip to help guide you through an expansive world.  Your apparent objective is to hunt down as many dinosaurs before succumbing to your inevitable demise.  Once you die, your equipment and your body is left to be eaten while a "family member" is spawned at a random place nearby.  If you want that equipment back, you basically have to trek through the jungles and mountains to regain your possessions or search for more boxes of goodies scattered throughout the lands.  The pros of this game are that you get to walk around with dinosaurs, enjoying the view, and taking the time to learn the long-lost art of tracking down game.  You can spend hours doing this.The cons are plentiful.  There aren't many dinosaurs.  You'll only get the 5 types of dinosaurs advertised.  It can get pretty repetitive hunting down the same dinosaurs over and over.  There's not much variety in that sense.  To make matters worse, the AI for the dinosaurs are pretty bad.  They each have their own way to move, which of course makes sense, but they tend to move directly towards a waypoint.  If you run out of the way, they will not change their path.  They'll arive at the waypoint, then turn around to recalculate.  This doesn't make the game any easier, because the T-Rex will kill you, but the realism takes a hit in that sense.  To add to the cons, the game is not fun when you're playing it alone.  It's all fine and dandy while learning how to do things, but once you figure out the main aspect of the game it gets pretty boring.  I can only play long enough until I die, and then I shut the game off.  There are no missions or no primary objectives.  You just kill dinosaurs and hope to harvest them for points.  You collect the same objects over and over, and then go out and use them against only a few of the dinosaurs.  The rest of the time, you're tracking for hours looking for the one that you wounded while avoiding the ones that are just too hard to kill or more likely to kill you in one blow.  You need multiplayer to make this game enjoyable.And my biggest buzz kill is no controller support.  I never liked keyboard/mouse games, especially when I have a perfectly good controller that can execute all of the small list of tasks available to the player.  Your guy can't even climb, jump, or swim, so there's nothing complex behind slapping on a few instructions for a controller.Overall, I say it's a well made game that I enjoyed for some time and would recommend for others to play, but like the dinosaurs it doesn't stand the test of time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												12/17/2014: So far I'm loving this game. I've played about 6 hours as of writing this and I've played solo as well as with friends. I will say, if you're looking for a terrifying experience, play solo. With the lights off. With the bass on the speakers way up. And put a glass of water next to you.The gameplay feels little clunky and rigid, but it's an early alpha stage of the game and there's only 3 types of dinosaurs at the moment, but for what stage this game is in it looks beautiful, the sound effects are terrifying, and it's not a run and gun once you get gear, but you MUST evade dinosaurs at all times or you're probably going to die. They're clever and violent.Aside from the expected buggy nature of an early alpha game, I would highly recommend this game. 9/10UPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATE!UPDATE 3/3/2015: As a full release game, there isn't much that has been added to the game and there's a serious lack of variety in dinosaurs and vegetation. There's a barely existent backstory, no driven purpose, and it feels like it was rushed to release with a promise of more material based on how well the game does AFTER "Full" release. That's a very poor marketing choice and practically screams "Bored, now! Here's this thing we made. Now get bent."The game can't do well if it's left unfinished by community standards, but promising to finis- errr, "add more" to the game if it does well despite that fact is foolish and near-sighted. It cannot do well in its current state and I am thoroughly disappointed in the devs for rushing it to release with so little content.

												This game is finally what I've been waiting for since Carnivores 2 came out on PC ages ago.  You hunt dinosaurs, not deer, in a big world with plenty of weapons full of immersion.  The sounds are amazing and can really get you tense when a T-Rex is around.  However, at its current stage, the price is a little bold. If the developers can bring in more species (not all of them needing to be carnivores either) and program them to realistically interact with each other, than I would rate this game a 10/10 because seriously.  Dinosaurs!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 6, 2015
Early Access Review
								In this game you are air dropped into a world inhabited by dinosaurs where you try to hunt and kill them for sport.You start off with a bow and a handful of arrows and must make your way on foot using a hand-held computer to find better weapons and gear, as well as track dinos.There are currently 3 types of dinos in this game: Raptors, Triceratops, and the T-Rex.  The other threat are poisonous plants.As far as I can tell - you do not craft or build anything in this game.Pros:- The map is massive - I'm guessing it's probably about the size of Maui.  - The flora is nice looking.Cons:- The bow is almost worthless.  The odds of taking out a raptor is very slim.- If you sprint - you run out of stamina after 20-40 yards/meters.- If you exit the game, you will lose all of your weapons, ammo, and other gear.- you cannot cross water that is knee deep (or deeper).Overall:In this game:  You walk thru the jungle.  When a raptor attacks you, you shoot at it with whatever weapon you have on hand (only vital shots count).  If you killed it, you scan the kill in your computer (yay points).  If you did not one-shot the raptor, you die.  If more than one raptor attacks, you die.  If you encounter a T-rex, you die.  This is a walking/hunting/dying simulator.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
Early Access Review
								Open world, no hand holding dinosaur hunting game. Even though its still being created and updated, it has a nice level of polish. Animations look great, and the enviroment looks nice. Dinosaurs are scary, due to how easy they can kill you, but also scary in a  realistic sense because they dont always find you. Join a player vs. player server and basically play "Hunger games: Dinosaurs are here too"Some of the most suspensful moments in this game are the moments when you dont even push a key or move the mouse, and  a T-Rex is walking 6 feet away from you. Do you move away, or hope it passes? You only have 6 arrows and 4 magnum rounds. Its choices like these that really are special with this game. Your not overpowered with machine guns, and you move like a human carrying gear.Throw some headphones on, and you can really sink many hours into this game looking for better gear, and hunting. However to call the game a hunter game at times can be tough, might as well call it "TheSurvivor" because you feel powerless at times. You usually start off with a bow and arrows but their is almost no way to tell were the arrow flys when you shoot it until you see the little "smoke" effect it makes hitting the ground. Making it a bit frustrating to use at times unless you like 10 feet away from a raptor. Obviously if your 10 feet from a ratpor with a bow, your a dead man if there are 2  or more raptors which is almost the case, so prepare to die a lot.Likes:-Dinosaurs! (Only 3 for now, but its the most requested 3 I would say)-Open world-Not an easy game-Multiplayer! Play with up to 16 people as teams! Or play against other players! (2 types of enemys!)-Player vs player mode really is scary with both threats everywhere, only using your ears and eyes-Your little screen device will give you subtle hints on dino locations, but not enough to feel overpoweredDislikes:-The Bow is not well designed. Aim and fire and you dont see the arrow in the air, only were it hits assuming you hit ground and can see the "smoke" effect. Makes you say "Were did the arrow go?" a lot. Especially since this is a starting weapon, it makes it frustrating when the game also spawns you near 4 raptors. Would be nice if it worked like a crossbow with some kind of indicator of distance and being able to see the arrow fly to adjust aim.-Sound design can be better. Its not sounds themselves, but were the sound is coming from. The Trex stomping is an awesome sound, but it seems like it just plays, with little sense of direction. A lot of sounds could use a better sense of direction. I can tell its coming from behind me, or in front of me but not to the left right or center. -There is too much walking with not enough reward. The best loot (Weapons) are only at specific camps marked on maps while there are random pick ups across the map but they always have decent stuff. Why cant the randoms have good pick ups? Makes me only want to check out camps.Overall if you like dinosaurs, and dont mind open world games, I would for sure reccomend this game! It will require patience as it is set as a hunting game. So dont come in expecting dino kill streaks, since every kill counts in this game.Grab your headphones and prepare for dino suspense that you cant buy anywhere else.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
Early Access Review
								OMG!!!! I hate and totally love this game. It is by far the most intense, at times, game I've played yet. It does have some drawbacks though which I will address in a minute. First, i'd like to congratulate the dev team that worked on the sound and graphics. Some of the settings are absolutely spectacular. My brother and I just bought it today and I found myself staring at a couple of sunsets and a triceratops roaming down by the ocean. They're so life-like.The utahraptors...don't get me started. They were so hard to deal with in the dense forest I finally quit trying to get my stuff back. I was almost there once. I was traveling a little gully and saw a pack of them ahead of me say 50 yards away. Too late, I've been spotted. I laid down and worked my way over against the side of a rock wall as they approached. I can hear them hissing and that weird growling. One just walked right by me.  My God, they're everywhere. I can see their tails. Okay, my screen is red and I'm am feeding them with my entrails. I love this game.The pros are the intensity is insane. There are long stretches when nothing happens, but the never knowing when something is going to happen, especially at night makes the intensity more enthralling. The sound and graphics are top-notch. The utahraptors actually herded us up a hill where we had no choice but to take a stand against them. Very real feeling of dread. Between my bow and my brother's .308 scoped hunting rifle we won. My brother ran out of bullets. I'm going to cut this short because he's back and we're going to play some more.The minuses are the stamina. It runs out wat too fast IMO. Should last a little longer, but not too much. There's not enough wildlife yet. There should be a crafting system to build a place to make a homebase. Or perhaps a structure that can be used as one. That's it for now. If you like survival games, some long stretches of just looting and exploring followed by stomach twisting moments of chaotic mayhem where hours of hard work can be extinguished by one bite...this game should not be missed. Twenty bucks and my brother and I are hooked. In the immortal words of Axl Rose, welcome to the jungle baby...you're gonna die!

												There's many things in this game that I don't like... the only thing is good is you hunt a Dinosaurs  (or rather the Dinosaurs hunt you).- the fact is u need to die first before u can customizing your Inventory is ridiculous.- Anything you bought like weapons, ammo etc will drop with your dead body when you die, so once you respawn you'll need walk long distance to the place you died to retreive your gear that is if you didn't die along the way or someone else didn't took your gear before you. Oh did I mention u can't shoot without aiming with right mouse button toggle?- U walk long distance to get a supply drop and what did you get? A bunch of ammo with no gun to use with, so guess what? U just have to kill the T-rex by throwing your ammo to the t-rex mouth with your hand, hopping one of those ammo will choke the Rex to death.- Huge map to explore but only 5 Species to hunt? ohh... my bad, is actually 6 species (that is if killing other player also count)I played the original "The Hunter" once which u hunt Deer, bear etc... is a good hunting game, I stop playing it bcoz is too expensive to stay subcribe. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												The devs for this game know how to make an addicting game, yet managed to give you the subtle middle finger in almost everything. For example, have a valuable pack with lots of gear? One of a couple things WILL happen. A: A pack of 3-5 Utahraptors will swarm you, and given the odd control scheme and feel of shooting in this game, you will have zero chance. B: You will be a couple (10-15) meters from a ledge and the game will suck you over the side to kill you. C: Some other form of the middle finger will kill you. Then once you respawn, you better have a lot of buddies by your side because you can bet you bottom dollar there will be 8-10 utahraptors between you and your pack. Refer to A above. Weapons have an amazing drop in power after only a few feet. Yet sometimes they seem to have loads of power to spare across the map. More than once I have one shot a triceratops from several hundred meters with a .44 and not hit any vitals, yet it dropped like a sack of rocks.The game often has issues on a lan. Sometimes everyone can join wihtout issue, some times no one can join. Two machines with the same config and the the following will happen. Some users can join one but not the other. All of this is without any real information other than generic cannot join errors so troubleshooting is a crapshoot. Despite having way over the top specs on both my and several of my friends machines, this game often has unexplained slow downs where the dinosaurs all seem to move in slo-mo. Then there is of course the all too common 3 people see a dinosaur thats standing 50 meters away, the other 10 people dont have it on their screen.Bottom line, for full price pass it up, if its on sale for 5-10 bucks and your looking for a buggy often incredibly frustrating yet somehow still often fun game, snag it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												I don't understand all the negativity surrounding this game.  If you are tired of playing games where you go from being a noob to very shortly dominating the planet or area you are playing in, then this is NOT the game for you.  It gives you very basic supplies to get started and you must actually work to level up and get access to the better things in life...like bigger guns.  These you will need.  Trying to take down a T-Rex alone and armed with only a blade...is suicide.  However, if you work with others and are not afraid of dying (once, twice, often) you can accomplish the impossible.  We (us four) took down a T-Rex armed only with machetes.  Although the big beasty did not die right away, we tracked her blood trail till we found her dead body.  The beasties will run when hurt and even die at a later time...lose the trail, and you lose the reward for killing this beast.  You will get some compensation if someone else finds the body and claims it.  Best part, you don't lose your level or money no matter how often you die (though the devs may change this at a later time...would be BRUTAL then).  This game has a tension that few can bring.  In this game your are not....I repeat, you are NOT the dominant species on this planet...and I for one ENJOY the hell out of that.
