content:
Posted: January 13, 2015
Early Access Review
								My first impression of the game was how amazing it looks, and the sounds get you really into it. Finding my first crate wasn't hard thanks to the map piece you spawn with, and soon enough i killed a couple utharaptors. The constant struggle to track animals and don't get killed make it both a hunting game and a survival game, but i think that's cool. The dinosaurs look really good, and if you've been lying in a bush and looking at a T-rex close up as many times as i, you know how terrifying they are. Just hearing the footsteps of the t-rex is enough to awaken all senses and make you hide in a bush to localize it. The way the T-rex and Utharaptors act is awesome, they track you if you run, or if they hear you walk normally, and follow your smell if you're not careful. However the Triceratops act a bit strange in my opinion. The guide said they might be agressive, but after MANY encounters both from far away and the point when they step on you, they all just run away, and then they run. Far. Really far. other than that the world is pretty cool, awesome with the volcano in the middle and bases that's been destroyed. Been playing the game with a friend for a whole weekend + 1 day after school (maybe 20 hours) and even though i get the best guns and gear, i have to be careful not to get overrun by a pack of raptors, which has happened a few times when i get cocky. Luckily i just have to go back where i died and pick up my stuff again (if nobody's stolen it, i played on a server with just my friend). Now we've done most of the things although we haven't cared to run across the map after a triceratops that's been hit, and only managed to kill 1 T-rex, but 20 hours of gameplay and more to come is more than you get from many other games that costs more. Now we're just waiting for the next patch with new dinosaurs. I recommend this game for anyone who likes survival games and wants a game for the weekend packed with scary moments, traces of adrenaline at times and beautiful graphics sprinkled on top.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								As you can probably see from my account. I don't review games often. and when i do. It's probably just cause i enjoyed it and felt it was a good buy.However.This game...This game is fantastic. Even in it's current state. It's intese, It's immersive and quite frankly sometimes. it's terrifying. The stealth is a fantastic factor, the loot spawns, the PvE and the PvP are fun. and if your a hunter fan, or a dinosaur fan and would like a "as close to realistic" game, this is for you. Be prepared to die. ALOT. Raptors are relentless. Even if you encouter one on it's own. You better be a damn good shot and take it out or you're going to have 4 maybe even 5 surrounding you while you're on the move. T-Rex's are ruthless, Your only chance of survival is to stop drop and DO NOTHING. even then. Sometimes. It runs into you. and well. Squish.Pros : ImmersiveIn-depthUnforgiving environment/dinosaursgraphics are real prettyruns very stable (occasional FPS drop but nothing game breaking)No amount of gear makes this game "easy mode" Rifles? Arrows? .44 magnum? You still have to be careful where and what you shoot at.Good co-op experience + good solo experience i enjoyed playing alone or with others.Cons (subject to change)Combat (I dislike the requirement to ADS to even load an arrow/how slow ADS is)No possibility of hiding yourself from dino's (smothering your self in Dino poo, for instance)Once you have a raptors attention, they NEVER back down, I'm aware this is how they hunted in real life but it's practically impossible once they have an idea that your there because they convienently stop within hearing distance of you (unless this is just my unlucky experience)T-Rex doesn't seem to attack other dinosaurs, Or any dinosaurs don't attack other dinosaurs. Something i found quite frustrating.

Early Access Review
								I purchased The Hunter: Primal about a month ago and so far I have loved the gameplay. I have had very little problems and the AI on the dinosaurs is great. However there are a few problems that I would like to address about  Utahraptor attack behavour and Triceritops movement glitches. The raptors seem to attack plays by sprinting at them from cover and killing them by biting them to death. Recent studies on Dromeosaurid (raptor) anatomy has shown that the most likely ambushed their prey from cover and then pinned it to the ground sinking their large sickle claws into the victim`s  back then started to eat the struggling prey alive. If this was implemented in the Utharaptors it would make fighting them harder and hunting with a buddy more important.

												I would recommend this game, although to start, it's overpriced for its current lack of content and it has a few flaws. However, other reviews go over most of these.The main problem is like I mentioned, the lack of content. The game could use a couple more guns, but mainly it needs more *dinosaurs*. After all, they're the focus of the entire game.I'd suggest adding a few more well-known but interesting ones. For example, deinosuchuses could live along the coastline and attack you if you got too close. Stegosauruses, Allosauruses, Coelophyses, and Gallimimuses for a start. I understand, of course, that it takes time to create and add something so complex, but the game could certainly use it.The current dinosaurs are modeled very nicely and their behaviour is pretty well-done, but it has some bugs.In any case, I'd recommend this game.TL;DR- more dinos pls

This game is the best Dinosaur themed game currently on Steam.Pros:*Huge island to explore with lots of places to go and plenty of things to see and do*Realistic weapon physics with bullet drop*Very fun co-op with other people*There are no trolls, hackers or spammers online*No real money micro-transactions. 								What a fantastic game! One of the main reasons I love this game so much is because of the way creators have depicted the way these dinosaurs look. Giganotosaurus, Carcaradontosaurus and Spinosaurus all bigger would be a great accusation.Something in the sky and something in the water would be quite exiting.More weapons, clothing and other objects of appeal.A larger scale map.And finally as im sure everyone would love to see dinosaurs hunting something other than you!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 5, 2015
												As a gamer and as a game developer, I can say that this 'game' has potential. I purchased the game without looking at reviews and assumed that it was a nearly finished product or at least a product with finesse and spunk.Instead, I received a game that was under developed and felt more like a wimpy simulation, rather than a full-blown game with music, story, AI, a finished battle system and enjoyable play. I do not say this without taking into careful consideration that this 'company' is an independent studio run by what I would assume are University Students looking to expand their knowledge and ability to produce a finished project for their class - thus releasing it under the impression that it's a final product in the real world.Their companys name is "Avalanche", which serves as a dual purpose. A warning sign that their product is literally rolling down the hill to kill you and a studio who produces something with large intentions and ruining the experience a mountain climber might have whilst scaling a range and a large pile of snow falls to bury and disappoint the said hiker.THP is essentially a game with strong design aesthics, intelligent research on dinosaurs, very unique and nicely created dinosaur sounds (with glitches here and there), and a non-crashing base-program that allows a player to simulate hiking along a tropical island. The island is filled with wonderful and unique landscape design - that is to say, you can get lost but not in the sense that everything looks the same, everywhere.What they don't tell you is that the AI is very dumb. They target you with high intelligence and attack with insta-gib slices and force you to respawn. The trailers are beautiful, the cinematic-trailer is old-Blizzard quality, they have so much potential, but it's wasted on poor game development. There is no music, no lead up to fear. You simply hear dinosaur sounds, wield a crappy machette and hope your stamina bar fills up in time for you to attack any dinosaur. The servers are empty, you cannot find anyone to play with and get ganged up on by Utahraptors, which, mind you, all rend you or chomp at you and kill you in three or less hits.The game has items scattered among the world, the island is massive, the creatures are everywhere, but nothing feels enjoyable about the game. It's missing heart. It's missing story, the story you get a glimpse of through a trailer you might not even see. It's missing the feel of a what a game is. Instead, you're given a game that is underdeveloped and lacking in all fields. You waste your $20-30 on a piece of software that lets you run for 10 seconds and takes 3 minutes to let you run again, whilst not allowing you to jump when creatures attack you from the forest depths. Take your money, spend it on a dating sim, you'll get more out of it. Believe me.

												At first I didn't like this game. Its pretty challenging and can be a real♥♥♥♥♥♥off especially losing all your gear on a cliff... But that being said this game is absolutley amazing in sound (best played with headphones), teamwork (great community so far), graphics are astounding for the requirements (not the best out there but expected way less), when you make a kill it is way more satisfing than any game i played before because it so hard and shot accuracy matters big time. The size of this online multiplayer map is very impressive too. This game is a fav of mine****UPDATE*****Sick of seeing these reveiws that are so negative after the reveiwer has only an hour or two or 4 in.... They cant hunt and are more mad about their own lack of skills i'd say just need to vent. As of now I have 242.5 hrs into this game, It has problems yes... I paid 20 bucks for this game, thats 20 bucks ppl!!!!! people expect to get a game at the standards of others in the range of $70+ and yes there are better $70 games out there but not one about hunting dinos multiplayer online, and those $70 games get pushed back and back and then when you think it will be released push it back again (Rockstar). At least its playable while dev is ongoing! some ppl say it runs like crap on their comp, well my 2nd computer is dualcore amd mini itx @ 2.7ghz with a 1g radeon hd7750 runs native settings and runs this game at full graphics 60fps with minimal drops in frame rate and my card does not heat up so i'd say ppl have hardware issues other than this game seeing that card is known for running hot, and it doesnt in this game! You will not find a better looking and running game anywhere on any system for $20

Early Access Review
								This Game is Listed a Survival Game. As it Trends toward role the one thing that bothers me is...Well the lack of current Survival features. This Game is incomplete Survival Game with some hunting aspects. Currently Death has little punishment. Dino A.I. Is shaky at times ,but most of the time it fares decently. The Game is in Early Access so many of the features aren't here yet. But this game has tons of potenial as a Survival game. Unlike many other Survival Games the PvE can be heart pounding. However in its current state the game esclates to easy very quickly Dinosaurs need to be feared not target practice. Overall i like its potential and it is fun to play ,but lacks many features before it can be a Full release game. Requires more Dinos.More Survival Aspects.Better Dino A.I.Party system.For starters.Would only recommend to those who desire a Survival Game with fun unique elements.

Early Access Review
								this game is much alike carnivores but with a survival aspect to it, probably more like dayz mixed with carnivores with thehunter gameplay style but let me get to the aspects of this game.pros1. pay once play forever unlike the original thehunter... i still like that one2. gigantic open world.3. different terratory for each dino but dont expect every area to be clear of certain dinosours (i was exploring the lower terratory, which is raptor terratory, and found a trex that i ran into)4. realistic versions of dinosours ( such as feathers or spines which is a good turn around to realism... also dont expect the volociraptor to be 6 feet tall in reality they are about 2 feet tall)5. better graphics then carnivores... at least the old ones.6. you can die... which you can do in the original thehunter but is rare.now for the cons.1. dino's are stupid they will run right past you and give you a chance to kill them.2. tricy's run away and wont charge... maybe run you over but that hasnt happend to me yet.3. only four dino's the volociraptor, utahraptor, triceratops, and the trex. isnt that bad though remember its still early access.and thats about all i can think of the cons. Now there is a currency in this game but isnt like the original thehunter where you have to buy currency to get all the kickass stuff, you have to level up and inorder to get money and exp you have to hunt.

								I have to say, I absolutely love the feel of the game so far. Dropped in with nothing but a bow and no choice but to survive. You never know what is waiting around the next bend, what loot you might find, if any, and whether or not you can trust others. Nerve wracking in a good way. That being said the game isn't perfect, AI could improve as im sure it will, melee and jumping could also be an option. Swimming is going to be a must, and im sure equipment durability would add another layer to the game. Overall i'm impressed for twenty dollars!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
Early Access Review
								Not the most full time action packed game ever.... but it do have it's moments.You start with basic cloths and nothing else... but hey right in front of you is your drop pod! Lucky you.Inside is a GPS type hunter's helper that gives you the lay of the land, helps guide you to loot crates and locations, gives you information on tracks you may find and takes pics of your kills.Also a simple bow and arrows now you are ready to take down a T-rex. NOT!!!You then trek around a good sized island- not huge- but big enough to get lost. Use the GPS and map alot. :)You must watch out for one species of posion plant, dinos, rocks to throw and distract said dinos, mushrooms to heal and good places to hide.The idea is to survive long enough to find some camo gear and big guns. It takes around 3 arrows to drop a raptor but these bad girls travel in packs (I had six on me once.)You have a health and stamina bar but do not have to eat or drink, but you do need to find health spray that restores lost hit points.I died alot but each respawn was fun and the atmosphere felt real. Lots of ambiant sounds, and visually stunning.I have to say it is the best looking fauna in a game I have ever seen- It looks good enough you can almost smell the pine trees. Now, the sound is also well done. I found myself stopping because I heard a twig snap behind me and began stressing that a raptor had me. I cannot explain how good the sound fx for the dinos are- I had thought I lost a T-rex that was tracking me so I started moving out of the area when It roared and began to charge my way!!  The screen shook and the, "THUD, THUD, THUD!!!" of its foot falls made me beleive I had a several thousand kilo♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off Rex running up behind me. It was awSOME!!!And the models are too cool: They look every bit as good as that first time you saw Jurassic Park.The map is covered in a "fog of war" and I havent come close to reveiling the whole thing before I am eaten. They do eat you too... When you die you get the pleasure of listening to then chow down on you.Now the cons:They only have three species of dinos: T-Rex, Triceritops and Raptor.It is a bit boreing hideing and slinking around a forrest 90% of the time and running for your life 9% with only scoreing good loot -so far- a tiny 1% of the time.They need more sights to see and places to go and possibly holdout at.It is more sim than adventure but if the devs add some more dinos and give the players lots of equipment to survive- maybe some crafting and building... this will be on fun♥♥♥♥♥co-op game that will be around a long time!!!

Early Access Review
								Here is my experience with the game so far:---------------------------------------------------------"Oh, forest. Where is everyone? I am unarmed"*noise*"What the hell was that? "-sees raptor, hides like a little girl, raptor walks past-"SWEET JESUS THAT THING, ALMOST ATE ME.. back to the -mauled by raptor-"Oh, you could get a bow in the spawn point? Why didn't you say so?" -MAULED BY RAPTOR AGAIN.-" Oh, look! A t REx. And I conveniently found a rifle nearby! Time to bag me a Tyranosaur. "-fills t rex with bullets-" And there you go, now, lets go get some -EATEN BY ANOTHER T REX--kills a raptor- There you go! Finally killed something. Lets take a selfie. -Succesfully takes a selfie, mauled by raptor immediately afterwards.----------------------------------------So yeah, this game is a lot of fun. You are gonna die often. Like, all the time. And most dinosaurs wont even give you the courtesy of a warning growl until its too late. It still needs a lot of work though, and a lot of love. And more dinosaurs, most definitely needs more dinosaurs.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
Early Access Review
								If you've grown to love this games sister game theHunter as i have for the past 10yrs i think or since season 7 according to my hunter profile u'll love this game. One can't really begin to love this game as i said b4 unless u love it's sister game as this games a COMPLETE role reversal. In TheHunter it's u the hunter who is hunting deer, bear, rabbits, moose, elk, coyote, hogs to name a few of the species but in this game ya u might be there to hunt the dinosaurs that they have now but these dinosaurs are out to hunt u the hunter. This game u can either be the hunter or the hunted it just depends on what u see beyond the next bush or what u hear beyond the next bush. It could be a cocky velociraptor, a gentle triceratops or a down right nasty azz T-Rex ready to throw u around like a chew toy. I highly recommend this game if u've grown to love the sister game theHunter.

content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
Early Access Review
								Like Dinosaurs. Like hunting games. Like the fact there aren't zombies. This game rules.Played for like an hour and a half. First ten minutes of the game, rushing through the brush to a box, boom. Shh shh shh! What was that?! BOOM! Uh oh. Nope this train, run away behind a tree to see a t-rex come to a halt right where i was. SHH SHH SHH! Maybe he doesn't see.... "You are dead". He definatly saw me. And ate me from behind a tree. Second playthrough: Running down the coast, decide enough is enough and run through the forest. Triceratops. So neat! Keep going, find an outpost on the far side of a lake. Hear a noise, see a pack of raptors coming up on me, following my scent. Run out of stamina like a billion times trying to run away. Get to the outpost, raptor right on my♥♥♥♥♥ Loot a shotgun, bullets. Lay that ♥♥♥♥er out and take a selfie with it.Would highly recommend this game. It's not the most fast paced of games which is a nice thing. Until it becomes fast paced. Then run. You hear a strange noise? Run. You hear stomping? Run. You die? Don't go back to the body, the dinosaurs sort of just stick around the bodies. 10/10. Would recommend to everyone.

								Honestly just wish there were more dinosDay 1: spawn next to that pod and get a bow and arrow. Then i travel few miles. I come acros footprints. They were to dino that was easy picking. So i followed them and followed them and followed them so more and then came across its well fisces. I looked up and found the dino. I was nervous but i didnt attack cuz i didnt have the best equipment. So i looked for items and came across 3 boxes in one area. Then i turned around and there was a t rex right there. He didnt see me so i layed down. He than walked away. I thought to myself im not attacking it. But courosity broke loose. So i followed it. I lost track of it. I was scanning footprints and crap for about a min. Then out of no where it lookes at me dead in the eye. I thought maybe it didnt see me again but it did. It roared and was running at me. I was panicking and did not no what to do. I froze in place. Then it ate me. Spawn agian and get my bow and arrow. traveld to my die spot and saw him. I shot my arrow at it and it ran at me agian. I shot another 2 more arrows. Well enough it killed me. Spawned agian and go my stuff and treked to my body agian. it was there agian and i shot another arrow at it and of course it killed me agian. Rage quit and wrote the this review. I just wanted to kill a t rex.

Early Access Review
								Somewhat con(s) I really hope the devs will include some kind of crafting/maybe even rudeimentary base or structure building system.  It would make teaming up much more fun, and give you more incentive to group up.  So far, I don't see anything of the sort listed in the "what to expect".  This does have great promise, and is fun as is, however I really think some more features should be in the "upcomings" to justify the pricing... Pros.  Being hunted by dinos and subsequently hunting them back, awesome :)  Yes, some other games have done this, but this one has a very immesive and more realistic feel to the approach.  I like :) But I'd really like to see some more complimentary features listed in what to expect :-/ Mayhaps I missed something.

												Was walking along when I first started the game. Got told to go to the Volcano. Ran into a Utahraptor, killed it with two arrows. Felt like a beast, then continued north to find a T-Rex. It didn't go as nicely.11/10 Will continue to get turned into neat poop piles.EDITED:I havent touched touched it since the "Full Release" update. Nearly nintey hours of gameplay, learning to differentiate the sounds enough that I could avoid dying too much, figuring that you kind of need to be effective with every weapon in case you get ammo boned, even one instance where a friend popped up Cheat Engine and changed the Utahraptor spawn to near triple. Fortunately we had a log and ammo. Unfortunately, forty utahs later we were almost out of ammo and there were still more raptors. But that was beside the point. The point is of those near nintey hours I put in, a third was walking, some was being dead and♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥cause my stuff was essentially gone (usually it was a rex or a pack of raptors), and the rest, close to half of it, was legitimately fun gameplay.Then Avalanche took off and left us all with our asses in the wind.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												12/17/2014: So far I'm loving this game. I've played about 6 hours as of writing this and I've played solo as well as with friends. I will say, if you're looking for a terrifying experience, play solo. With the lights off. With the bass on the speakers way up. And put a glass of water next to you.The gameplay feels little clunky and rigid, but it's an early alpha stage of the game and there's only 3 types of dinosaurs at the moment, but for what stage this game is in it looks beautiful, the sound effects are terrifying, and it's not a run and gun once you get gear, but you MUST evade dinosaurs at all times or you're probably going to die. They're clever and violent.Aside from the expected buggy nature of an early alpha game, I would highly recommend this game. 9/10UPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATE!UPDATE 3/3/2015: As a full release game, there isn't much that has been added to the game and there's a serious lack of variety in dinosaurs and vegetation. There's a barely existent backstory, no driven purpose, and it feels like it was rushed to release with a promise of more material based on how well the game does AFTER "Full" release. That's a very poor marketing choice and practically screams "Bored, now! Here's this thing we made. Now get bent."The game can't do well if it's left unfinished by community standards, but promising to finis- errr, "add more" to the game if it does well despite that fact is foolish and near-sighted. It cannot do well in its current state and I am thoroughly disappointed in the devs for rushing it to release with so little content.

								This is easily one of the best dinosaur survival games I've ever played!Great graphics!beautiful atmosphere and terrain the sounds are absolutely incredibleand of course there's DINOSAURS!!but with that being said I feel like this game still lacks quite a bit (I know this is still early access and I'm not complaining I'm just wanting to state what I feel should be improved on and added) :)you can't swim in waterit's easy to get hunted down and die by yourselfthere's really no plot to the game (except shoot dinosaurs)you can't build anything to protect yourselfand it lacks even more Dinosaurs!What I would like to see is the ability to swim, build houses/huts/forts or bases some kind of plot or end to the game, maybe some kind of special camo suit to wear to protect you from being seen, or something to keep the scent  off you and more weapons and dinosaurs.As I said earlier it is still early access so a lot of things could be added and changed but as for now I'm just stating what I think should be added or improved upon but I give it a 7.5 out of 10 it's still very, very fun! and I enjoy playing it! I would highly recommend this to someone who likes the suspense of getting hunted by our favorite prehistoric animals

Early Access Review
								This isnt the game to survive alone. AI is very unforgiving and will hunt you down. 2-4 man is needed. from dodging 2 t-rex's to 8 pack of rapters this game is hunting you! Only hope of survival is to find your friend quickly and start hunting care packages. Learn shot placement as normal shots are not going to kill them. Only vital heart or double lung shots will kill immediately. kidney, single lung and stomach shots are semi-fatal but will not kill immediately. Leg and head shots are even more useless. To survive is to learn how to fight and pick your fights. This review is for PvE only. I dont dare imagine what PvP is like. God be with you...

								If you've grown to love this games sister game theHunter as i have for the past 10yrs i think or since season 7 according to my hunter profile u'll love this game. One can't really begin to love this game as i said b4 unless u love it's sister game as this games a COMPLETE role reversal. In TheHunter it's u the hunter who is hunting deer, bear, rabbits, moose, elk, coyote, hogs to name a few of the species but in this game ya u might be there to hunt the dinosaurs that they have now but these dinosaurs are out to hunt u the hunter. This game u can either be the hunter or the hunted it just depends on what u see beyond the next bush or what u hear beyond the next bush. It could be a cocky velociraptor, a gentle triceratops or a down right nasty azz T-Rex ready to throw u around like a chew toy. I highly recommend this game if u've grown to love the sister game theHunter.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
Early Access Review
								This is a quick initial review after spending my first 1.6hrs in game, all opinions are subjective to change as the game updates as it is in Early Acess State.I had initially heard of this game from a youtuber by the name of DevilDogGamer, listening to him talk about it immediately peaked my interest. The thought of being dropped in a distant land full of dangerous prehistoric predators with the sole intention to turn the hunters into the hunted.  Dinosaurs have always been of interest, an while currently limited in the species type this game did not fall short of delivering an immersive experience.PC Specs - MSI 890FXA-GD70 mobo, AMD Phenom 2x6 1075T cpu, XFX 6870HD gpu, Gskill Ripjawz 8gb ram, WD caviar black 2TB HDD, Onboard Realtech HD audioRating - 8/10Pros:1) The game is beautiful minus a few graphical glitches I noticed here an there, nothing major however. Sometimes I would notice a few white slivers here an there as well from textures that haven't loaded. However with that said my GPU is dated an it still looked gourgous for the better part.2) Sounds/ambience - The audio for this game has so far been done in extremely good taste. The nature of this game forces you to constantly be vigilant and paying attention. You are being hunted after all, An with time the 3 different dinos become easily distinguishable between them. There is also the atmospheric background noise, as well as the terrain/movement sounds.  There was one sound I feel could use some improvement, which would be when the raptors are coming up on you. To me it sounds like a record player playing static and it keeps skipping, It's by no means a game killer but it does get kind of annoying after a bit.3) Each individual dino looks amazing and unique, I love that the devs took into account that many believe modern day birds evolved from dinos ( I agree with this but if you don't to each their own ). It's evident in the designs as portrayed by the feathers particularily on the raptor which raptor in itself means bird of prey.4) Tracking is easy for anyone, Your not going to walk up to a dino sign an sit an wonder for 10 min what it was. Each animal has its own individual sounds and tracks, it's very important to be able to decifer what exactly your chasing... or whats chasing you for that matter.5) Loot crates stand out, they show up nicely on the pda as well. With a bright orange color, an audio que and the pda dropping you rite on top of it they're hard to miss. I also found plenty of them, an while most had decent drops in it I'll get into my thoughts for improvements on them later.Areas of Improvement 1) First an foremost to few weapons, I haven't found a single firearm as of this post within the amount of time I have played. I get the survival with limited resources aspect an that this game isn't supposed to be easy, But with the number of crates I opened something other then another bow would have been nice. I did however find enough arrows the T-rex probably would have chocked on them if it wasn't ultimately a pack of raptors that did me in.2) Non-stackable items - I ultimately died from running out of arrows with my bow, not because I didn't have any but because my stack of 8 had run out and in haste switched to my stack of 3 which is no bueno with 3 raptors chasin ya down.  Pick a number and allow us to stack it up to that, doesn't have to be big i'ld say 8-10 if you'ld like to keep it limited.  3) some dino suggestions for the future - Stegosaurus, Ankylosaurus, Allosaurus, Pteranodon ( more so for ambience then to hunt ), Archeopteryx ( again for ambience ), Baryonyx.All in all it was an enjoyable experience and I look forward to playing it and progressing with it as it updates. This is the game many of us have been waiting for, and tho this is just the first lick of the spoon it's already hit my sweet tooth.  I would recommend playing with a friend, tho it could work against you as well depending on the type of experience your seeking. I will continue to update this as improvements and changes are made, this is just an initial review an thoughts of the game in its current state.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 26, 2015
Early Access Review
								As you can probably see from my account. I don't review games often. and when i do. It's probably just cause i enjoyed it and felt it was a good buy.However.This game...This game is fantastic. Even in it's current state. It's intese, It's immersive and quite frankly sometimes. it's terrifying. The stealth is a fantastic factor, the loot spawns, the PvE and the PvP are fun. and if your a hunter fan, or a dinosaur fan and would like a "as close to realistic" game, this is for you. Be prepared to die. ALOT. Raptors are relentless. Even if you encouter one on it's own. You better be a damn good shot and take it out or you're going to have 4 maybe even 5 surrounding you while you're on the move. T-Rex's are ruthless, Your only chance of survival is to stop drop and DO NOTHING. even then. Sometimes. It runs into you. and well. Squish.Pros : ImmersiveIn-depthUnforgiving environment/dinosaursgraphics are real prettyruns very stable (occasional FPS drop but nothing game breaking)No amount of gear makes this game "easy mode" Rifles? Arrows? .44 magnum? You still have to be careful where and what you shoot at.Good co-op experience + good solo experience i enjoyed playing alone or with others.Cons (subject to change)Combat (I dislike the requirement to ADS to even load an arrow/how slow ADS is)No possibility of hiding yourself from dino's (smothering your self in Dino poo, for instance)Once you have a raptors attention, they NEVER back down, I'm aware this is how they hunted in real life but it's practically impossible once they have an idea that your there because they convienently stop within hearing distance of you (unless this is just my unlucky experience)T-Rex doesn't seem to attack other dinosaurs, Or any dinosaurs don't attack other dinosaurs. Something i found quite frustrating.

Product received for free
												theHunter: Primal is a very fun addicting dinosaur hunting game. Playing with solo is a challenge and is scary but more fun with friends. So starting out without a intro but just a note on why you are there was okay but players will mainly skip the reading and get to the game. You are given a machete and a GPS chip to a location with no game-play teaching. Just go play and pray, The weapons are amazing however the damage doesn't seem to be accurate for the guns. Also having to aim to shoot is a pain a since the zoom zooms to far. The weapons should also accept the weapon class if from as well like compressed arros should work for a wood bow The random crates are nice and rewarding to find but find that the things you want appaer after you die 50x. Also storage crates would have been nice for ammo or things players don't need or store for later.The dinosuars look & act somewhat like they should. The small raptors are fast and attack quick. The big raptors will stalk before they attack. Triceratops are peacful but don't get close. The Quetzalcoatlus isn't much of a bother since its mainly in the sky but the T-Rex is the most feared in the game. The t-rex is the boss of the game. Killing it is near impossible and can kill with sneak. Avoid at all cost.There is no swiming machanic in the game so its all walking. TheHunter: Primal is a good game but does need a few more updates but its still fun to play. I can easily give this game a 6/10 score. With updates and new machinic this game can get a higher score but I can recommend this game.

content:

Early Access Review
								This is by far the best Dino survival game out there ..... ok I know its not really survival as such but when I play this game and get into the world (which look amazing!) you cant help but really feel like you have just landed on a hostile planet where everything is out to get you. So in that way for me its about survival but with that bit done this game is awesome! its what I was expecting from other games of titles I will not say, the AI is great the dinos look amazing even the sounds of everything going on around you at night sometimes you cant help but stand there and just listen to this world thats come to life. You also have a PDA that gives you a location to get to and along the way you come across drop pods for a chance to gain new weapons and ammo and also with the PDA you can also scan dino crap and footprints which will tell you how old it is and how far away it could be from you. This game manages to do things, make me feel things that so many other dino games have fallen short on and its only getting better with plenty of updates so on that note buy this game its a worthy investment of you cash and time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								Now I can't give a full review as I've only had about 7 hours into this game and my time with the game has been off and on for short periods of time. What I can tell you is that from the beginning, this isn't your average hunting game, but you know that right? You've already seen the clips from YouTubers and watched the videos here on Steam. So you know its a dinosaur hunting game, its in early alpha so theres bugs, and its a bare bones game. You got dinosaurs who act weird sometimes, although everyone is raving about how they look like what dinosaurs are supposed to look like (they've got feathers hurr durr). What I can tell you is that I've seen all of them, hunted them all (and been hunted by them, mostly this part) and its always an intense situation especially when you are alone. I'm a lone wolf so thats kind of what I do, but the game is about taking down the big buck of the land, the T-Rex. This is something I can only assume you'd need friends, lots of friends, and a lot of firepower to accomplish because T-Rex lives up to his reputation in this game. He can take a beating and still keep coming at you and only your buddies and your trusty .308 will help bring him/her down. As a loner though you don't have those luxuries, well you might have been lucky to stumble across a .308 and some ammo,  but I wouldn't suggest trying it alone unless you are certain you are a great shot. Also, like a proper hunting game, this game relies on target boxes that you must hit in order to maximize damage and bring down the beasts. And, much as you may have heard in science class all those years ago (or yesterday, whatever age you are), most of these creatures have a brain the size of a walnut, so your Call of Duty, 360, No scoping sniper skills won't get you anywhere in this game except in the digestive tract of a very appreciative carnivore. Instead you must rely on lung and heart shots, not saying a brain shot isn't possible (I've seen the videos of a guy take down a pack of raptors with only a bow and head shots, this guy was a pro... you probably aren't) so keep it safe, conserve your arrows/rounds and breathe and train your sights on the heart. Ok I got off track there, moving along. The dinosaur AI isn't the greatest here, before a recent patch (and I haven't confirmed its fix) but you would have moments where you were hauling♥♥♥♥♥across a field from a pack of raptors cause you didn't take your time with your shots and now you're out and along comes a might T-Rex to swoop in and save you like he did in Jurassic Park, right? Nope... they'd team up and chase you down together, probably resulting in a nice picnic between the two species as they discuss why your taste didn't live up to their expectations. Or, as I've observed, you can watch as a triceratops grazes on the grass when suddenly a T-Rex emerges and you finally get to see the epic battle you played out as a child with your toys, two titans clashing, who will win? Definitely not you, because the Rex would rather eat you in your 170lb boney frame than deal with the triceratops as it continues to eat in peace. Now, again, its alpha, there are bugs and they'll be fixed. But sometimes the AI gets it right and when it does, it adds soo much to the experience. For example, you can be travelling along, and you hear the roll of distant thunder, and you look out and see the clouds rolling in. It starts raining, gently at first then it picks up and the sounds of nature slightly wash out over the sounds of the pats of thousands of dropplets hitting the ground and lightening starts its dance across the sky (I don't mean to paint such a picture, but the atmosphere alone is worth the price. Watching a storm roll in while I was on the side of a volcanoe literally brought me to tears with its beauty, not ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ you) and all of a sudden you hear what sounds like monkeys chattering, only you know well that those aren't monkeys and its not background noise as they always, always make different sounds instead of repeating in a loop. Then you slowly crouch/walk your way up to high ground and you peer out into the forest and its hard to see because of the mixture of rain and darkness from the clouds and thats when you spot the first utahraptor. Then another and they slowly begin making their way up the hill in your direction. So panic quickly sets in as you only have a bow with a few arrows, so you ease back off the rock and keep your eyes in the direction you last saw them and thats when it happens... while the two were heading towards you while you were focusing on them, another two were coming up from the other side and started closing in a little faster. They screech and every single one of them zeros in for the kill and you never stood a chance. It could have just been my experience, it could be the way the game does it for everyone, but these moments get seared into your memory and give you a healthy appreciation that these things no longer exist. As for the big guys, triceratops is a bit of a wimp unless you corner him, then he will instantly kill you by trampling you. T-Rex, why not save the best for last? I've been killed a few times by them and its always a moment filled with heavy, heart pounding excitement. You absolutely can't win on your own (at least I never have), so when you see one, you immediately go prone and hope to god Dr. Alan Grant was right about his vision being based on movement. And as it turns out, while you back pedal slowly across the ground with the big creature closing in, you may just stand a chance as he isn't immediately attacking you but just smelling the area you were in. So you hold still for a few minutes, hoping he looses interest and that is when it happens. T-Rex adorns his troll face mask and immediately bites you in half, because he knew you were there the whole time. It may sound like I'm mocking this game, but I swear the bugs only get to you if you focus on them and let the deaths get you down. But if you take a moment to take in the atmosphere and the beautiful creatures that inhabit the island, you will realize that by the time the game gets flushed out (and they add the rest of the dinosaurs and weapons) that it was worth the price all along.

content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								What a fantastic game! One of the main reasons I love this game so much is because of the way creators have depicted the way these dinosaurs look. Velociraptors in particular are fantastic, small, feathery and incredibly intelligent. Just the way Palaeontologist would picture them. However, that being said the game does have a lot of issues such as constant server disconnections, slow aiming reaction time and a some what annoying scenario where a player buys items e.g. ammo and then losing it all upon reconnecting from a disconnection without even using them. In saying that the game is again in early access and will undoubtedly fix the madurity of these issues and I for one cannot wait!A few things that I would love to see:More dino's obviously,Stegosaurus, Iguanodon, Parasaurolophus, Pachycephalosaurus  just to name a few herbivores.Something to compete with the might of the Tyrannosaurus. Giganotosaurus, Carcaradontosaurus and Spinosaurus all bigger would be a great accusation.Something in the sky and something in the water would be quite exiting.More weapons, clothing and other objects of appeal.A larger scale map.And finally as im sure everyone would love to see dinosaurs hunting something other than you!

												I want to say a few things... a) this game, although lacking in content, is extremely fun to play on your own and even better if played along with a cpl friends!  b) do not believe any of the negative comments about this game regarding it being a copy and paste and the gameplay... it has the similarities of some games, but everything in this game so far has made all of those similarities much better than anything close to it... c) the negative comments you read about the lack of content are all 100% accurate!  There is an O.K variety of weapons, equipment and clothing, but when it comes to the dinosaurs, they need more types!  The map is big enough to handle more dinos and i really dont underatand why the devs are holding back on that!  d) for a game that doesnt have the visuals of most of todays games, IT STILL IS MUCH MORE FUN TO PLAY THAN THE OTHERS THAT DO!  I hope the devs wake up and see that they have something bigger and better than most of the games in this genre... WAKE UP GUYS!  Me and my friends recently purchased a 4 pack and had others also buy in to it and we've had so much fun playing... if you look at my collection of games as well as the collections of all the people i play with you will see that we have been looking for something like this to pop up in steam for a while now... 11 hours of gameplay in only a few days with my buddies killing raptops, trikes, taradactles and a few uncommon t-rex's and all we have to say is... WE CRAVE MORE!!!!  Don't let the community down, this game deserves better than a 3 star rating in steam and if you only did your part in releasing updates more frequently(even if they were minor updates), you would draw much more attention and get the much needed respect for this unfinished game!!!!Dont abandon this game, please...

content:
Posted: January 5, 2016
												I have no idea what the others are talking about, but this game is beautiful, the atmosphere is tense, and although there are only five dinosaurs, the world does seem quite full. My girlfriend loves dinosaurs, so we got this game to play, and I was very skeptical at first, and doubted the content it possessed, ready to demand a refund. After portforwarding so we could do a private game, we were plunged into a canyon, cut by a river. I tried to reach her and immediately, I was greeted by a set of teeth that belonged to a raptor. I got destroyed. Keep in mind this is five mintues in. I tried to go back to my corpse to get my items to then again, be greeted by an abnoxious raptor. I hid in a bush while it looked for me, and I heard the ground being stomped on. I thought "Great. I am f*****" and I was. A T-rex stepped over the bush I was in and looked at the little rapor, and I FIGURED they'd fight to the death. I was wrong. They teamed up and scanned for me together. After waiting for what seemed an eternity, the duo left and we continued our journey. Which ended in us getting trapped by the same T-rex, and we jumped to our deaths. 10/10 I love it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 20, 2016
												After reading all the hateful reviews and contemplating for about a week, I finally broke down and bought this game. I was not dissapointed. People on here complain about not seeing dinos ever and i just gotta say that they straight up could not have played it long enough. You walk straight and if you're not blind then you will see dinos. You dont spawn in with nothing, you get a machete and a gps. There's no team killing unless you're on a pvp server and honestly you shouldn't play pvp right off the bat anyways. Get guns and find an awesome group on a pve server and just have fun. Then maybe go pvp if you want to be a bandit i guess. Me and a group of 4 went on a t rex killing spree right when i started the game up. Couldn't be happier with the community. Happened to find a guy that gave me a .44 and i ended up being able to stay alive forever. Update: Read a few reviews where people said the devs ditched this game. They are wrong. I just wanted to put that out there because that one review stopped me from buying it a week ago. They have a few other priorities (Just Cause 3 and Mad Max) before they can put all their effort in this. They also sent out a survey the middle of december and asked what everyone wanted in the future dlc. Do some research. The games worth the price especially with FREE updated content within the coming year.Pros:-Great Community-Graphics are awesome-gear is not hard to find (NOT AS HARD AS DAYZ)-leveling system allows to buy gear before deployment (gotta be a high enough level but doesnt take long at all)-dinosaurs-nice selection of weapons-pve servers (I personally don't play anything but pve in this)Cons:-only a few types of dinos but they already announced more in upcoming updates so YAY-sometimes you might spawn on a cliff and it's tedious to get down but not impossible-some dinos glitch and dont die, they dont attack either but you cant harvest them for cash and xp (not a big deal)-pvp servers (makes no sense to me when its a hunting game that everything can kill you in)I will not put walking in the cons because if you have ever played dayz then you know true hell with finding loot.I honestly don't know why people give this game bad reviews. Maybe they just can't play survival games?It's in no way linear and completely open world. You can sprint if you simply find the right key binding so don't listen to those excuses. I understand I don't have much play time but trust me when I say it's probably the best dinosaur hunting simulator out there. I own multiple dinosaur shooters and this shot straight to the top after only a few hours. Given that I joined a badass server for my first time, if you have any problems add me and I'd be down to point out a few with great admins that kick pirate players (people that scavenge your dead body for your loot). That might be the only problem with some servers that i know of that can definitely hinder someone from progressing, but it's not that big of a deal. Look at some forums, find a group of chill players and try to make the experience better for yourself. Hopefully this review is helpful. If not. Your loss.8/10 there are a few bugs but not enough to say the game is♥♥♥♥♥

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 27, 2015
												Ok , first thing I need to get out is ignore all these reviews from people who have played around 30 minutes and posted a bad review because lets be honest their opinions worthless to someone looking to invest money and time into a game.Ive played this for about 40+ hours at the time im posting this and the experience has been amazing , un comparable to any other dinosaur games out there due to its realism and its focus on survival/hunting. The game has been "Released" which I think couldve been put back another 5 months of work personally but the dev's are updating this game regularly with new dinosaurs and weapons which all have their own advantages and downsides such as reload time and range which keeps a variety of hunters in the game , all with their own weapons of choice and play style. If you are un familiar with TheHunter dont rush into this too much and make sure you know what type of gameplay you will be thrown into. Fans of TheHunter like myself will find this game amazing , expecially with friends to do anything to survive and eventually gather the gear to start hunting dinosaurs your self.Overall : I recommend this game to every person out there due to a positive and supportive community towards new players and regular communication with the developers.  I see my self playing this for a long time after this and who knows how many hours i will lose when the updates keep rolling in. Good luck!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 18, 2016
												Ok, before I get picky, this is a Hunt simulator. You will have to find prey, but you can and will become the prey too. As another said, it could use some polishing. If they'd polish and add to this game, I'd pay 3 times what I did... but they didn't and I didn't. It is still worth the price and then some for just the animals though. Cons: I wasn't liking the game for the first... 15 minutes as it got boring with nothing to cut with my machete and the landscape graphics... need work... there was a wave breaking a long ways from shore and 15 feet high... and plants/objects are often seen floating, the same tree graphics are used over and over. Then the... I think that noise is supposed to be grasshoppers doing the clicking noise when they fly, it sounds like a glitching object does in other games. Needs work there too. No jumping or swimming was a let down, but wasn't really needed. I did not encounter any game breaking glitches so all that said, not a problem.Pros: Now the up side is, the way these animals act is awesome and to me seems like they put a lot of thought into it. A T-Rex would look at me around a tree like my sisters dog does her snack toy. *I know the tasty snack is in there, but why can't I get it??* haha That said, it sucks cuz you know you are doomed without a better weapon. Then those raptors! A pack of 4 hunted me for 10 minutes. I made a mistake and ran for it. lol Like with dogs, not a good idea. The triceratops is what you'd expect, nice until you get too close or poke one with an arrow. Could use a few more types of animals, especially herbavores. All those carnivores would die of starvation quickly if all they had to eat were triceratops. Also, the t-rex / pack of rasptors ought to go for the bigger prey first. Seems silly to attack me when a perfectly good triceratops is not 10 feet away.Ok so, first game, first life for me went like this: Appear in front of a capsule, look around, try to figure out how to get stuff out of capsule, durr, get stuff, use map piece, play with machete.I then go around tried to cut stuff along the beach... nope, but found some nice shrooms. Hear a noise, look around and see nothing and continue...Hear a louder noise and spot 2 raptors coming toward me. I run for the water... ah crap I can't swim!I get to a nice spot where only one at a time could come at me, machete ready. First comes *dodge slice dodge slice slice slice* & it runs away... I'm at half health now and I get ready for the next! Similar results with dodging and slicing only I have about 20 some percent health. Feeling fairly invincible I follow and find one dead and take a selfie trophie shot... then find the other and accidently made it go away w/o a picture. Then on I go, following shiny chests toward that map location. I avoid another raptor, see a couple triceratops and oh look another chest! *approach*.I get about 25 yards away and I see a fricken T-Rex comming toward me 100 yard away! I hide behind a tree and keep on the opposite side as he comes closer. He turns and looks like he is walking away, but then he turns and spots me! Q_Q We played ring around the tree for about 5 minutes before I got too cocky and took a machete swing at him... he caught my arm. I died. Q_Q

												I have no idea what the others are talking about, but this game is beautiful, the atmosphere is tense, and although there are only five dinosaurs, the world does seem quite full. My girlfriend loves dinosaurs, so we got this game to play, and I was very skeptical at first, and doubted the content it possessed, ready to demand a refund. After portforwarding so we could do a private game, we were plunged into a canyon, cut by a river. I tried to reach her and immediately, I was greeted by a set of teeth that belonged to a raptor. I got destroyed. Keep in mind this is five mintues in. I tried to go back to my corpse to get my items to then again, be greeted by an abnoxious raptor. I hid in a bush while it looked for me, and I heard the ground being stomped on. I thought "Great. I am f*****" and I was. A T-rex stepped over the bush I was in and looked at the little rapor, and I FIGURED they'd fight to the death. I was wrong. They teamed up and scanned for me together. After waiting for what seemed an eternity, the duo left and we continued our journey. Which ended in us getting trapped by the same T-rex, and we jumped to our deaths. 10/10 I love it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 17, 2014
												12/17/2014: So far I'm loving this game. I've played about 6 hours as of writing this and I've played solo as well as with friends. I will say, if you're looking for a terrifying experience, play solo. With the lights off. With the bass on the speakers way up. And put a glass of water next to you.The gameplay feels little clunky and rigid, but it's an early alpha stage of the game and there's only 3 types of dinosaurs at the moment, but for what stage this game is in it looks beautiful, the sound effects are terrifying, and it's not a run and gun once you get gear, but you MUST evade dinosaurs at all times or you're probably going to die. They're clever and violent.Aside from the expected buggy nature of an early alpha game, I would highly recommend this game. 9/10UPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATEUPDATE!UPDATE 3/3/2015: As a full release game, there isn't much that has been added to the game and there's a serious lack of variety in dinosaurs and vegetation. There's a barely existent backstory, no driven purpose, and it feels like it was rushed to release with a promise of more material based on how well the game does AFTER "Full" release. That's a very poor marketing choice and practically screams "Bored, now! Here's this thing we made. Now get bent."The game can't do well if it's left unfinished by community standards, but promising to finis- errr, "add more" to the game if it does well despite that fact is foolish and near-sighted. It cannot do well in its current state and I am thoroughly disappointed in the devs for rushing it to release with so little content.
